original: @14b * // rgya gar skad du /
analyzed: @14b * // rgya gar skad du /
translated: In Sanskrit:

original: pra m'a na sa mutstsh'a ya britti /
analyzed: pra m'a na sa mutstsh'a ya britti /
translated: Pramana-samuccaya-vriti

original: bod skad du /
analyzed: bod skad du /
translated: In Tibetan:

original: tshad ma kun las btus pa'i 'grel pa /
analyzed: tshad ma kun las btus pa'i 'grel pa /
translated: A Commentary on the Compendium of Valid Cognition

original: sangs rgyas la phyag 'tshal lo //üîΩtshad mar gyur pa 'gro la phan par bzhed //
analyzed: sangs rgyas la phyag 'tshal lo // tshad mar gyur pa 'gro la phan par bzhed //
translated: Homage to the Buddha

original: ston pa bde gshegs skyob la phyag 'tshal nas //
analyzed: ston pa bde gshegs skyob la phyag 'tshal nas //
translated: I pay homage to the Teacher, the Sugata, the Protector,üîΩThe one who has become valid, who wishes to benefit beings,üîΩIn order to establish validity,

original: tshad mar sgrub phyir rang gi gzhung kun las //
analyzed: tshad mar sgrub phyir rang gi gzhung kun las //
translated: I collect from all his texts

original: btus te sna tshogs 'thor rnams 'dir gcig bya //
analyzed: btus te sna tshogs 'thor rnams 'dir gcig bya //
translated: And scatter them here in various ways.

original: 'dir yang rab tu byed pa'i dang por rgyu dang 'bras bu phun sum tshogs pas tshad mar gyur pa nyid kyis bcom ldan 'das la bstod pa brjod pa ni gus pa bskyed par bya ba'i don du'o //
analyzed: 'dir yang rab tu byed pa'i dang por rgyu dang 'bras bu phun sum tshogs pas tshad mar gyur pa nyid kyis bcom ldan 'das la bstod pa brjod pa ni gus pa bskyed par bya ba'i don du'o //
translated: Here, at the beginning of the chapter, praising the Blessed One with his perfect cause and effect for being valid is to generate respect.

original: de la rgyu ni bsam pa dang sbyor ba phun sum tshogs pa'o //
analyzed: de la rgyu ni bsam pa dang sbyor ba phun sum tshogs pa'o //
translated: There, the cause is the perfection of intention and application.

original: bsam pa ni 'gro ba la phan par bzhed pa'o //
analyzed: bsam pa ni 'gro ba la phan par bzhed pa'o //
translated: The intention is the wish to benefit beings.

original: sbyor ba ni 'gro ba la bstan ba ston pa'o //
analyzed: sbyor ba ni 'gro ba la bstan ba ston pa'o //
translated: The application is teaching the doctrine to beings.

original: 'bras bu ni rang dang gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu ni rang dang gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa'o //
translated: The result is the perfect fulfillment of one's own and others' goals.üîΩThe perfect fulfillment of one's own goal is the state of a sugata.üîΩThe perfect fulfillment of others' goals is the state of a protector.üîΩThe perfect fulfillment of both goals is the state of a teacher.

original: rang don phun sum tshogs pa ni bde bar gshegs pa nyid kyis te /üîΩdon gsum nye bar blang bar bya'o //üîΩrab tu mdzes pa'i don ni skyes bu gzugs legs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: rang don phun sum tshogs pa ni bde bar gshegs pa nyid kyis te / don gsum nye bar blang bar bya'o // rab tu mdzes pa'i don ni skyes bu gzugs legs pa bzhin no //
translated: The perfect fulfillment of one's own goal is the state of a sugata because it is the state of one who has gone well to bliss.

original: phyir mi ldog pa'i don ni rims nad legs par byang pa bzhin no //üîΩma lus pa'i don ni bum pa legs par gang ba bzhin no //
analyzed: phyir mi ldog pa'i don ni rims nad legs par byang pa bzhin no // ma lus pa'i don ni bum pa legs par gang ba bzhin no //
translated: The perfect fulfillment of others' goals is the state of a protector because it is the state of one who has crossed over and saves others.üîΩThe perfect fulfillment of both goals is the state of a teacher because it is the state of one who teaches the Dharma to those who are to be tamed.

original: don gsum po de yang phyi rol ba'i 'dod chags dang bral ba dang / slob pa dang / mi slob pa rnams las rang don phun sum tshogs pa khyad par du bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don gsum po de yang phyi rol ba'i 'dod chags dang bral ba dang / slob pa dang / mi slob pa rnams las rang don phun sum tshogs pa khyad par du bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The perfect fulfillment of one's own goal is superior to the perfect fulfillment of the goals of non-Buddhists, learners, and nonlearners.

original: gzhan don phun sum tshogs pa ni sgrol ba'i don gyis na skyob pa nyid do //
analyzed: gzhan don phun sum tshogs pa ni sgrol ba'i don gyis na skyob pa nyid do //
translated: The perfect fulfillment of others' goals is the state of a protector because it is the state of one who has crossed over and saves others.

original: de lta bu'i yon tan can gyi ston pa la phyag 'tshal nas /
analyzed: de lta bu'i yon tan can gyi ston pa la phyag 'tshal nas /
translated: Having paid homage to the teacher who has such qualities,

original: tshad ma bsgrub par bya ba'i phyir rang gi rab tu byed pa rigs pa'i sgo la sogs pa rnams las 'dir gcig tu btus te /
analyzed: tshad ma bsgrub par bya ba'i phyir rang gi rab tu byed pa rigs pa'i sgo la sogs pa rnams las 'dir gcig tu btus te /
translated: In order to establish valid cognition, I will here collect into one place the various arguments found in my own treatises, such as the Gate for Entering the Way of Logic, etc.

original: tshad ma kun las btus pa brtsam par bya'o //
analyzed: tshad ma kun las btus pa brtsam par bya'o //
translated: I will compose a Compendium of Valid Cognition.üîΩIn order to refute the valid cognitions of others and in order to proclaim the good qualities of my own valid cognition,

original: gzhan gyi tshad ma dgag par bya ba'i phyir dang / rang gi tshad ma'i yon tan brjod par bya ba'i phyir dang / gang gi phyir gzhal bya rtogs pa ni tshad ma la rag las pa yin pas /
analyzed: gzhan gyi tshad ma dgag par bya ba'i phyir dang / rang gi tshad ma'i yon tan brjod par bya ba'i phyir dang / gang gi phyir gzhal bya rtogs pa ni tshad ma la rag las pa yin pas /
translated: because the understanding of objects of knowledge depends on valid cognition,

original: 'di la yang log par rtogs pa mang bas na'o //üîΩde la / mngon sum dang ni rjes su dpag /
analyzed: 'di la yang log par rtogs pa mang bas na'o // de la / mngon sum dang ni rjes su dpag /
translated: and because there are many misconceptions about this.üîΩWith regard to that, there are only two valid cognitions:

original: tshad ma gnyis kho na'o //
analyzed: tshad ma gnyis kho na'o //
translated: perception and inference.

original: gang gi phyir zhe na /
analyzed: gang gi phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: mtshan nyid gnyis gzhal bya /
analyzed: mtshan nyid gnyis gzhal bya /
translated: Because there are two types of objects of knowledge:

original: rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid dag las gzhan pa'i mtshan nyid gzhal bar bya ba gzhan ni med do //
analyzed: rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid dag las gzhan pa'i mtshan nyid gzhal bar bya ba gzhan ni med do //
translated: particulars and universals. There is no other object of knowledge apart from these two.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid kyi yul can ni mngon sum @15a * //
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid kyi yul can ni mngon sum @15a * //
translated: Perception has particulars as its object.

original: la ; spyi'i mtshan nyid kyi yul can ni rjes su dpag pa'o zhes shes pa'o //
analyzed: la ; spyi'i mtshan nyid kyi yul can ni rjes su dpag pa'o zhes shes pa'o //
translated: The subject that has a universal as its object is inference.

original: gal te 'di mi rtag ces bya ba la sogs pa'i rnam pas kha dog la sogs pa 'dzin pa dang / lan cig ma yin pa 'dzin pa de ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: gal te 'di mi rtag ces bya ba la sogs pa'i rnam pas kha dog la sogs pa 'dzin pa dang / lan cig ma yin pa 'dzin pa de ji ltar zhe na /
translated: If it is the apprehension of color, etc. in the aspect of impermanence, etc., and if it is the apprehension of that more than once, how is that?

original: de ltar 'dzin pa ni yod mod kyi 'on kyang gzhal bya de'i rab sbyor bas /
analyzed: de ltar 'dzin pa ni yod mod kyi 'on kyang gzhal bya de'i rab sbyor bas /
translated: Although there is such an apprehension, still, because of the application of that object of comprehension,

original: de la rab sbyor tshad ma gzhan ma byin /
analyzed: de la rab sbyor tshad ma gzhan ma byin /
translated: the other valid cognition is not applied to that.

original: rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid tha dad du ma byas pa dang kha dog nyid dag las kha dog la sogs pa bzung nas spyi'i mtshan nyid ni kha dog la sogs pa mi rtag go zhes mi rtag pa nyid la sogs par yid kyis rab tu sbyor bar byed
analyzed: rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid tha dad du ma byas pa dang kha dog nyid dag las kha dog la sogs pa bzung nas spyi'i mtshan nyid ni kha dog la sogs pa mi rtag go zhes mi rtag pa nyid la sogs par yid kyis rab tu sbyor bar byed
translated: Having apprehended color, etc. without differentiating the particular and universal characteristics, one mentally applies impermanence, etc. to the universal characteristic, such as ‚Äúcolor, etc. is impermanent.‚Äù

original: do// de'i phyir tshad ma gzhan ma yin no //
analyzed: do// de'i phyir tshad ma gzhan ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is not another valid cognition.

original: yang yang shes pa'ang ma yin te /
analyzed: yang yang shes pa'ang ma yin te /
translated: It is also not the cognition of that again and again.

original: gang lan cig ma yin par don de nyid so sor ngo shes pa yod mod /
analyzed: gang lan cig ma yin par don de nyid so sor ngo shes pa yod mod /
translated: Although there is the recognition of that very object again and again,

original: de ltar na yang tshad ma gzhan ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na yang tshad ma gzhan ni ma yin no //
translated: But it is not a valid cognition.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: thug pa med 'gyur /
analyzed: thug pa med 'gyur /
translated: Because there would be an infinite regress.

original: gal te shes pa thams cad tshad ma nyid du 'dod pa de lta na ni tshad ma thug pa med par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te shes pa thams cad tshad ma nyid du 'dod pa de lta na ni tshad ma thug pa med par 'gyur te /
translated: If you accept that all consciousnesses are valid cognitions, then there would be an infinite regress of valid cognitions.

original: dran sogs bzhin /
analyzed: dran sogs bzhin /
translated: Because they are like memory and so on.

original: dran pa ni dran pa nyid do //
analyzed: dran pa ni dran pa nyid do //
translated: Memory is memory itself.

original: dper na dran pa dang / 'dod pa dang / zhe sdang la sogs pa sngar rtogs pa'i don la tshad ma gzhan ma yin pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na dran pa dang / 'dod pa dang / zhe sdang la sogs pa sngar rtogs pa'i don la tshad ma gzhan ma yin pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, memory, desire, hatred, and so on are not valid cognitions in regard to an object that has already been realized.üîΩWith regard to that,

original: de la / mngon sum rtog dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: de la / mngon sum rtog dang bral ba'o //
translated: direct perception is free from conceptuality.

original: shes pa gang la rtog pa med pa de mngon sum mo //
analyzed: shes pa gang la rtog pa med pa de mngon sum mo //
translated: A consciousness that is free from conceptuality is direct perception.

original: rtog pa zhes bya ba 'di ji lta bu zhig yin zhe na /
analyzed: rtog pa zhes bya ba 'di ji lta bu zhig yin zhe na /
translated: What is this thing called conceptuality?

original: ming dang rigs sogs su sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: ming dang rigs sogs su sbyor ba'o //
translated: It is the application of names, types, and so on.

original: 'dod rgyal ba'i sgra rnams la ming gi khyad par du byas nas don rjod par byed de /
analyzed: 'dod rgyal ba'i sgra rnams la ming gi khyad par du byas nas don rjod par byed de /
translated: One uses the particular name of a thing that is a product of one's own desire and expresses the meaning.

original: lha sbyin zhes bya ba dang / rigs kyi sgra rnams la ci ste ba lang zhes bya ba dang / yon tan gyi sgra rnams la yon tan gyis te dkar po zhes bya ba dang / bya ba'i sgra rnams la bya ba'i sgo nas te 'tshed pa zhes bya ba dang /
analyzed: lha sbyin zhes bya ba dang / rigs kyi sgra rnams la ci ste ba lang zhes bya ba dang / yon tan gyi sgra rnams la yon tan gyis te dkar po zhes bya ba dang / bya ba'i sgra rnams la bya ba'i sgo nas te 'tshed pa zhes bya ba dang /
translated: The word cow is applied to the class of cows, the word Devadatta to the person Devadatta, the word ox to the class of oxen, the word son to the person Devadatta, the word Brahmin to the class of Brahmins, the word quality to the class of qualities, the word white to the quality white, the word cook to the class of cooks, the word cook to the action of cooking, the word stick to the class of sticks, the word horn to the class of horns.

original: rdzas kyi sgra rnams la rdzas kyi sgo nas te /üîΩdbyug pa can rva can zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: rdzas kyi sgra rnams la rdzas kyi sgo nas te / dbyug pa can rva can zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
translated: The word substance is applied to the class of substances.üîΩ The word stick-holder is applied to the person Devadatta, the word horned to the class of oxen.

original: 'di la kha cig na re 'brel pa khyad par du byas pa'i sgra yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: 'di la kha cig na re 'brel pa khyad par du byas pa'i sgra yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: Some say that the word is applied by the relation of the qualifier and the qualified.

original: gzhan dag na don gyis stong pa'i sgra 'ba' zhig gis don rnams khyad par du byas shing brjod do zhes 'dod do //
analyzed: gzhan dag na don gyis stong pa'i sgra 'ba' zhig gis don rnams khyad par du byas shing brjod do zhes 'dod do //
translated: Others say that the word is applied by the relation of the qualified and the qualifier, even though the word is empty of meaning.

original: gang la rtog pa de dag med pa de mngon sum mo //
analyzed: gang la rtog pa de dag med pa de mngon sum mo //
translated: That which is free from these conceptual thoughts is perception.

original: ci gang gi phyir gnyis la brten nas /
analyzed: ci gang gi phyir gnyis la brten nas /
translated: Why is it so?

original: skyed pa'i rnam par shes pa'i dbang po la brten pa'o zhes brjod kyi yul la brten pa zhes ci nas yin @15b zhe na /
analyzed: skyed pa'i rnam par shes pa'i dbang po la brten pa'o zhes brjod kyi yul la brten pa zhes ci nas yin @15b zhe na /
translated: Why is it not said that the object is the basis?

original: thun mong yin pa'i rgyu'i phyir //
analyzed: thun mong yin pa'i rgyu'i phyir //
translated: Because the object is common to many.

original: de yi tha snyad dbang po las //
analyzed: de yi tha snyad dbang po las //
translated: The designation of the object is made in relation to the sense faculty,

original: yul gzugs la sogs pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: yul gzugs la sogs pa ni ma yin no //
translated: not in relation to the object, form, etc.

original: 'di ltar yul ni rgyud gzhan gyi yid kyi rnam par shes pa dang yang thun mong yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar yul ni rgyud gzhan gyi yid kyi rnam par shes pa dang yang thun mong yin no //
translated: For the object is common to the mental consciousness of other streams.

original: thun mong ma yin pa la tha snyad byed pa yang mthong ste /
analyzed: thun mong ma yin pa la tha snyad byed pa yang mthong ste /
translated: We also see that there is designation in relation to what is not common.

original: dper na rnga'i sgra nas kyi myu gu zhes pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na rnga'i sgra nas kyi myu gu zhes pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, the sound of a drum is called the sprout of rice.

original: de lta bas na mngon sum rtog pa dang bral bar 'thad pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na mngon sum rtog pa dang bral bar 'thad pa yin no //
translated: Thus, it is correct that direct perception is free from conceptual thought.

original: chos mngon pa las kyang /
analyzed: chos mngon pa las kyang /
translated: In the Abhidharma, it is said:

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa dang ldan pas sngon po shes kyi sngon po'o snyam du ni ma yin no //
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa dang ldan pas sngon po shes kyi sngon po'o snyam du ni ma yin no //
translated: One knows blue through visual consciousness, but one does not think, ‚ÄúThis is blue.‚Äù

original: don la don du 'du shes kyi don la chos su 'du shes pa ni ma yin no zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: don la don du 'du shes kyi don la chos su 'du shes pa ni ma yin no zhes gsungs so //
translated: One has the idea of an object in relation to the object, but one does not have the idea of a dharma.

original: gal te de gcig tu mi rtog na rnam par shes pa lnga po de 'dus pa la dmigs pa ji ltar yin /üîΩgang yang skye mched kyi rang gi mtshan nyid la so so rang gi mtshan nyid kyi yul can yin gyi /
analyzed: gal te de gcig tu mi rtog na rnam par shes pa lnga po de 'dus pa la dmigs pa ji ltar yin / gang yang skye mched kyi rang gi mtshan nyid la so so rang gi mtshan nyid kyi yul can yin gyi /
translated: If they do not conceive of them as one, how can the five consciousnesses be said to have a composite as their object?üîΩAlso, how can it be said that the sense bases have as their object the particular inherent characteristics of their objects,

original: rdzas kyi rang gi mtshan nyid la ni ma yin no zhes kyang ji ltar gsungs she na /
analyzed: rdzas kyi rang gi mtshan nyid la ni ma yin no zhes kyang ji ltar gsungs she na /
translated: but that they do not have as their object the substantial inherent characteristics of their objects?

original: der don du mas bskyed pa'i phyir //
analyzed: der don du mas bskyed pa'i phyir //
translated: Because they are generated by many objects.

original: rang don spyi yi spyod yul can //
analyzed: rang don spyi yi spyod yul can //
translated: They have as their domain the general object of their own object.

original: de rdzas du mas bskyed par bya ba'i phyir na rang gi skye mched la spyi'i spyod yul can zhes brjod kyi /
analyzed: de rdzas du mas bskyed par bya ba'i phyir na rang gi skye mched la spyi'i spyod yul can zhes brjod kyi /
translated: Because they are generated by many substances, they are said to have as their domain the general object of their own object.

original: tha dad pa la tha mi dad par rtogs pa las ni ma yin no //
analyzed: tha dad pa la tha mi dad par rtogs pa las ni ma yin no //
translated: They are not said to have as their domain the general object of their own object because they apprehend what is different as nondifferent.

original: don 'di nyid smras pa /üîΩdu ma'i ngo bo'i chos can ni //
analyzed: don 'di nyid smras pa / du ma'i ngo bo'i chos can ni //
translated: This very point is stated in the following:üîΩIt is not possible for a consciousness

original: dbang po las rtogs srid ma yin//üîΩrang rang rig bya tha snyad kyis //
analyzed: dbang po las rtogs srid ma yin// rang rang rig bya tha snyad kyis //
translated: to cognize a phenomenon that has a multiple nature through a sense faculty.

original: bstan bya min na dbang po'i yul //
analyzed: bstan bya min na dbang po'i yul //
translated: If it is not taught that the object of consciousness is to be known by itself,üîΩthen it is an object of the sense faculties.

original: de ltar na re zhig dbang po lnga las skyes pa'i mngon sum gyi shes pa rtog pa med pa yin yang gzhan gyi 'dod pa la brten nas 'dir khyad par byas pa ste /
analyzed: de ltar na re zhig dbang po lnga las skyes pa'i mngon sum gyi shes pa rtog pa med pa yin yang gzhan gyi 'dod pa la brten nas 'dir khyad par byas pa ste /
translated: Thus, although the non-conceptual cognitions that arise from the five sense faculties are direct perception, they are distinguished here in dependence on the assertions of others.

original: de dag ni thams cad du rtog pa med pa 'ba' zhig go //üîΩyid kyang don dang chags la sogs //
analyzed: de dag ni thams cad du rtog pa med pa 'ba' zhig go // yid kyang don dang chags la sogs //
translated: They are all non-conceptual.

original: rang rig rtog pa med pa yin //
analyzed: rang rig rtog pa med pa yin //
translated: The mind also is self-knowing and non-conceptual.

original: yid kyang yul gzugs la sogs pa la dmigs shing nyams su myong ba'i rnam pas 'jug pa ste /
analyzed: yid kyang yul gzugs la sogs pa la dmigs shing nyams su myong ba'i rnam pas 'jug pa ste /
translated: The mind also engages its object, form and so on, through the aspect of experience.

original: rtog pa med pa 'ba' zhig go //üîΩ'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug dang / bde ba dang sdug bsngal la sogs pa ni dbang po la mi ltos pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rtog pa med pa 'ba' zhig go // 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug dang / bde ba dang sdug bsngal la sogs pa ni dbang po la mi ltos pa'i phyir /
translated: It is only non-conceptual.

original: rang rig pa'i mngon sum mo //
analyzed: rang rig pa'i mngon sum mo //
translated: Desire, hatred, ignorance, pleasure, pain, and so on are self-knowing direct perception because they do not rely on the sense faculties.

original: de bzhin du /üîΩrnal 'byor rnams kyi bla ma yis //
analyzed: de bzhin du / rnal 'byor rnams kyi bla ma yis //
translated: Similarly,üîΩyogis see only the mere object

original: bstan don tha dad tsam zhig mthong //
analyzed: bstan don tha dad tsam zhig mthong //
translated: taught by their gurus.

original: rnal 'byor ba rnams kyis kyang lung las rnam par rtog pa dang ma 'dres pa'i don tsam mthong ba ni mngon sum mo //üîΩre zhig gal te 'dod chags la @16a * //
analyzed: rnal 'byor ba rnams kyis kyang lung las rnam par rtog pa dang ma 'dres pa'i don tsam mthong ba ni mngon sum mo // re zhig gal te 'dod chags la @16a * //
translated: The yogis and yoginis also see the mere object that is not mixed with conceptuality through scripture. That is direct perception.

original: sogs pa'i rang rig pa mngon sum yin na rtog pa'i shes pa yang mngon sum du 'gyur ro zhen /
analyzed: sogs pa'i rang rig pa mngon sum yin na rtog pa'i shes pa yang mngon sum du 'gyur ro zhen /
translated: If the self-awareness of attachment and so on is direct perception, then the conceptual consciousness would also be direct perception.

original: de ni bden te /
analyzed: de ni bden te /
translated: That is true.

original: rtog pa'ang rang rig nyid du 'dod //
analyzed: rtog pa'ang rang rig nyid du 'dod //
translated: It is asserted that conceptual consciousnesses are also self-awareness,

original: don la ma yin de rtog phyir //
analyzed: don la ma yin de rtog phyir //
translated: but not with regard to the object, because it is conceptual.

original: de yul la ni 'dod chags la sogs pa nyid bzhin du mngon sum ma yin yang rang rig go zhes bya ba'i skyon ni med do //
analyzed: de yul la ni 'dod chags la sogs pa nyid bzhin du mngon sum ma yin yang rang rig go zhes bya ba'i skyon ni med do //
translated: Although it is not direct perception with regard to the object, like attachment and so on, there is no fault in saying that it is self-awareness.

original: de dag ni mngon sum mo //
analyzed: de dag ni mngon sum mo //
translated: Those are direct perception.üîΩConceptual, obscured, mental consciousness,

original: 'khrul dang kun rdzob yid shes dang // rjes dpag rjes su dpag las byung //
analyzed: 'khrul dang kun rdzob yid shes dang // rjes dpag rjes su dpag las byung //
translated: inference, and what arises from inference,

original: dran dang mngon 'dod ces bya ba //
analyzed: dran dang mngon 'dod ces bya ba //
translated: memory, and what is called desire

original: mngon sum ltar snang rab rib bcas //
analyzed: mngon sum ltar snang rab rib bcas //
translated: are called direct perception but are obscured by cataracts.

original: re zhig 'khrul pa'i shes pa ni smig rgyu la sogs pa la chu la sogs par rtog pa'i phyir mngon sum ltar snang ba'o //
analyzed: re zhig 'khrul pa'i shes pa ni smig rgyu la sogs pa la chu la sogs par rtog pa'i phyir mngon sum ltar snang ba'o //
translated: First, a mistaken consciousness is like a direct perception because it conceives a mirage, etc. to be water, etc.

original: kun rdzob tu yod pa ni don bzhin sgro 'dogs pas na de'i ngo bor brtags nas 'jug pa'i phyir mngon sum ltar snang ba'o //
analyzed: kun rdzob tu yod pa ni don bzhin sgro 'dogs pas na de'i ngo bor brtags nas 'jug pa'i phyir mngon sum ltar snang ba'o //
translated: It is like a direct perception because it engages by conceiving the entity of an object that is superimposed as existing conventionally.

original: rjes su dpag pa dang de'i 'bras bu la sogs pa'i shes pa ni sngar nyams su myong myong ba la rtog pa'i phyir mngon sum ma yin no //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa dang de'i 'bras bu la sogs pa'i shes pa ni sngar nyams su myong myong ba la rtog pa'i phyir mngon sum ma yin no //
translated: Inference and the consciousness that is its result, etc. are not direct perception because they conceive what was previously experienced.üîΩHere, it is said:

original: 'dir yang / bya dang bcas par rtogs pa'i phyir //
analyzed: 'dir yang / bya dang bcas par rtogs pa'i phyir //
translated: Because it is realized to have an object,

original: tshad ma'i 'bras bu nyid du 'dod //
analyzed: tshad ma'i 'bras bu nyid du 'dod //
translated: it is asserted to be the result of valid knowledge.

original: 'di la phyi rol pa rnams kyi bzhin du tshad ma las 'bras bu don gzhan du 'gyur ba ni med kyi /üîΩ'bras bur gyur pa'i shes pa de nyid yul gyi rnam pa can du skyes pa dang bya ba dang bcas par rtogs pa de nye bar blangs nas /
analyzed: 'di la phyi rol pa rnams kyi bzhin du tshad ma las 'bras bu don gzhan du 'gyur ba ni med kyi / 'bras bur gyur pa'i shes pa de nyid yul gyi rnam pa can du skyes pa dang bya ba dang bcas par rtogs pa de nye bar blangs nas /
translated: Unlike the non-Buddhist schools, the result is not a different object from the valid knowledge.üîΩThe consciousness that is the result is born with the aspect of the object and is realized to have an object.

original: tshad ma nyid du 'dod pa ste /
analyzed: tshad ma nyid du 'dod pa ste /
translated: It is accepted to be valid knowledge because it is taken to be the result.

original: bya ba med pa'ang ma yin no //
analyzed: bya ba med pa'ang ma yin no //
translated: Nor is it without activity.

original: dper na 'bras bu rgyu dang rjes su mthun par skyes pa la rgyu'i gzugs 'dzin zhes brjod do //
analyzed: dper na 'bras bu rgyu dang rjes su mthun par skyes pa la rgyu'i gzugs 'dzin zhes brjod do //
translated: For example, when an effect is produced in accordance with its cause, it is said that the effect ‚Äútakes on the form of the cause.‚Äù

original: bya ba med par yang ma yin pa de bzhin du 'dir yang yin no //
analyzed: bya ba med par yang ma yin pa de bzhin du 'dir yang yin no //
translated: And so it is here as well.

original: rang rig la yang 'dir 'bras bu //
analyzed: rang rig la yang 'dir 'bras bu //
translated: And here, self-awareness is the effect.

original: shes pa ni snang ba gnyis las skyes te rang gi snang ba dang yul gyi snang ba'o //
analyzed: shes pa ni snang ba gnyis las skyes te rang gi snang ba dang yul gyi snang ba'o //
translated: Consciousness is produced from two appearances: the appearance of itself and the appearance of the object.

original: snang ba de gnyis las gang dang rig pa de ni 'bras bur 'gyur ro //
analyzed: snang ba de gnyis las gang dang rig pa de ni 'bras bur 'gyur ro //
translated: From among those two appearances, the awareness of the object is the effect.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de yi ngo bo las don nges /
analyzed: de yi ngo bo las don nges /
translated: Because the object is ascertained from the nature of that.

original: gang gi tshe shes pa don gyi yul dang bcas pa'i de'i tshe /
analyzed: gang gi tshe shes pa don gyi yul dang bcas pa'i de'i tshe /
translated: When consciousness is together with the object,

original: de dang rjes su mthun pa'i rang rig pa 'dod pa'am mi 'dod pa'i don rtogs par byed do //
analyzed: de dang rjes su mthun pa'i rang rig pa 'dod pa'am mi 'dod pa'i don rtogs par byed do //
translated: then it is the self-awareness that is in accordance with that that ascertains the object, whether it is desired or not.

original: gang gi tshe phyi rol gyi don 'ba' zhig gzhal byar byed pa de'i tshe ni /
analyzed: gang gi tshe phyi rol gyi don 'ba' zhig gzhal byar byed pa de'i tshe ni /
translated: When only the external object is taken to be the object of comprehension,üîΩthen this appearance of the object

original: yul gyi snang ba 'di nyid 'di //
analyzed: yul gyi snang ba 'di nyid 'di //
translated: is the object of comprehension.

original: tshad ma de'i tshe ni shes pa rang rig pa yin yang ltos pa med pa'i rang gi ngo bo'i don gyis snang ba 'di tshad ma'o //
analyzed: tshad ma de'i tshe ni shes pa rang rig pa yin yang ltos pa med pa'i rang gi ngo bo'i don gyis snang ba 'di tshad ma'o //
translated: At that time, although the consciousness is reflexive awareness, the appearance of the object by the power of its own nature, without relying on anything else, is valid knowledge.

original: gang gi phyir zhe na /
analyzed: gang gi phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: don de yis 'jal bar byed /
analyzed: don de yis 'jal bar byed /
translated: Because it comprehends the object.

original: ji lta ji ltar don gyi rnam pa dkar po dang dkar po ma yin pa la sogs pa nyid shes pa @16b la snang ba na de dang de'i ngo bo yul dang bcas par 'jal bar byed de /
analyzed: ji lta ji ltar don gyi rnam pa dkar po dang dkar po ma yin pa la sogs pa nyid shes pa @16b la snang ba na de dang de'i ngo bo yul dang bcas par 'jal bar byed de /
translated: In whatever way the aspect of the object, such as white or not white, appears to consciousness, it comprehends the object that has that nature.

original: de lta rnam pa du ma rig pa'i shes pa nye bar blangs pa de lta de ltar tshad ma dang gzhal bya nyid du nye bar 'dogs pa yin te /
analyzed: de lta rnam pa du ma rig pa'i shes pa nye bar blangs pa de lta de ltar tshad ma dang gzhal bya nyid du nye bar 'dogs pa yin te /
translated: In that way, the consciousness that apprehends the many aspects is posited as valid knowledge and the object is posited as the object of comprehension.

original: chos thams cad ni bya ba dang bral ba yin pas na'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad ni bya ba dang bral ba yin pas na'o //
translated: Because all phenomena are devoid of action.

original: de nyid smras pa /
analyzed: de nyid smras pa /
translated: That is stated:

original: gang tshe rnam pa de gzhal bya //
analyzed: gang tshe rnam pa de gzhal bya //
translated: When the aspect is the object of comprehension,

original: tshad ma dang de'i 'bras bu ni //
analyzed: tshad ma dang de'i 'bras bu ni //
translated: valid knowledge and its result

original: 'dzin rnams rigs pa de yi phyir //
analyzed: 'dzin rnams rigs pa de yi phyir //
translated: are the apprehender. For that reason,

original: de gsum tha dad du ma byas //
analyzed: de gsum tha dad du ma byas //
translated: those three are not differentiated.

original: ci ste shes pa tshul gnyis so //
analyzed: ci ste shes pa tshul gnyis so //
translated: If it is said that consciousness has two modes,

original: zhes ji ltar rtogs par bya zhe na /
analyzed: zhes ji ltar rtogs par bya zhe na /
translated: How is this to be understood?

original: yul shes pa dang de'i shes pa'o //
analyzed: yul shes pa dang de'i shes pa'o //
translated: The object, the consciousness, and the consciousness of that.

original: dbye bas blo yi tshul gnyis ni //
analyzed: dbye bas blo yi tshul gnyis ni //
translated: The two modes of cognition are distinguished

original: yul ni gzugs la sogs pa ste gang gis de shes pa ni don dang rang snang ba'o //
analyzed: yul ni gzugs la sogs pa ste gang gis de shes pa ni don dang rang snang ba'o //
translated: The object is form and so on. That which cognizes it is the object-appearance and the self-appearance.

original: yul shes pa ni gang yul dang rjes su mthun pa'i shes pa ste /
analyzed: yul shes pa ni gang yul dang rjes su mthun pa'i shes pa ste /
translated: The consciousness of the object is the consciousness that accords with the object.

original: shes pa ste snang ba dang / rang snang ba'o //
analyzed: shes pa ste snang ba dang / rang snang ba'o //
translated: The consciousness of that is the appearance and the self-appearance.

original: de ltar ma yin te /
analyzed: de ltar ma yin te /
translated: It is not like that.

original: gal te gzugs nyid rang shes pa'am rang gi ngo bor 'gyur ba ni zhes pa yang yul shes pa dang khyad par med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te gzugs nyid rang shes pa'am rang gi ngo bor 'gyur ba ni zhes pa yang yul shes pa dang khyad par med par 'gyur ro //
translated: If form itself were the consciousness or its own nature, then there would be no difference between the object-consciousness and the consciousness of that.

original: phyis rjes la skye ba'i shes pa la yang sngar ring du 'das pa'i yul snang bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: phyis rjes la skye ba'i shes pa la yang sngar ring du 'das pa'i yul snang bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: Also, in the subsequent consciousness that arises later, the object that has long passed would not appear.

original: gang gi phyir zhe na /
analyzed: gang gi phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de yul ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de yul ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not the object.

original: de'i phyir shes pa la tshul gnyis yod par grub bo //
analyzed: de'i phyir shes pa la tshul gnyis yod par grub bo //
translated: Therefore, it is established that consciousness has two modes.

original: dus phyis dran pa las kyang ste /
analyzed: dus phyis dran pa las kyang ste /
translated: Also from memory at a later time.

original: tshul gnyis nyid do zhes 'brel to //
analyzed: tshul gnyis nyid do zhes 'brel to //
translated: The two modes themselves.

original: gang gi phyir yul gzhan du shes pa la yang dus phyis myong ba'i dran pa skye ste /
analyzed: gang gi phyir yul gzhan du shes pa la yang dus phyis myong ba'i dran pa skye ste /
translated: Because memory of the experience of consciousness at a later time arises.

original: de'i phyir yang shes pa'i tshul gnyis nyid du grub pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir yang shes pa'i tshul gnyis nyid du grub pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is established that consciousness has two modes.

original: rang rig pa nyid du yang ngo //
analyzed: rang rig pa nyid du yang ngo //
translated: It is reflexive awareness.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: 'dir ma myong ba med phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dir ma myong ba med phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no experience of it by another.

original: nyams su ma myong bar don mthong ba'i dran pa ni med do //
analyzed: nyams su ma myong bar don mthong ba'i dran pa ni med do //
translated: There is no memory of seeing an object without experiencing it.

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i dran pa bzhin no //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i dran pa bzhin no //
translated: It is like the memory of form and so on.

original: ci ste gzugs la sogs pa bzhin du yang shes pa gzhan gyis myong ba yin no zhe na /
analyzed: ci ste gzugs la sogs pa bzhin du yang shes pa gzhan gyis myong ba yin no zhe na /
translated: But if, like form and so on, it is experienced by another consciousness,

original: de yang rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de yang rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: that is also illogical.üîΩBecause,

original: gang phyir / shes pa gzhan gyis nyams myong na //
analyzed: gang phyir / shes pa gzhan gyis nyams myong na //
translated: If it is experienced by another consciousness,

original: thug med / thug pa med pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: thug med / thug pa med pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: There would be an infinite regress.

original: shes pa bzhin gyis myong bar byed na'o //
analyzed: shes pa bzhin gyis myong bar byed na'o //
translated: If it is experienced by another consciousness, there would be an infinite regress.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How so?

original: de la'ang dran pa ste /
analyzed: de la'ang dran pa ste /
translated: Because there would be memory of it.

original: shes pa gzhan gyis shes pa de nyams su myong bar byed na /
analyzed: shes pa gzhan gyis shes pa de nyams su myong bar byed na /
translated: If that consciousness were experienced by another consciousness,üîΩthen that other consciousness would have to be experienced by another consciousness, and so on.

original: de la yang phyis kyi dran pa mthong dgos pas so //
analyzed: de la yang phyis kyi dran pa mthong dgos pas so //
translated: and that memory must be seen by a subsequent cognition.

original: des na de la yang shes pa gzhan gyis nyams su myong ba yin na ni thug pa med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na de la yang shes pa gzhan gyis nyams su myong ba yin na ni thug pa med par 'gyur ro //
translated: If it is experienced by another cognition, there is an infinite regress.

original: de bzhin yul gzhan la 'pho ba //
analyzed: de bzhin yul gzhan la 'pho ba //
translated: And when it moves to another object,

original: med 'gyur de yang mthong ba nyid //
analyzed: med 'gyur de yang mthong ba nyid //
translated: it is not seen.

original: de'i phyir gdon mi za @17a * //
analyzed: de'i phyir gdon mi za @17a * //
translated: Therefore, it is not to be doubted

original: bar rang rig pa'i shes pa khas blang bar bya'o //
analyzed: bar rang rig pa'i shes pa khas blang bar bya'o //
translated: that reflexive awareness must be accepted.

original: de yang 'bras bu nyid du gnas par grub /
analyzed: de yang 'bras bu nyid du gnas par grub /
translated: And it is established that it exists as the effect.

original: de ltar na mngon sum du rtogs pa dang bral ba yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na mngon sum du rtogs pa dang bral ba yin no //
translated: Thus, it is free from being realized by direct perception.

original: de'i rjes su gzhan gyis byas pa'i mngon sum brtag par bya ste /
analyzed: de'i rjes su gzhan gyis byas pa'i mngon sum brtag par bya ste /
translated: After that, the direct perception created by another should be examined.

original: rtsod sgrub slob dpon gyis ma yin //
analyzed: rtsod sgrub slob dpon gyis ma yin //
translated: It is not the master of debate.

original: nges par snying po med par dgongs //
analyzed: nges par snying po med par dgongs //
translated: It is certainly considered to be without essence.

original: gzhan du cha shas su gsung 'gyur //
analyzed: gzhan du cha shas su gsung 'gyur //
translated: Otherwise, it would be spoken of in part.

original: des na kho bos brtag par bya'o //
analyzed: des na kho bos brtag par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, I will examine it.

original: rtsod pa bsgrub pa ni slob dpon dbyig gnyen gyi ma yin no //
analyzed: rtsod pa bsgrub pa ni slob dpon dbyig gnyen gyi ma yin no //
translated: The establishment of debate is not by the master Vasubandhu.

original: gang gi phyir rtsod pa sgrub pa de la ni slob dpon gyis snying po med par dgongs pa ste /
analyzed: gang gi phyir rtsod pa sgrub pa de la ni slob dpon gyis snying po med par dgongs pa ste /
translated: Because the master thinks that the proof of the thesis is pointless.

original: de lta ma yin na cha shas can du mdzad par 'gyur ro//
analyzed: de lta ma yin na cha shas can du mdzad par 'gyur ro//
translated: The Master [Nagarjuna] intended the word essence to refer to the proof of the thesis, because otherwise it would be a part.

original: des na kho bos kyang tshad ma la sogs pa cung zad cig brtag par bya'o //
analyzed: des na kho bos kyang tshad ma la sogs pa cung zad cig brtag par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, I will also investigate a little the theory of valid cognitions.

original: don de las skyes pa'i rnam shes //
analyzed: don de las skyes pa'i rnam shes //
translated: The consciousness that arises from that object

original: mngon sum yin zhes bya ba 'dir //
analyzed: mngon sum yin zhes bya ba 'dir //
translated: is called perception.

original: kun la don 'di zhes brjod na //
analyzed: kun la don 'di zhes brjod na //
translated: If one says that object in this case,

original: gang de de 'ba' zhig las min //
analyzed: gang de de 'ba' zhig las min //
translated: it is not just that alone.

original: gal te la de zhes bya ba 'dis rkyen kun brjod pa yin na ni shes pa gang yul gang la skyes pa de'i tha snyad du bya'i /
analyzed: gal te la de zhes bya ba 'dis rkyen kun brjod pa yin na ni shes pa gang yul gang la skyes pa de'i tha snyad du bya'i /
translated: If this that refers to all the conditions, then the convention should be made according to the object from which any consciousness arises.

original: de 'ba' zhig las ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de 'ba' zhig las ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not just that alone.

original: dmigs pa'i rkyen 'ba' zhig las shes pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: dmigs pa'i rkyen 'ba' zhig las shes pa ni ma yin no //
translated: Consciousness does not arise from the objective condition alone.

original: sems dang sems las byung ba rnams gzhi las skye ba'o zhes grub pa'i mtha' las 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems dang sems las byung ba rnams gzhi las skye ba'o zhes grub pa'i mtha' las 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is stated in the tenets that mind and mental factors arise from the basis.üîΩIf it is said that it is the object,

original: dmigs pa'o zhe na dran sogs kyi //
analyzed: dmigs pa'o zhe na dran sogs kyi //
translated: then memory and so on would not be perception.

original: shes pa'ang gzhan la ltos ma yin //
analyzed: shes pa'ang gzhan la ltos ma yin //
translated: Nor does cognition depend on anything else.

original: gal te don de las zhes pa 'dis yul tsam yin na ni dran pa dang / rjes su dpag pa dang mngon par 'dod pa la sogs pa'i shes pa yang dmigs par bya ba gzhan la mi ltos te /
analyzed: gal te don de las zhes pa 'dis yul tsam yin na ni dran pa dang / rjes su dpag pa dang mngon par 'dod pa la sogs pa'i shes pa yang dmigs par bya ba gzhan la mi ltos te /
translated: If the object is the mere object, then memory, inference, desire, etc., do not depend on another object of observation.

original: dud pa la sogs pa dmigs nas me la sogs pa'i shes pa skye ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: dud pa la sogs pa dmigs nas me la sogs pa'i shes pa skye ba ni ma yin no //
translated: For example, the cognition of fire, etc., does not arise from observing smoke, etc.

original: gzugs la sogs pa nyid la dmigs pa don du brjod par bya grang na /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa nyid la dmigs pa don du brjod par bya grang na /
translated: If the object is form, etc., then it should be said that the object is the mere object.

original: ci shes pa skye ba de ltar snang ba de la de bzhin du dmigs nas skye ba yin nam /
analyzed: ci shes pa skye ba de ltar snang ba de la de bzhin du dmigs nas skye ba yin nam /
translated: Is the arising of cognition in that way, appearing as it does, produced by observing it in that way?

original: de ste gzhan du snang du zin kyang ji ltar yod pa'i de rgyur 'gyur ba yin grang /
analyzed: de ste gzhan du snang du zin kyang ji ltar yod pa'i de rgyur 'gyur ba yin grang /
translated: Or, even if it appears otherwise, how could it be the cause of what exists as it does?

original: de las cir 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: de las cir 'gyur zhe na /
translated: What follows from that?

original: gal te ji lta ba de las shes pa skye na ni de ltar na bsags pa la dmigs pa yin pa'i phyir lnga po kun rdzob par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te ji lta ba de las shes pa skye na ni de ltar na bsags pa la dmigs pa yin pa'i phyir lnga po kun rdzob par 'gyur te /
translated: If cognition arises from what exists as it does, then, because it observes the accumulation, all five would be conventional,

original: de nyid la dmigs pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de nyid la dmigs pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it observes that alone.

original: sngon po la sogs par snang ba'i shes pa la don de las skyes pa'i shes pa mngon sum du 'gyur ro zhes 'dod pa de lta na ni tshogs la de dag la khas blangs pa bden yang yod pa'i rdzas @17b kyi rnam pa nyid thob ste /
analyzed: sngon po la sogs par snang ba'i shes pa la don de las skyes pa'i shes pa mngon sum du 'gyur ro zhes 'dod pa de lta na ni tshogs la de dag la khas blangs pa bden yang yod pa'i rdzas @17b kyi rnam pa nyid thob ste /
translated: If you maintain that the consciousness to which blue, etc. appears is a direct perception that arises from that object, then you have accepted the collection of consciousnesses as the substance of the direct perception.üîΩBut you have not accepted the aspect of the substance that exists,

original: de nyid rdzas la sogs pa nyid du snang bas na rdzas dang grangs la sogs pa'i rnam pa yang 'thob bo //
analyzed: de nyid rdzas la sogs pa nyid du snang bas na rdzas dang grangs la sogs pa'i rnam pa yang 'thob bo //
translated: because that very thing appears as substance, etc. and therefore you have not accepted the aspect of substance, number, etc.

original: de ste ji ltar yod pa rgyur gyur na ni de ltar rdzas la sogs pa ni thal ba'i nyes par mi 'gyur te de ltar na de dag med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ste ji ltar yod pa rgyur gyur na ni de ltar rdzas la sogs pa ni thal ba'i nyes par mi 'gyur te de ltar na de dag med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If you say that the existent is the cause, then the fault of the absurd consequence of substance, etc. does not arise, because in that case they do not exist.

original: de ltar na yang gang la yang tha snyad du bya ba ste de ni 'thob par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ltar na yang gang la yang tha snyad du bya ba ste de ni 'thob par mi 'gyur te /
translated: But even so, you cannot make a convention about anything, because that does not exist.

original: de dag so so la shes pa yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de dag so so la shes pa yod pa ma yin no //
translated: There is no consciousness of the individual.

original: so so ba de dag 'dus pa rgyu yin yang de 'dus par yod pa la sogs pa ni khas ma blangs so //
analyzed: so so ba de dag 'dus pa rgyu yin yang de 'dus par yod pa la sogs pa ni khas ma blangs so //
translated: Even if the collection of the individual things is the cause, you have not accepted the existence of the collection of those things, etc.

original: de nyid smras pa //
analyzed: de nyid smras pa //
translated: He says just that:

original: ji ltar snang ba de yod min //
analyzed: ji ltar snang ba de yod min //
translated: But it does not exist as it appears.

original: de yi phyir na don dam du //
analyzed: de yi phyir na don dam du //
translated: Therefore, ultimately,

original: sems kyi dmigs pa lnga rnams so //
analyzed: sems kyi dmigs pa lnga rnams so //
translated: The five objects of mind do not exist.

original: de la tha snyad du ma byas //
analyzed: de la tha snyad du ma byas //
translated: They are not even conventionally real.

original: dmigs pa la sogs pa yang dmigs par bya ba nyid du thal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: dmigs pa la sogs pa yang dmigs par bya ba nyid du thal bar 'gyur te /
translated: And the objects of the objects, etc., would also be objects,

original: de dag ni don dam par yod pas so //
analyzed: de dag ni don dam par yod pas so //
translated: Because they exist ultimately.

original: gzhan du na yod pa ma yin pa zla ba gnyis pa la sogs par snang ba yang sngon po la sogs par snang ba'i shes pa'i rgyur 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan du na yod pa ma yin pa zla ba gnyis pa la sogs par snang ba yang sngon po la sogs par snang ba'i shes pa'i rgyur 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, even the appearance of a nonexistent, such as a second moon, would be the cause of the cognition of blue, etc.

original: don gyi tshul gyis dben pa yang brjod bya ma yin /
analyzed: don gyi tshul gyis dben pa yang brjod bya ma yin /
translated: And that which is devoid of the mode of being of an object is not an object of expression.

original: shes pa thams cad don gyi tshul dang bral na yang tha snyad du bya bar mi nus so //
analyzed: shes pa thams cad don gyi tshul dang bral na yang tha snyad du bya bar mi nus so //
translated: And if all cognitions are devoid of the mode of being of an object, they cannot be conventionally real.

original: yul 'di'i yang /
analyzed: yul 'di'i yang /
translated: And in this regard,

original: spyi yi tshul gyis bstan par bya //
analyzed: spyi yi tshul gyis bstan par bya //
translated: The general mode of being is taught.

original: des na tha snyad du mi bya //
analyzed: des na tha snyad du mi bya //
translated: Therefore, they are not even conventionally real.

original: rnam par shes pa lnga rnams kyi yul de'i tshul gyis tha snyad du bya ba yin gyi rang gi ngo bo'i tshul gyis tha snyad du bya ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa lnga rnams kyi yul de'i tshul gyis tha snyad du bya ba yin gyi rang gi ngo bo'i tshul gyis tha snyad du bya ba ni ma yin no //
translated: The five consciousnesses conventionally designate their objects in terms of their mode of appearance, not in terms of their own nature.

original: spyi'i ngo bo'i tshul las ni gzugs la sogs pa tha snyad du byed do //
analyzed: spyi'i ngo bo'i tshul las ni gzugs la sogs pa tha snyad du byed do //
translated: Form and so on are conventionally designated in terms of their general nature.

original: de'i phyir rnam par shes pa lnga rnams kyi yul ni tha snyad du bya bar mi nus so zhes bya ba ni rtsod pa sgrub pa la'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir rnam par shes pa lnga rnams kyi yul ni tha snyad du bya bar mi nus so zhes bya ba ni rtsod pa sgrub pa la'o //
translated: Therefore, the objects of the five consciousnesses cannot be conventionally designated. This is the argument.

original: rigs pa can rnams ni dbang po dang don phrad pa las skyes pa'i shes pa tha snyad du byas pa ma yin pa 'khrul pa med pa zhen pa'i bdag nyid ni mngon sum mo zhes zer ro //
analyzed: rigs pa can rnams ni dbang po dang don phrad pa las skyes pa'i shes pa tha snyad du byas pa ma yin pa 'khrul pa med pa zhen pa'i bdag nyid ni mngon sum mo zhes zer ro //
translated: The NaiyƒÅyikas say that perception is a nonerroneous cognition that arises from the contact of a sense faculty with its object and is not a conventional designation.

original: 'di yang rigs pa ma yin te khyad par 'di dag ni mi gsha'o //
analyzed: 'di yang rigs pa ma yin te khyad par 'di dag ni mi gsha'o //
translated: This is also unreasonable, because these distinctions are illogical.

original: gang gi phyir /üîΩdbang po las byung don blo las //
analyzed: gang gi phyir / dbang po las byung don blo las //
translated: BecauseüîΩconventional designations and so on are not possible

original: tha snyad la sogs srid ma yin //
analyzed: tha snyad la sogs srid ma yin //
translated: for a cognition arisen from a sense faculty and its object.

original: 'khrul pa srid pa'i yul la ni khyad par du bya grang na /
analyzed: 'khrul pa srid pa'i yul la ni khyad par du bya grang na /
translated: If you say that error is the object of existence,

original: tha snyad du bya ba'i yul la ni rjes su dpag pa las yin gyi /
analyzed: tha snyad du bya ba'i yul la ni rjes su dpag pa las yin gyi /
translated: then the object of conventional activity is from inference.

original: dbang po'i blo ni tha snyad kyi yul nyid du srid pa ma yin no //
analyzed: dbang po'i blo ni tha snyad kyi yul nyid du srid pa ma yin no //
translated: The cognition of the sense faculties is not possible as the object of convention.

original: de'i phyir ma 'khrul pa'i khyad par bstan par mi bya ba nyid do //üîΩdbang po'i blo tha snyad du bya bar mi nus pa de'i phyir khyad par @18a * //
analyzed: de'i phyir ma 'khrul pa'i khyad par bstan par mi bya ba nyid do // dbang po'i blo tha snyad du bya bar mi nus pa de'i phyir khyad par @18a * //
translated: Therefore, it is not possible to teach the distinction of non-error.

original: du bya ba tshigs mi bya ba nyid do //
analyzed: du bya ba tshigs mi bya ba nyid do //
translated: Since the cognition of the sense faculties is not possible as the object of convention, it is not possible to make a distinction.

original: 'khrul pa'i khyad par nyid kyang srid pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'khrul pa'i khyad par nyid kyang srid pa ma yin te /
translated: The distinction of error is also not possible.

original: 'khrul pa ni yid la ste /
analyzed: 'khrul pa ni yid la ste /
translated: Error is in the mind,

original: de 'khrul pa'i yul can yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de 'khrul pa'i yul can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the subject of error.

original: zhen pa ni nges pa ste /
analyzed: zhen pa ni nges pa ste /
translated: Attachment is ascertainment.

original: de spyi la sogs pa dang ldan pa'i dri la sogs pa la rtog par mi byed /
analyzed: de spyi la sogs pa dang ldan pa'i dri la sogs pa la rtog par mi byed /
translated: It does not conceive or see smell, etc. that possesses generality, etc.

original: mi mthong ba de bas mi srid do //
analyzed: mi mthong ba de bas mi srid do //
translated: Therefore, it is not possible.

original: ci ste don ji lta ba la sogs pa'i shes pa'i ldog 'tshams su brjod do zhe na /
analyzed: ci ste don ji lta ba la sogs pa'i shes pa'i ldog 'tshams su brjod do zhe na /
translated: If you say that it is stated at the end of the cognition of the object as it is, etc.,

original: de lta na khyad par du byed pa'i tshigs rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de lta na khyad par du byed pa'i tshigs rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: Thus, it is not logical to specify the sense consciousnesses in this way.

original: ma 'khrul pa'i phyir yang dbang po'i blo thams cad rang rang gi don tsam 'dzin par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: ma 'khrul pa'i phyir yang dbang po'i blo thams cad rang rang gi don tsam 'dzin par byed pa yin no //
translated: Moreover, all sense consciousnesses apprehend their own objects without error.

original: de dag gis ni bshad pa'i rnam par rtog pa la yang so sor brjod do //
analyzed: de dag gis ni bshad pa'i rnam par rtog pa la yang so sor brjod do //
translated: The above explanation also applies to the conceptual consciousnesses.

original: gang smras pa zhen pa'i bdag nyid ces pa la zhen pa ni 'bras bu yin na de dbang po'i blo la mi srid de /
analyzed: gang smras pa zhen pa'i bdag nyid ces pa la zhen pa ni 'bras bu yin na de dbang po'i blo la mi srid de /
translated: As for the statement that conceptual consciousnesses have the nature of adherence, adherence is the result, and it is not possible for the sense consciousnesses to have that nature.

original: don ji lta ba la sogs pa'i shes pa nyid dngos kyi 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don ji lta ba la sogs pa'i shes pa nyid dngos kyi 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because the consciousnesses that perceive things as they are and so on are the direct results of the sense consciousnesses.

original: ci ste tha snyad du bya ba ma yin pa la sogs pa smos pa la ni shes pa de'i rang gi ngo bo bstan par bya ba'i phyir yin no zhe na /
analyzed: ci ste tha snyad du bya ba ma yin pa la sogs pa smos pa la ni shes pa de'i rang gi ngo bo bstan par bya ba'i phyir yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that the terms nonconceptual and so on are used to indicate the nature of the consciousness itself,

original: ma yin te mngon sum gyi mtshan nyid brjod par bya ba yin pa'i phyir la /
analyzed: ma yin te mngon sum gyi mtshan nyid brjod par bya ba yin pa'i phyir la /
translated: that is not so, because the definition of direct perception is what is to be stated.

original: de la dbang po dang don du phrad pa nyid kyis grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la dbang po dang don du phrad pa nyid kyis grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And that is established by the sense faculty and object coming together.

original: shes pa'i rang gi ngo bo bstan par bya ba'i phyir yin na yang yon tan dang rdzas rtsom par mi byed pa dang / nam mkha' la sogs pa shes par bya ba'i yul ma yin pa nyid kyang bstan par bya ba yin pa'i phyir ha cang thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: shes pa'i rang gi ngo bo bstan par bya ba'i phyir yin na yang yon tan dang rdzas rtsom par mi byed pa dang / nam mkha' la sogs pa shes par bya ba'i yul ma yin pa nyid kyang bstan par bya ba yin pa'i phyir ha cang thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If the nature of consciousness is to be taught, then it is absurd to say that it is not taught in the treatises on fine arts and medicine, and that it is not taught in the treatises on grammar, logic, and epistemology, and that it is not taught in the treatises on ethics and the arts.

original: thams cad du phrad nas skye ba mngon sum du 'dod na ni /
analyzed: thams cad du phrad nas skye ba mngon sum du 'dod na ni /
translated: If you maintain that all things arise in contact,üîΩthen you would not perceive what is distant,

original: bar dang bcas pa 'dzin pa dang // shes pa lhag pa'ang mi thob 'gyur //
analyzed: bar dang bcas pa 'dzin pa dang // shes pa lhag pa'ang mi thob 'gyur //
translated: nor would you obtain a sense faculty that is superior.

original: ri la sogs pa la ni yul dang dbang po bar med pa ste bar dang bcas pa yin bzhin du 'dzin pa mthong med kyi /
analyzed: ri la sogs pa la ni yul dang dbang po bar med pa ste bar dang bcas pa yin bzhin du 'dzin pa mthong med kyi /
translated: In the case of a mountain, etc., the object and sense faculty are not in contact, but you do perceive them.

original: dbang po lhag par 'dzin pa ni rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: dbang po lhag par 'dzin pa ni rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not reasonable to maintain that you obtain a superior sense faculty.

original: phyi rol du 'jug pa'i phyir 'thad pa nyid do //
analyzed: phyi rol du 'jug pa'i phyir 'thad pa nyid do //
translated: It is reasonable to maintain that the sense faculty extends outward, because it engages external objects.

original: dbang po gnyis kyi rten las phyi rol du 'jug pa ste /
analyzed: dbang po gnyis kyi rten las phyi rol du 'jug pa ste /
translated: The sense faculty extends outward from the support of the two sense faculties.

original: des na yul te bar dang bcas pa lhag par 'dzin pa yang 'thad pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: des na yul te bar dang bcas pa lhag par 'dzin pa yang 'thad pa yin no zhe na /
translated: Therefore it is reasonable to maintain that it perceives distant objects.

original: de yang rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de yang rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: This is not a correct argument.

original: gang gi phyir /
analyzed: gang gi phyir /
translated: Because:

original: rten las dbang po phyir min par //
analyzed: rten las dbang po phyir min par //
translated: The sense faculty is not established as external to the support.

original: grub po zhes bya ba tshig gi lhag ma'o //
analyzed: grub po zhes bya ba tshig gi lhag ma'o //
translated: The remainder of the verse is: ‚Äúbecause it is not established as external to the support.‚Äù

original: dbang po ni brten gyi yul nyid la gnas pa ste /
analyzed: dbang po ni brten gyi yul nyid la gnas pa ste /
translated: The sense faculty is the support, and the object is what is supported.

original: der gso ba la sogs pa la rab tu sbyor ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: der gso ba la sogs pa la rab tu sbyor ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is applied to the object, it is nourished, and so on.

original: des na dbang po kho na bar du chod @18b pa'i don 'dzin par byed do //
analyzed: des na dbang po kho na bar du chod @18b pa'i don 'dzin par byed do //
translated: Therefore, the sense faculty itself, which is obstructed, apprehends the object.

original: dbang po phyi rol du 'pho ba bden du chug na yang /
analyzed: dbang po phyi rol du 'pho ba bden du chug na yang /
translated: Even if it is true that the sense faculty moves externally,

original: yul la 'dzin par nus pa ma yin //
analyzed: yul la 'dzin par nus pa ma yin //
translated: it is not able to apprehend the object.

original: gzhan du na brten pa bsgribs kyang yul 'dzin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan du na brten pa bsgribs kyang yul 'dzin par 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, even if the support is obstructed, it would apprehend the object.

original: de'i phyir mig dang rna ba dag gis nang rten gyi gnas kho na 'thob ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir mig dang rna ba dag gis nang rten gyi gnas kho na 'thob ste /
translated: Therefore, the eye and ear obtain only the internal support, the body.

original: yul gyi skad cig ma dag las bar dang bcas pa dang lhag par 'dzin par yang rigs pa min no //
analyzed: yul gyi skad cig ma dag las bar dang bcas pa dang lhag par 'dzin par yang rigs pa min no //
translated: It is not reasonable that they apprehend the object, which is a different continuum and is obstructed.

original: bde sogs gzhal bya min pa'am //
analyzed: bde sogs gzhal bya min pa'am //
translated: Pleasure, etc., are not objects of knowledge.

original: 'am zhes smos pa ni'am gyi sgra las tshad ma gzhan 'thob par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: 'am zhes smos pa ni'am gyi sgra las tshad ma gzhan 'thob par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: The word ‚Äúor‚Äù in the verse indicates that another means of valid knowledge is obtained.

original: gang 'di ltar rtags pa sogs pa med par bdag nyid kyi bde ba dang sdug bsngal dang 'dod pa dang / zhe sdang dang 'bad rtsol rnams la 'dzin pa de tshad ma ma yin pas bde ba la sogs pa rnams gzhal bya nyid du mi 'gyur ba'am /
analyzed: gang 'di ltar rtags pa sogs pa med par bdag nyid kyi bde ba dang sdug bsngal dang 'dod pa dang / zhe sdang dang 'bad rtsol rnams la 'dzin pa de tshad ma ma yin pas bde ba la sogs pa rnams gzhal bya nyid du mi 'gyur ba'am /
translated: If pleasure, pain, desire, hatred, and effort were not apprehended by themselves, without the existence of such a cognizer, then they would not be objects of knowledge, because they would not be apprehended by valid cognition.

original: der 'am zhes smos pas tshad ma gzhan nyid mtshon par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: der 'am zhes smos pas tshad ma gzhan nyid mtshon par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Or, if one were to say ‚Äúthere,‚Äù it would indicate another valid cognition.

original: dbang po gzhan yod yid dbang po //
analyzed: dbang po gzhan yod yid dbang po //
translated: The other sense faculties are the mental faculty.

original: yang na yid kho na dbang po nyid du brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: yang na yid kho na dbang po nyid du brjod par bya ste /
translated: Or, only the mental faculty should be called a sense faculty.

original: de dang phrad pa las skyes pa mngon sum nyid du bsgrub par bya ba'i don du'o //
analyzed: de dang phrad pa las skyes pa mngon sum nyid du bsgrub par bya ba'i don du'o //
translated: This is in order to prove that the mental faculty is a sense faculty, and that the mental consciousness arises in dependence on the mental faculty and its object.

original: bkag pa med phyir 'thob ce na /
analyzed: bkag pa med phyir 'thob ce na /
translated: If you say that it is obtained because it is not refuted,

original: ci ste yang gzhan gyi 'dod pa ma bkag pa ru sgrub pa la yid kyi dbang po nyid bkag pa med pa'i phyir 'thob pa nyid do zhe na /
analyzed: ci ste yang gzhan gyi 'dod pa ma bkag pa ru sgrub pa la yid kyi dbang po nyid bkag pa med pa'i phyir 'thob pa nyid do zhe na /
translated: if you say that the mental faculty is obtained because it is not refuted in the proof of the other‚Äôs thesis,

original: gzhan gyi 'dod pa la ni yid kyi dbang po yod la rag na de lta na ni /
analyzed: gzhan gyi 'dod pa la ni yid kyi dbang po yod la rag na de lta na ni /
translated: then the other‚Äôs thesis is that the mental faculty exists.

original: dbang po gzhan gyi sgra don med //
analyzed: dbang po gzhan gyi sgra don med //
translated: The other faculties are meaningless.

original: gal te gzhan gyis smras pa'i yid la bkag pa med pa'i phyir dbang po yin na des rna ba la sogs dbang por brjod do zhes bstan pa don med par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te gzhan gyis smras pa'i yid la bkag pa med pa'i phyir dbang po yin na des rna ba la sogs dbang por brjod do zhes bstan pa don med par 'gyur te /
translated: If the other faculties are faculties because they are not obstructed to the objects of their own object-field, then it is meaningless to state that the ear and so on are faculties because they are not obstructed to sound and so on.

original: bkag pa med pa nyid las de grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bkag pa med pa nyid las de grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are established as faculties by the fact that they are not obstructed.

original: don des 'bras bu yod min pas //
analyzed: don des 'bras bu yod min pas //
translated: The result is not due to that object.

original: shes pa'i yang ni tshad nyid las//
analyzed: shes pa'i yang ni tshad nyid las//
translated: Also, the result is not due to valid knowledge.

original: don gzhan 'bras bu smra bar 'gyur //
analyzed: don gzhan 'bras bu smra bar 'gyur //
translated: One would have to say that the result is another object.

original: nges pa'i bdag nyid can gyi shes pa ni tshad ma ste /
analyzed: nges pa'i bdag nyid can gyi shes pa ni tshad ma ste /
translated: Valid knowledge is a cognition that has a determined nature.

original: tshad ma de skyes kyi rjes la don lhag tu rtogs so zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tshad ma de skyes kyi rjes la don lhag tu rtogs so zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu med par 'gyur ro //
translated: It would be meaningless to say that the object is realized later after the arising of that valid knowledge.

original: gal te khyad par du byed pa'i shes pa tshad ma yin te /
analyzed: gal te khyad par du byed pa'i shes pa tshad ma yin te /
translated: If you say that valid knowledge is a cognition that distinguishes,

original: gang spyi la sogs pa khyad par du byed pa'i shes pa de'i tshe ma yin la /
analyzed: gang spyi la sogs pa khyad par du byed pa'i shes pa de'i tshe ma yin la /
translated: then the cognition that distinguishes a universal and so on is not valid knowledge.

original: gang rdzas la sogs pa khyad par du bya ba'i shes pa de ni 'bras bu yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gang rdzas la sogs pa khyad par du bya ba'i shes pa de ni 'bras bu yin no zhe na /
translated: But the cognition that distinguishes a substance and so on is the result.

original: de yi khyad par la min tha dad phyir //
analyzed: de yi khyad par la min tha dad phyir //
translated: But it is not different from that, because it is not different.

original: tha dad pa ni khyad par du byed pa khyad par du bya ba tha dad pa yin la yul gzhan la tshad mar 'gyur zhing gzhan la 'bras bur 'gyur ba yang rigs pa ma yin te /üîΩdper na seng ldeng @19a * //
analyzed: tha dad pa ni khyad par du byed pa khyad par du bya ba tha dad pa yin la yul gzhan la tshad mar 'gyur zhing gzhan la 'bras bur 'gyur ba yang rigs pa ma yin te / dper na seng ldeng @19a * //
translated: It is not logical that what is different from the object of a valid cognition is the object of that valid cognition, and that what is different from the object of a result is the result.

original: gi yul bcad cing gshags pas pa la sha chod pa ni ma mthong ngo //
analyzed: gi yul bcad cing gshags pas pa la sha chod pa ni ma mthong ngo //
translated: For example, when a piece of teak wood is cut and split, a piece of palasha wood is not seen.

original: ji ste khyad par du bya ba'i shes pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir de'i yul nyid kyang yin no zhe na ma yin te /
analyzed: ji ste khyad par du bya ba'i shes pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir de'i yul nyid kyang yin no zhe na ma yin te /
translated: If you say that the object of the cognition that is the cause of the distinction is also the object of the valid cognition, that is not so.

original: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is absurd.

original: de lta na ni byed pa po thams cad gcig tu 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta na ni byed pa po thams cad gcig tu 'gyur te /
translated: If that were so, all agents would be the same,

original: khyad par du bya ba'i shes pa'i rgyu yin pa nyid kyis de'i byed pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khyad par du bya ba'i shes pa'i rgyu yin pa nyid kyis de'i byed pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the cause of the cognition that is the object of the distinction is the agent of that.

original: de'i phyir gang la las kyi bya ba yod par brjod pa de nyid de'i 'bras bu nyid du rigs so //
analyzed: de'i phyir gang la las kyi bya ba yod par brjod pa de nyid de'i 'bras bu nyid du rigs so //
translated: Therefore, it is logical that whatever is said to be the object of the action is the result of that.

original: gzhan yang de la yod min /
analyzed: gzhan yang de la yod min /
translated: Moreover, it does not exist in that.

original: de la yang khyad par du byed pa lhag par rtogs pa med pa'i 'bras bu yang med la tshad ma yang med do //
analyzed: de la yang khyad par du byed pa lhag par rtogs pa med pa'i 'bras bu yang med la tshad ma yang med do //
translated: Moreover, if there is no special realization, there is no result and no valid cognition.

original: gnyis she na /
analyzed: gnyis she na /
translated: If you say that there are two,

original: ci ste yang khyad bar du byed pa'i shes pa nyid tshad ma dang gzhal bya gnyis kar yang 'gyur te /
analyzed: ci ste yang khyad bar du byed pa'i shes pa nyid tshad ma dang gzhal bya gnyis kar yang 'gyur te /
translated: then the cognition that is the special object would be both valid cognition and the object of comprehension.

original: dper na bdag gis bdag khong du chud par byed tsam na /
analyzed: dper na bdag gis bdag khong du chud par byed tsam na /
translated: For example, when the self is understood by the self,

original: gzhal bar bya ba yang 'gyur zhing 'dzin pa po yang yin pa bzhin no zhe na /
analyzed: gzhal bar bya ba yang 'gyur zhing 'dzin pa po yang yin pa bzhin no zhe na /
translated: it is the object of comprehension and it is the apprehender.

original: ma yin khyad par bya la'ang 'gyur //
analyzed: ma yin khyad par bya la'ang 'gyur //
translated: No, because it would also be the special object.

original: de lta na ni khyad par du bya ba'i shes pa la'ang tshad ma dang gzhal bya gnyis ka thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta na ni khyad par du bya ba'i shes pa la'ang tshad ma dang gzhal bya gnyis ka thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: If that were so, then the cognition that is the special object would also be both valid cognition and the object of comprehension.

original: gal te shes pa dang shes bya don gzhan yin yang tshad ma dang gzhal bya nyid du 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: gal te shes pa dang shes bya don gzhan yin yang tshad ma dang gzhal bya nyid du 'gyur ba ste /
translated: If the object of comprehension and valid cognition are different objects, then valid cognition and the object of comprehension would exist,

original: rang gis bdag khong du chud pa'i shes pa bzhin no zhes pa de nyid dngos po gnyis ka la yang 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: rang gis bdag khong du chud pa'i shes pa bzhin no zhes pa de nyid dngos po gnyis ka la yang 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: just like the cognition that understands the self.

original: khyad par du byed pa'i shes pa bdag dang mtshungs so zhes pa ni ma yin gyis gnyis ka la yang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: khyad par du byed pa'i shes pa bdag dang mtshungs so zhes pa ni ma yin gyis gnyis ka la yang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: But it is not so; it should be applied to both.

original: de lta na ni shes bya khong du chud kyang gang ma rtogs pa dang the tshom bra ba dang log par rtogs pa las log pa de 'bras bur 'gyur na /
analyzed: de lta na ni shes bya khong du chud kyang gang ma rtogs pa dang the tshom bra ba dang log par rtogs pa las log pa de 'bras bur 'gyur na /
translated: If that were so, then even though the object of knowledge is understood, the opposite of what is not understood, the opposite of what is doubted, and the opposite of what is wrongly understood would be the effect.

original: de yang mi rigs te /
analyzed: de yang mi rigs te /
translated: But that is not reasonable.

original: gang gi phyir /
analyzed: gang gi phyir /
translated: Because:

original: ma rtogs la sogs kun la min //
analyzed: ma rtogs la sogs kun la min //
translated: It is not in all cases of non-understanding, etc.

original: re zhig thams cad du ma rtogs pa la sogs pa las 'byung ba'i nges pa de dag ni yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: re zhig thams cad du ma rtogs pa la sogs pa las 'byung ba'i nges pa de dag ni yod pa ma yin te /
translated: To begin with, those certainties that arise from non-understanding, etc. are not present in all cases.

original: kha cig tu gzas pa tsam gyis shes pa skye bas so //
analyzed: kha cig tu gzas pa tsam gyis shes pa skye bas so //
translated: Because in some cases knowledge arises merely from the object.

original: ma rtogs pa la sogs pa yod du chug na yang /
analyzed: ma rtogs pa la sogs pa yod du chug na yang /
translated: Even if non-understanding, etc. were to exist,

original: log pa 'bras bur yod ma yin //
analyzed: log pa 'bras bur yod ma yin //
translated: The opposite would not be the effect.

original: log pa zhes bya ba ni ma rtogs pa la sogs pa med pa la bya na /
analyzed: log pa zhes bya ba ni ma rtogs pa la sogs pa med pa la bya na /
translated: What is called the opposite is taken to be the non-existence of non-understanding, etc.

original: yod pa ma yin pa de ni 'bras bu ma yin te /
analyzed: yod pa ma yin pa de ni 'bras bu ma yin te /
translated: That non-existence is not the effect.

original: de gzhal byar 'gyur ba ni mi dpyod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de gzhal byar 'gyur ba ni mi dpyod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not analyzed as an object of knowledge.

original: de ltar na re zhig rigs pa can rnams kyi mngon sum ni rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na re zhig rigs pa can rnams kyi mngon sum ni rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: Thus, for the time being, the direct perception of the logicians is not logical.

original: bye brag pa rnams kyi mdo las re zhig gang 'brel pa 'ba' zhig @19b las grub pa de rdzas la mngon sum mo zhes so //
analyzed: bye brag pa rnams kyi mdo las re zhig gang 'brel pa 'ba' zhig @19b las grub pa de rdzas la mngon sum mo zhes so //
translated: In the s≈´tra of the Vai≈õe·π£ikas, it is said, ‚ÄúThat which is established from mere connection is direct perception of substance.‚Äù

original: bdag dang dbang po don du phrad pa las gang grub pa de gzhan yin no zhes so //
analyzed: bdag dang dbang po don du phrad pa las gang grub pa de gzhan yin no zhes so //
translated: And, ‚ÄúThat which is established from the contact of self and sense faculty is different.‚Äù

original: kha cig ni tshad ma las don gzhan du 'dod de /
analyzed: kha cig ni tshad ma las don gzhan du 'dod de /
translated: Some assert that it is different from valid knowledge.

original: thun mong ma yin pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir dbang po dang don du phrad pa tshad mar rtog par byed do //
analyzed: thun mong ma yin pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir dbang po dang don du phrad pa tshad mar rtog par byed do //
translated: They imagine that the contact of sense faculty and object is valid knowledge because it is the uncommon cause.

original: gzhan dag ni gtso bo yin pa'i phyir bdag dang yid du phrad pa tshad ma'o zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gzhan dag ni gtso bo yin pa'i phyir bdag dang yid du phrad pa tshad ma'o zhes zer ro //
translated: Others say that the contact of self and mind is valid knowledge because it is primary.

original: de ltar na ni gang 'di skad the tshom dang gtan la 'bebs pa'i shes pa dag las grub pa ni mngon sum dang rtags can gyi shes pa dag go zhes bshad pa dang 'gal lo //
analyzed: de ltar na ni gang 'di skad the tshom dang gtan la 'bebs pa'i shes pa dag las grub pa ni mngon sum dang rtags can gyi shes pa dag go zhes bshad pa dang 'gal lo //
translated: If that were so, it would contradict the explanation that ‚Äúthat which is established from doubt and determining consciousnesses is direct perception and inferential consciousness.‚Äù

original: bzhi po phrad pa las skyes pa'i shes pa dang / gtan la 'bebs pa las skyes pa mtshungs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: bzhi po phrad pa las skyes pa'i shes pa dang / gtan la 'bebs pa las skyes pa mtshungs pa ma yin te /
translated: The consciousness produced from the contact of the four is not the same as that produced from the determination.

original: gtan la 'bebs pa ni brtag pa sngon du 'gro ba yin pa'i phyir la /
analyzed: gtan la 'bebs pa ni brtag pa sngon du 'gro ba yin pa'i phyir la /
translated: Because the determination is preceded by investigation,

original: mngon sum ni yul lta ba tsam yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mngon sum ni yul lta ba tsam yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: and direct perception is merely the seeing of the object.

original: yul la lta ba tsam zhes pa pa ni bzhi po phrad pa las skyes pa ste /
analyzed: yul la lta ba tsam zhes pa pa ni bzhi po phrad pa las skyes pa ste /
translated: Merely seeing the object is produced from the contact of the four.

original: de la brtag cing dpyod pa gang la srid //
analyzed: de la brtag cing dpyod pa gang la srid //
translated: How could it be possible to investigate and analyze that?

original: dbang po dang don du phrad pa tshad mar smra bas ni lhag par bstan la ci yang med pa nyid do //
analyzed: dbang po dang don du phrad pa tshad mar smra bas ni lhag par bstan la ci yang med pa nyid do //
translated: The S≈´tra master‚Äôs assertion that sense faculties and objects contact each other is taught to be a mistake, because it is nothing at all.

original: dbang po dang don du phrad pa tshad mar smra ba'i ltar na ni 'di ci zhig ces shes par 'dod pa'i tshe don mtha' dag 'dzin par 'gyur te /
analyzed: dbang po dang don du phrad pa tshad mar smra ba'i ltar na ni 'di ci zhig ces shes par 'dod pa'i tshe don mtha' dag 'dzin par 'gyur te /
translated: According to the S≈´tra master‚Äôs assertion that sense faculties and objects contact each other, when one wishes to know what this is, all objects are apprehended,

original: thams cad kyi bdag nyid dang phrad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thams cad kyi bdag nyid dang phrad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they contact the nature of all.

original: bdag dang yid du phrad par smra ba la yang yul tha dad la yul gzhan la tshad mar 'gyur zhing gzhan la 'bras bur 'gyur ba ni med do zhes sngar smras zin to //
analyzed: bdag dang yid du phrad par smra ba la yang yul tha dad la yul gzhan la tshad mar 'gyur zhing gzhan la 'bras bur 'gyur ba ni med do zhes sngar smras zin to //
translated: Also, in the case of the assertion that the self and the mind come into contact, it has already been explained that there is no object that is both a valid cognition in regard to one object and a result in regard to another object.

original: gzhan yang spyi'i khyad par la ltos pa dang rdzas dang yon tan dang las la ltos pa mngon sum zhes ni sbyar bar mi bya ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang spyi'i khyad par la ltos pa dang rdzas dang yon tan dang las la ltos pa mngon sum zhes ni sbyar bar mi bya ste /
translated: Moreover, one should not apply the term ‚Äúperception‚Äù to that which depends on a universal or a particular, or to that which depends on a substance, a quality, or an action.

original: gang gi phyir dbang po dang yul du phrad pa las skyes pa ni /
analyzed: gang gi phyir dbang po dang yul du phrad pa las skyes pa ni /
translated: Because that which arises from the contact of a sense faculty and an object

original: yul la lta ba'i don can phyir //
analyzed: yul la lta ba'i don can phyir //
translated: has the meaning of seeing an object,

original: khyad par rnams dang sbyar mi bya //
analyzed: khyad par rnams dang sbyar mi bya //
