translated: it is not applied to particulars.

original: dbang po'i blo rnams ni rang gi don tsam 'dzin par byed pa yin pa'i phyir //
analyzed: dbang po'i blo rnams ni rang gi don tsam 'dzin par byed pa yin pa'i phyir //
translated: Because the cognitions of the sense faculties apprehend their own objects alone,

original: khyad par rnams dang lhan cig tu sbyor ba ni mi 'thad do //
analyzed: khyad par rnams dang lhan cig tu sbyor ba ni mi 'thad do //
translated: it is not tenable that they are applied together with particulars.

original: 'di ni 'di'i spyi yin zhing rdzas la sogs pa rnams dang 'brel pa'o zhes dang gi don gnyis nges par bzung nas de bzhin du brtag par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni 'di'i spyi yin zhing rdzas la sogs pa rnams dang 'brel pa'o zhes dang gi don gnyis nges par bzung nas de bzhin du brtag par bya'o //
translated: One should investigate in the same way, having ascertained the two meanings of ‚Äúthis is the universal of that‚Äù and ‚Äúit is connected with substances, etc.‚Äù

original: de yang dran pa la sogs pa yin pa'i phyir 'di la yid kyi blos khyad par du byas la 'thad pa kho na ste /
analyzed: de yang dran pa la sogs pa yin pa'i phyir 'di la yid kyi blos khyad par du byas la 'thad pa kho na ste /
translated: Because it is memory, etc., it is the object of mental consciousness alone.

original: gzhan du na dri mngar ro zhes 'dzin pa yang mngon sum du 'gyur la /
analyzed: gzhan du na dri mngar ro zhes 'dzin pa yang mngon sum du 'gyur la /
translated: Otherwise, the apprehension of sweet smell would be direct perception.

original: de ltar 'gyur bar yang mi rigs te /
analyzed: de ltar 'gyur bar yang mi rigs te /
translated: But that is not reasonable,

original: @20a * // khyad par du byed pa dang khyad par du bya ba dag dbang po tha dad kyi yul yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: @20a * // khyad par du byed pa dang khyad par du bya ba dag dbang po tha dad kyi yul yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the object that is qualified and the object that qualifies are the objects of different sense faculties.

original: gal te yang rdzas gcig pas dbang po du ma'i gzung bya yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te yang rdzas gcig pas dbang po du ma'i gzung bya yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that it is the object of many sense faculties because it is one substance,

original: de lta na ni gcig min te gzugs la sogs pa bzhin du du mar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta na ni gcig min te gzugs la sogs pa bzhin du du mar 'gyur ro //
translated: then it is not one, because it is like form, etc., which are many.

original: gzugs la sogs pa la ni dbang po du mas gzung bar bya ba'i gcig nyid gang du mthong ngo //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa la ni dbang po du mas gzung bar bya ba'i gcig nyid gang du mthong ngo //
translated: But form, etc., are seen to be one, the object of many sense faculties.

original: gcig min gzugs sogs kyang gcig 'gyur //
analyzed: gcig min gzugs sogs kyang gcig 'gyur //
translated: If it is not one, form, etc., would be one.

original: gal te dbang po du ma'i gzung bya yin kyang tha mi dad par 'dod na ni gzugs la sogs pa yang rdzas bzhin gcig nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te dbang po du ma'i gzung bya yin kyang tha mi dad par 'dod na ni gzugs la sogs pa yang rdzas bzhin gcig nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: If you maintain that the object of many sense faculties is not different, then form, etc. will be one substance like the universal of substance.

original: mthong zhe na /
analyzed: mthong zhe na /
translated: You see it!

original: de dag gal te 'di ltar dbang po tha dad kyang yul rdzas la shes pa tha mi dad pa ni ma mthong ba kho na ste /üîΩyod pa nyid dang yon tan nyid dag lta bu'o //
analyzed: de dag gal te 'di ltar dbang po tha dad kyang yul rdzas la shes pa tha mi dad pa ni ma mthong ba kho na ste / yod pa nyid dang yon tan nyid dag lta bu'o //
translated: If you see that the object of many sense faculties is not different, then the object of the sense faculties will be one substance like the universal of substance.üîΩBut you do not see that the object of the sense faculties is not different, just as you do not see that the object of the sense faculties is one substance.

original: de bas gzugs la sogs pa la gcig nyid dang du ma nyid du thal bar mi 'grub bo zhe na /
analyzed: de bas gzugs la sogs pa la gcig nyid dang du ma nyid du thal bar mi 'grub bo zhe na /
translated: Therefore, the consequence that form, etc. are one or many is not established.

original: shes pa tha mi dad pa 'di lta bu ni mthong na /
analyzed: shes pa tha mi dad pa 'di lta bu ni mthong na /
translated: If you see that the object of the sense faculties is not different,

original: 'on kyang de dbang po las min /
analyzed: 'on kyang de dbang po las min /
translated: then the object of the sense faculties is not from the sense faculties.

original: de dbang po'i sgo nas dbang po gzhan gyi yul shes pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de dbang po'i sgo nas dbang po gzhan gyi yul shes pa ni ma yin no //
translated: The object of the sense faculties is not the object of another sense faculty through the sense faculties.

original: gang gi phyir zhe na /
analyzed: gang gi phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: dbang gzhan don med 'gyur phyir ro //
analyzed: dbang gzhan don med 'gyur phyir ro //
translated: Because the other sense faculties would be purposeless.

original: gal te dbang po gzhan gyi yul la yang dbang po gzhan gyis 'dzin nus par 'dod na ni gzugs la sogs pa la dbang po du ma brtags pa don med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te dbang po gzhan gyi yul la yang dbang po gzhan gyis 'dzin nus par 'dod na ni gzugs la sogs pa la dbang po du ma brtags pa don med par 'gyur ro //
translated: If you maintain that one can apprehend the object of another sense faculty with another sense faculty, then it is pointless to posit many sense faculties such as the eyes and so on.

original: gal te 'di ltar gzugs la sogs pa tha dad du yod pa'i phyir dbang po gcig gis 'dzin par mi nus so zhe na /
analyzed: gal te 'di ltar gzugs la sogs pa tha dad du yod pa'i phyir dbang po gcig gis 'dzin par mi nus so zhe na /
translated: If you say that the eyes cannot apprehend form and so on because they exist separately,

original: de yang rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de yang rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: that is illogical.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: dbang pos ni rang yul tha dad kyang 'dzin nus /
analyzed: dbang pos ni rang yul tha dad kyang 'dzin nus /
translated: The sense faculties can apprehend their own separate objects.

original: rang gi yul la ni sngon po la sogs pa'i tha dad pa dang // grangs la sogs pa'i tha dad pa la yang la sog 'dzin par nus pa la khyod kyis ni tha dad par dbang pos 'dzin nus par 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang gi yul la ni sngon po la sogs pa'i tha dad pa dang // grangs la sogs pa'i tha dad pa la yang la sog 'dzin par nus pa la khyod kyis ni tha dad par dbang pos 'dzin nus par 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The sense faculties can apprehend the difference of blue and so on and the difference of number and so on in their own objects. But you maintain that the sense faculties can apprehend the difference of objects.

original: gal te grangs la sogs pa'i tha dad la 'dzin pa ni dbang po gzhan gyi yul la 'dzin pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gal te grangs la sogs pa'i tha dad la 'dzin pa ni dbang po gzhan gyi yul la 'dzin pa ma yin no //
translated: If you say that the apprehension of the difference of number and so on is not the apprehension of the object of another sense faculty,

original: dbang po gzhan gyi yul nyid ni gzugs las tha dad pa'i reg bya lta bu ste /
analyzed: dbang po gzhan gyi yul nyid ni gzugs las tha dad pa'i reg bya lta bu ste /
translated: The object of another sense faculty is different from form, like tactility.

original: de mig gis gang tsug bzung /
analyzed: de mig gis gang tsug bzung /
translated: How is it apprehended by the eye?

original: gang dag gal te reg pa'i rdzas mig gis 'dzin na ni dbang po gzhan gyi yul yang mig gi rang gi yul yin no //
analyzed: gang dag gal te reg pa'i rdzas mig gis 'dzin na ni dbang po gzhan gyi yul yang mig gi rang gi yul yin no //
translated: If the substance of tactility is apprehended by the eye, then the object of another sense faculty would be the object of the eye sense faculty itself.

original: gsal bar khas blangs pa'i phyir tha dad kyang sngon po la sogs pa bzhin du reg pa la sogs pa yang mig gis 'dzin par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir dang / tha @20b dad pa nyid ni dbang po du mas gzung bar bya ba'i rgyu mtshan yin /
analyzed: gsal bar khas blangs pa'i phyir tha dad kyang sngon po la sogs pa bzhin du reg pa la sogs pa yang mig gis 'dzin par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir dang / tha @20b dad pa nyid ni dbang po du mas gzung bar bya ba'i rgyu mtshan yin /
translated: Even if it is different, it would follow that tactility and so on would be apprehended by the eye, like blue and so on, because it is accepted that they are clear.

original: cis na dbang po gzhan gyi yul mi 'dzin /
analyzed: cis na dbang po gzhan gyi yul mi 'dzin /
translated: Why would the object of another sense faculty not be apprehended?

original: gang yang don tha mi dad pa la yang dbang po du mas 'dzin par 'gyur /üîΩgzugs la sogs pa so so la yang /
analyzed: gang yang don tha mi dad pa la yang dbang po du mas 'dzin par 'gyur / gzugs la sogs pa so so la yang /
translated: Also, even if the object is not different, it would be apprehended by many sense faculties.

original: dbang po kun gyis 'dzin par 'gyur /
analyzed: dbang po kun gyis 'dzin par 'gyur /
translated: Also, form and so on would be apprehended by all sense faculties.

original: de rdzas la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: de rdzas la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: That is like substance and so on.

original: de ltar na yang gzugs la sogs pa yang dbang po gcig gi gzung bya ma yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar na yang gzugs la sogs pa yang dbang po gcig gi gzung bya ma yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: In that case, form and so on would not be objects of a single sense faculty.

original: nyes pa de dag ni yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: nyes pa de dag ni yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Those errors do not exist because

original: gzugs la sogs pa de dag la rang rang gi bye brag nges pa yod pa yin la /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa de dag la rang rang gi bye brag nges pa yod pa yin la /
translated: those forms and so on have their own specific determination.

original: de med pa'i phyir dbang po'i blo sngon po la mi 'khrul lo zhe na /
analyzed: de med pa'i phyir dbang po'i blo sngon po la mi 'khrul lo zhe na /
translated: Since that does not exist, the mind of the sense faculty is not confused about blue.üîΩWhat is that specific determination of those?

original: ci yang de dag gi nges pa nyid de ci lta bu zhig / gang la gzugs nyid med pa de mig gis gzung bar bya ba yin la de bzhin du reg bya la sogs pa rnams kyi rang rang gi yul la nges pa nyid yin nam /
analyzed: ci yang de dag gi nges pa nyid de ci lta bu zhig / gang la gzugs nyid med pa de mig gis gzung bar bya ba yin la de bzhin du reg bya la sogs pa rnams kyi rang rang gi yul la nges pa nyid yin nam /
translated: That which lacks form is apprehended by the eye, and similarly, that which is determined for each of those such as tactile objects is their own object.

original: de lta na ni mig gi reg bya tshogs pa la'ang 'jug / rdzas sogs la min /
analyzed: de lta na ni mig gi reg bya tshogs pa la'ang 'jug / rdzas sogs la min /
translated: If that is so, then the eye engages the collection of tactile objects, but not substance and so on.

original: rdzas dang grangs la sogs pa dang las rnams la gzugs nyid dang reg bya nyid med par 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rdzas dang grangs la sogs pa dang las rnams la gzugs nyid dang reg bya nyid med par 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is asserted that substance, number and so on and action do not have form and tactile objects.

original: mig dang reg pa dag gis de dag 'dzin par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mig dang reg pa dag gis de dag 'dzin par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: The eye and contact do not apprehend them.

original: gal te de lta na ni gang la gzugs nyid yod pa de mig gi gzung bya yin no //
analyzed: gal te de lta na ni gang la gzugs nyid yod pa de mig gi gzung bya yin no //
translated: If that is so, then whatever exists as form is the object of the eye.

original: de lta bas na reg bya la sogs pa yang de bzhin du nges pa nyid kyis khyad par yod pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na reg bya la sogs pa yang de bzhin du nges pa nyid kyis khyad par yod pa yin no //
translated: Thus, since tangible objects, etc. are also definitely existent in that way, they are distinct.

original: de bzhin du gzugs la sogs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du gzugs la sogs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: But that is not so, because form, etc. do not exist in sound, etc.

original: rdzas la sogs pa la nges pa med par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: rdzas la sogs pa la nges pa med par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If that is so, then substance, etc. would not be definite.

original: de lta na ni mdo dang yang 'gal te /üîΩde med pa'i phyir mi 'khrul lo zhes gzugs nyid la sogs pa ni sgra la sogs pa la med pas mi 'khrul bar brjod kyi /
analyzed: de lta na ni mdo dang yang 'gal te / de med pa'i phyir mi 'khrul lo zhes gzugs nyid la sogs pa ni sgra la sogs pa la med pas mi 'khrul bar brjod kyi /
translated: If that is so, then you contradict the sutra,üîΩbecause it says that the eye, etc. are not confused because they do not exist in sound, etc.

original: gzugs la sogs pa yod pa'i sgo nas ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa yod pa'i sgo nas ni ma yin no //
translated: It does not say that they are not confused because form, etc. exist.

original: de dag ni rigs pa dang yang mi 'tsham ste /
analyzed: de dag ni rigs pa dang yang mi 'tsham ste /
translated: That is not reasonable.

original: dbang po gzhan gyi med pa la sogs par brtags nas gzung ba ni gzung ba ma yin na /
analyzed: dbang po gzhan gyi med pa la sogs par brtags nas gzung ba ni gzung ba ma yin na /
translated: If the eye, etc. are not apprehended because they are not apprehended by other faculties,

original: gzung bas stong pa de ji ltar gzugs nyid la sogs pas sbyor bar bya ste /
analyzed: gzung bas stong pa de ji ltar gzugs nyid la sogs pas sbyor bar bya ste /
translated: how can that which is empty of apprehension be connected with form, etc.?

original: gal te rgyu med par 'dzin pa med pa'o zhe na /
analyzed: gal te rgyu med par 'dzin pa med pa'o zhe na /
translated: If you say that the apprehension of causelessness is nonapprehension,

original: de'i phyir gzugs la sogs pa'i rang gi yul la nges pa nyid ni sbyor bar mi bya ba nyid do //
analyzed: de'i phyir gzugs la sogs pa'i rang gi yul la nges pa nyid ni sbyor bar mi bya ba nyid do //
translated: then you should not apply the term ‚Äúdefinite‚Äù to the object, form, etc.

original: gal te 'di ltar rdzas la sogs pa la tha mi dad par 'dzin pa mi mthong ba de ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: gal te 'di ltar rdzas la sogs pa la tha mi dad par 'dzin pa mi mthong ba de ji lta zhe na /
translated: If you say that the apprehension of the object as undifferentiated from substance, etc. is not seen, how is that?

original: gzhan gyi yul /
analyzed: gzhan gyi yul /
translated: The object of the other is

original: mig ni reg par bya ba dag las tha dad pa'i yul la dmigs pa ste /üîΩgzhan nyid dang lhan cig rgyu ba'i @21a * //
analyzed: mig ni reg par bya ba dag las tha dad pa'i yul la dmigs pa ste / gzhan nyid dang lhan cig rgyu ba'i @21a * //
translated: the eye, which is the object of the operation of the eye, which is different from the object of touch.

original: spyi'i yul la tha mi dad du 'dzin pa'i dran pa'i shes pa skyes pa yin gyi /
analyzed: spyi'i yul la tha mi dad du 'dzin pa'i dran pa'i shes pa skyes pa yin gyi /
translated: The memory consciousness, which is generated by the operation of the eye and the object of touch, has a general object, and it apprehends it as undifferentiated.

original: gzugs la sogs pa gzung ba ni ma yin te /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa gzung ba ni ma yin te /
translated: It does not apprehend form, etc.,

original: de'i blo med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i blo med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the cognition of that does not exist.

original: de bzhin du khyad par med pa'i phyir dbang po rang rang gis yul tha dad la dmigs shing don gzhan rnam par gcad pa'i yul la tha mi dad kyi blo skyes pa ni thams cad du yid kyi shes pa yin gyi yod pa nyid dang yon tan nyid
analyzed: de bzhin du khyad par med pa'i phyir dbang po rang rang gis yul tha dad la dmigs shing don gzhan rnam par gcad pa'i yul la tha mi dad kyi blo skyes pa ni thams cad du yid kyi shes pa yin gyi yod pa nyid dang yon tan nyid
translated: In the same way, because there is no difference, the mind that arises in regard to an object that is not different from the object of a specific sense faculty that observes a different object and eliminates other objects is in all cases mental consciousness.üîΩ

original: dag las skyes pa'i mngon sum ni ma yin te /
analyzed: dag las skyes pa'i mngon sum ni ma yin te /
translated: In the same way, because there is no difference, the mind that arises in regard to an object that is not different from the object of a specific sense faculty that is observed by a specific sense faculty and that excludes other objects is in all cases mental consciousness, and not direct perception that arises from existence and quality.

original: de nye bar ma mtshon pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de nye bar ma mtshon pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not indicated.

original: mngon sum gyis gzung ngo snyam pa'i nga rgyal de dag ni rtog ge ngan pa rnams kyi yin no //
analyzed: mngon sum gyis gzung ngo snyam pa'i nga rgyal de dag ni rtog ge ngan pa rnams kyi yin no //
translated: The pride that thinks ‚ÄúI apprehend by direct perception‚Äù is the pride of those who are bad logicians.

original: yul de mtshungs par 'dod ce na ;
analyzed: yul de mtshungs par 'dod ce na ;
translated: If you assert that the object is similar,

original: 'di ltar 'gyur te khyad par du byed pa dang khyad par du bya ba dag ni dbang po'i yul du mtshungs par khas blang par bya ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'gyur te khyad par du byed pa dang khyad par du bya ba dag ni dbang po'i yul du mtshungs par khas blang par bya ste /
translated: it would be like this: The specific characteristic and the characterized by the specific characteristic must be asserted to be similar objects of the sense faculties.

original: de mi 'dzin pa ni de'i blo med pa'i phyir ro zhe na de lta yin na ni /
analyzed: de mi 'dzin pa ni de'i blo med pa'i phyir ro zhe na de lta yin na ni /
translated: If you say, ‚ÄúBecause if they are not apprehended, there is no cognition of them,‚Äù then in that case,

original: mi 'dod pa la'ang thal bar 'gyur //
analyzed: mi 'dod pa la'ang thal bar 'gyur //
translated: the consequence is that even what is not desired is apprehended.

original: gal te gnyis ka dbang po'i gzung bya nyid du mtshungs pa yin na ni /
analyzed: gal te gnyis ka dbang po'i gzung bya nyid du mtshungs pa yin na ni /
translated: If both are alike in being objects of the sense faculties,

original: rdzas dang yon tan dang las dag rdzas dang ldan pa yin pa'i phyir yod pa nyid bzhin rdzas dbang po thams cad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rdzas dang yon tan dang las dag rdzas dang ldan pa yin pa'i phyir yod pa nyid bzhin rdzas dbang po thams cad par 'gyur ro //
translated: then, because substance, quality, and action are possessed by substance, existence would be like substance, i.e., possessed by all the sense faculties.

original: de bzhin du rdzas gcig dang ldan pa'i phyir rdzas yod pa nyid ma yin pa bzhin dbang po thams cad pa yin pa'i phyir yod pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du rdzas gcig dang ldan pa'i phyir rdzas yod pa nyid ma yin pa bzhin dbang po thams cad pa yin pa'i phyir yod pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: And, because it is possessed by one substance, existence would not be like substance, i.e., possessed by all the sense faculties.

original: gal te rdzas la zhugs pa'i yod pa ni rdzas gcig po de dang ldan par brjod do zhe na /
analyzed: gal te rdzas la zhugs pa'i yod pa ni rdzas gcig po de dang ldan par brjod do zhe na /
translated: If you say that existence that inheres in substance is said to be possessed by that one substance,

original: ma yin te tha dad pa med pa'i phyir yod pa dang tha mi dad pa yin no //
analyzed: ma yin te tha dad pa med pa'i phyir yod pa dang tha mi dad pa yin no //
translated: no, because it is not different from existence, it is not different from that which inheres in substance.

original: thams cad du yod pa la rdzas la sogs pa dgag par bya ba ni ma yin te /
analyzed: thams cad du yod pa la rdzas la sogs pa dgag par bya ba ni ma yin te /
translated: Existence is not to be denied in all cases, such as in substance.

original: de skad du yang /
analyzed: de skad du yang /
translated: As it is said:

original: las dang yon tan la yod phyir //
analyzed: las dang yon tan la yod phyir //
translated: Because it exists in action and quality,

original: yod pa las min yon tan min ;üîΩ/ zhes brjod do //
analyzed: yod pa las min yon tan min ;üîΩ/ zhes brjod do //
translated: it is not from existence, nor is it a quality.

original: gal te yang rdzas la zhugs pa rdzas nyid gcig yin gyi gzhan la zhugs pa rdzas gcig ma yin no zhes zer ba ni rdzas tha dad du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te yang rdzas la zhugs pa rdzas nyid gcig yin gyi gzhan la zhugs pa rdzas gcig ma yin no zhes zer ba ni rdzas tha dad du 'gyur ro //
translated: If you say that the substance that is engaged with is the same substance, but the substance that is disengaged is not the same substance, then they would be different substances.

original: gang gi tshe mig gis mngon sum gyis mi 'dre'o zhes 'dzin pa de'i tshe reg bya yang mig gi gzung byar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang gi tshe mig gis mngon sum gyis mi 'dre'o zhes 'dzin pa de'i tshe reg bya yang mig gi gzung byar 'gyur ro //
translated: When the eye sense faculty directly apprehends that it is not engaged with, at that time the tangible object would also be the object of the eye sense faculty.

original: de'i phyir yod pa nyid dang yon tan nyid bzhin dbang po tha dad kyi gzung bya nyid yin yang rdzas tha mi dad do zhes pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir yod pa nyid dang yon tan nyid bzhin dbang po tha dad kyi gzung bya nyid yin yang rdzas tha mi dad do zhes pa ni ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, just as being an existent and being a quality are objects of different sense faculties, but they are not different substances.

original: gal te de ltar dbang po tha dad kyi gzung bya yin pa'i phyir yang gzhan nyid du smra ba yin na ni /
analyzed: gal te de ltar dbang po tha dad kyi gzung bya yin pa'i phyir yang gzhan nyid du smra ba yin na ni /
translated: If you say that they are different because they are objects of different sense faculties,

original: ma nges dbang po gcig gi gzung bya la yang rdzas dang yon tan dang las kyi @21b tha dad dang / sngon po la sogs pa'i tha dad mthong ste /
analyzed: ma nges dbang po gcig gi gzung bya la yang rdzas dang yon tan dang las kyi @21b tha dad dang / sngon po la sogs pa'i tha dad mthong ste /
translated: then it is not definite, because even with respect to the object of a single sense faculty, one sees a difference in substance, quality, and action.

original: dbang po tha dad med kyang sngon po la sogs pa'i tha dad du 'dzin pa mthong ngo //
analyzed: dbang po tha dad med kyang sngon po la sogs pa'i tha dad du 'dzin pa mthong ngo //
translated: One sees a difference in blue and so on, but one does not see a difference in sense faculties.

original: gang zhig gang med kyang 'byung ba de ni de'i rgyu ma yin pa'i phyir dbang po tha dad ni gzhan nyid kyi rgyu ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gang zhig gang med kyang 'byung ba de ni de'i rgyu ma yin pa'i phyir dbang po tha dad ni gzhan nyid kyi rgyu ma yin no zhe na /
translated: But if something arises even though something else does not exist, then the latter is not the cause of the former. Therefore, the difference of sense faculties is not the cause of difference.

original: de ni gzhan du brjod /
analyzed: de ni gzhan du brjod /
translated: That is expressed as ‚Äúother.‚Äù

original: dbang po tha dad kyi gzung bya yin pa'i phyir zhes pas ni du ma nyid du brjod pa yin gyi /
analyzed: dbang po tha dad kyi gzung bya yin pa'i phyir zhes pas ni du ma nyid du brjod pa yin gyi /
translated: Since it is the object of different sense faculties, it is expressed as ‚Äúmany.‚Äù

original: dbang po gcig gi gzung bya yin pa'i phyir gcig tu ma yin na gang las ma nges par 'gyur /
analyzed: dbang po gcig gi gzung bya yin pa'i phyir gcig tu ma yin na gang las ma nges par 'gyur /
translated: But since it is the object of a single sense faculty, it is not expressed as ‚Äúone.‚Äù

original: dbang po tha dad kyi gzung bya yin pa kho nas du ma nyid brjod pa ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: dbang po tha dad kyi gzung bya yin pa kho nas du ma nyid brjod pa ni ma yin gyi /
translated: It is not that difference is expressed only because it is the object of different sense faculties.

original: 'on kyang du ma nyid kho na yin pa'i phyir ma nges pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang du ma nyid kho na yin pa'i phyir ma nges pa ma yin no //
translated: But since it is many, it is not indeterminate.

original: dbang po tha dad med kyang zhes gang brjod pa 'dis /
analyzed: dbang po tha dad med kyang zhes gang brjod pa 'dis /
translated: As for the expression ‚Äúeven though there is no difference of sense faculties,‚Äù

original: thams cad bsgrub byar brjod ma yin //
analyzed: thams cad bsgrub byar brjod ma yin //
translated: it does not express that all are the object of a single sense faculty.

original: dbang po thams cad kyi tha dad las du mar brjod pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: dbang po thams cad kyi tha dad las du mar brjod pa ni ma yin te /
translated: It does not express that all are many because of the difference of all sense faculties.

original: gang dbang po tha dad pa de du ma kho na'o zhes yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang dbang po tha dad pa de du ma kho na'o zhes yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: But since that which is different sense faculties is only many, it is not indeterminate.

original: blo tha dad kyang gzhan gyi rgyu yin pas ni mi 'gegs so //
analyzed: blo tha dad kyang gzhan gyi rgyu yin pas ni mi 'gegs so //
translated: But we do not deny that the other is the cause of the cognition, even though the two are different.

original: gzhan yang blo dbang tha dad las tha dad //
analyzed: gzhan yang blo dbang tha dad las tha dad //
translated: Moreover, the cognition is different from the sense faculty.

original: gang la gcig yin gzhan du na //üîΩdbang po yang tha dad blo yang tha dad pa las gzhan nyid du mi brjod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang la gcig yin gzhan du na // dbang po yang tha dad blo yang tha dad pa las gzhan nyid du mi brjod par 'gyur ro //
translated: And when one is different from the other,üîΩthe sense faculty is different from the cognition, and we do not say that they are different.

original: dbang po yang tha dad blo yang tha dad pa de la ni gcig nyid yin no zhes pa'i go skabs med do //
analyzed: dbang po yang tha dad blo yang tha dad pa de la ni gcig nyid yin no zhes pa'i go skabs med do //
translated: And when the sense faculty is different from the cognition, there is no opportunity for saying that they are the same.

original: de dag gi yon tan la sogs pa la mngon sum gyis shes pa skye ba la yang gsal bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de dag gi yon tan la sogs pa la mngon sum gyis shes pa skye ba la yang gsal bar rig par bya'o //
translated: And we should understand that the arising of the cognition of the qualities of those sense faculties is also clear.

original: de dag gis ni rang gi rten dang 'brel ba'i sgo nas gzhi la sogs pa dang phrad pa nyid brjod pa yin te /
analyzed: de dag gis ni rang gi rten dang 'brel ba'i sgo nas gzhi la sogs pa dang phrad pa nyid brjod pa yin te /
translated: They say that the sense faculties contact their objects in the sense that they are related to them in the sense of being their substrata.

original: de lta na yang thams cad du phrad pa las shes pa skye ba ni ma yin no zhes rigs pa can gyis mngon sum brtags par ji lta ba bzhin du brjod zin to //
analyzed: de lta na yang thams cad du phrad pa las shes pa skye ba ni ma yin no zhes rigs pa can gyis mngon sum brtags par ji lta ba bzhin du brjod zin to //
translated: But even so, we have already explained, in the examination of perception in the NyƒÅyamukha, that cognition does not arise from contact with all objects.

original: de'i phyir bye brag pa'i mngon sum ni sgrub par dka'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir bye brag pa'i mngon sum ni sgrub par dka'o //
translated: Therefore, the perception of the Vai≈õe·π£ikas is difficult to establish.

original: ser skya ba rnams kyis ni rna ba la sogs pa'i 'jug pa mngon sum du 'dod do //
analyzed: ser skya ba rnams kyis ni rna ba la sogs pa'i 'jug pa mngon sum du 'dod do //
translated: The SƒÅ·πÉkhyas assert that the engagement of the ear and so on is perception.

original: rna ba dang pags pa dang mig dang lce dang sna rnams yid kyis byin gyis brlabs nas yul la 'jug pa ste /
analyzed: rna ba dang pags pa dang mig dang lce dang sna rnams yid kyis byin gyis brlabs nas yul la 'jug pa ste /
translated: The ear, skin, eyes, tongue, and nose, empowered by the mind, engage their objects.

original: sgra dang reg bya dang gzugs dang ro dang dri da ltar ba rnams la go rims bzhin du 'dzin pa ni mngon sum gyi tshad ma'o zhes so //
analyzed: sgra dang reg bya dang gzugs dang ro dang dri da ltar ba rnams la go rims bzhin du 'dzin pa ni mngon sum gyi tshad ma'o zhes so //
translated: The apprehension of sound, touch, form, taste, and smell in the present is the valid knowledge of perception.

original: de dag gi ltar na yang dbang po rnams kyi thug pa med pa'am /üîΩde dag gis ni dbang po gzhan gyi gzung bya yul ma yin pa nyid kyis rang gi yul la 'jug pa'i dbang po 'dod pa yin la yon tan gsum gyi 'phel ba dang 'grib @22a * //
analyzed: de dag gi ltar na yang dbang po rnams kyi thug pa med pa'am / de dag gis ni dbang po gzhan gyi gzung bya yul ma yin pa nyid kyis rang gi yul la 'jug pa'i dbang po 'dod pa yin la yon tan gsum gyi 'phel ba dang 'grib @22a * //
translated: According to them, the faculties are infinite,

original: pa tsam gyis tha dad las sgra la sogs pa'i rigs tha dad ces 'dod de /
analyzed: pa tsam gyis tha dad las sgra la sogs pa'i rigs tha dad ces 'dod de /
translated: or they assert that the faculties engage their objects by not being objects apprehended by other faculties, and they assert that the different types of sound and so on are different by the mere increase and decrease of the three qualities.

original: sgra gcig pu yang yon tan gyi 'phel 'grib kyi tha dad kyis thug pa med pa'i phyir dbang po dpag tu med pas 'dzin par khas blang bar bya'o //
analyzed: sgra gcig pu yang yon tan gyi 'phel 'grib kyi tha dad kyis thug pa med pa'i phyir dbang po dpag tu med pas 'dzin par khas blang bar bya'o //
translated: Since even a single sound is not exhausted by the differences of the increase and decrease of its qualities, it must be accepted that it is apprehended by an infinite number of sense faculties.

original: yang na dbang gcig 'gyur /
analyzed: yang na dbang gcig 'gyur /
translated: Or, one sense faculty would be all.

original: ci ste der yon tan gsum tha mi dad pas rigs gcig nyid yin na ni de ltar na sgra tha dad 'dzin pa bzhin reg pa la sogs pa'ang 'dzin par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir dbang po gcig nyid du 'gyur te /
analyzed: ci ste der yon tan gsum tha mi dad pas rigs gcig nyid yin na ni de ltar na sgra tha dad 'dzin pa bzhin reg pa la sogs pa'ang 'dzin par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir dbang po gcig nyid du 'gyur te /
translated: But if the three qualities are not different in that sound, then just as it apprehends the difference of sound, it would also apprehend the difference of touch, etc., and therefore one sense faculty would apprehend all objects.

original: thams cad du yon tan gsum po tha mi dad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thams cad du yon tan gsum po tha mi dad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the three qualities are not different in all objects.

original: yon tan gsum dang bral ba'i sgra'i rigs ni yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: yon tan gsum dang bral ba'i sgra'i rigs ni yod pa ma yin no //
translated: There is no sound class that is devoid of the three qualities.

original: gang sgra nyid du gyur pa de ni reg bya la sogs pa la ma yin no //
analyzed: gang sgra nyid du gyur pa de ni reg bya la sogs pa la ma yin no //
translated: That which is sound is not touch, etc.

original: gang gi tshe snying stobs la sogs pa'i dbyibs kyis gnas skabs kyi tha dad kyi sgra la sogs pa dag tha dad pa ji ltar med /
analyzed: gang gi tshe snying stobs la sogs pa'i dbyibs kyis gnas skabs kyi tha dad kyi sgra la sogs pa dag tha dad pa ji ltar med /
translated: When the state of sound, etc. is different due to the shape of sattva, etc., how can they be undifferentiated?

original: sgra'i rigs tha mi dad par mtshungs pa'i dbyibs kyi gnas skabs ni yod pa yin la /üîΩreg pa la sogs rnams las tha dad pa ste /
analyzed: sgra'i rigs tha mi dad par mtshungs pa'i dbyibs kyi gnas skabs ni yod pa yin la / reg pa la sogs rnams las tha dad pa ste /
translated: The shape of the different types of sound is not different from sound.

original: rigs mthun pa'i gzung bar bya ba'i yul la rna ba 'jug pa yin no //
analyzed: rigs mthun pa'i gzung bar bya ba'i yul la rna ba 'jug pa yin no //
translated: The ear engages its object, sound, which is a homogeneous object to be grasped, separately from tangible objects and so on.

original: de bzhin du reg pa la sogs pa la yang ngo //
analyzed: de bzhin du reg pa la sogs pa la yang ngo //
translated: The same applies to tangible objects and so on.

original: de'i phyir ji skad du brjod pa'i skyon du thal bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: de'i phyir ji skad du brjod pa'i skyon du thal bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: Therefore, the error stated previously does not arise.

original: de lta na yang reg bya ni mig gi mthun pa'i yul du 'gyur te //
analyzed: de lta na yang reg bya ni mig gi mthun pa'i yul du 'gyur te //
translated: Even so, tangible objects would be the object of the eye because shape is grasped by both.üîΩShape is grasped by both the eye and the body because the consciousnesses of both see the shape of a mountain and so on.

original: gang phyir dbyibs ni gnyis kyi gzung byar ri bo la sogs pa'i dbyibs la mig dang reg bya dag gi shes pa mthong ba'i phyir rang gi yul de kho nar 'jug go zhes pa ni rnam par gsal te /
analyzed: gang phyir dbyibs ni gnyis kyi gzung byar ri bo la sogs pa'i dbyibs la mig dang reg bya dag gi shes pa mthong ba'i phyir rang gi yul de kho nar 'jug go zhes pa ni rnam par gsal te /
translated: It is clear that the eye engages its object alone.

original: dbyibs kyis byas pa'i rigs kyi bye brag 'dod pa'i ltar na ni sgra la sogs pa ni rna ba la sogs pas mi 'dzin par 'gyur te /
analyzed: dbyibs kyis byas pa'i rigs kyi bye brag 'dod pa'i ltar na ni sgra la sogs pa ni rna ba la sogs pas mi 'dzin par 'gyur te /
translated: If shape is asserted to be a type of form created by shape, sound and so on would not be apprehended by the ear and so on.

original: gang gi phyir zhe na /
analyzed: gang gi phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: dbyibs ni gsum gyi spyod yul min //
analyzed: dbyibs ni gsum gyi spyod yul min //
translated: Shape is not the domain of the three.

original: dbyibs ni rna ba dang sna dang lce rnams kyis gzung bar bya ba ma yin pas /
analyzed: dbyibs ni rna ba dang sna dang lce rnams kyis gzung bar bya ba ma yin pas /
translated: Shape is not perceived by the ear, nose, or tongue.

original: mthong bzhin pa'i sgra dang dri dang ro rnams mngon sum ma yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mthong bzhin pa'i sgra dang dri dang ro rnams mngon sum ma yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: Sound, smell, and taste that are seen would not be directly perceived.

original: yul gcig la dbyibs mang po 'thob par yang 'gyur te /
analyzed: yul gcig la dbyibs mang po 'thob par yang 'gyur te /
translated: And many shapes would be obtained in one object.

original: dbang po gcig gi yul gyi dbye ba yod na ni de'i bye brag gi rigs du ma yod pa'i phyir yul gcig tu dbyibs du ma mthong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dbang po gcig gi yul gyi dbye ba yod na ni de'i bye brag gi rigs du ma yod pa'i phyir yul gcig tu dbyibs du ma mthong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If there were a difference in the object of one sense faculty, then because there would be many different types of it, many shapes would be seen in one object.

original: dbyibs rnams la khyad par med par mtshungs pa'i phyir gser la sogs pa'i skyogs rnams dang rgyan rnams kyi tha dad kyang med @22b par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dbyibs rnams la khyad par med par mtshungs pa'i phyir gser la sogs pa'i skyogs rnams dang rgyan rnams kyi tha dad kyang med @22b par 'gyur ro //
translated: And there would be no difference between a golden vessel and a golden ornament, because the shapes are the same.

original: dbyibs mtshungs par yod pa'i phyir gser dang sgra dang rdzas la sogs pa rnams kyang mtshungs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dbyibs mtshungs par yod pa'i phyir gser dang sgra dang rdzas la sogs pa rnams kyang mtshungs par 'gyur ro //
translated: And gold, sound, substance, and so on would be the same, because they exist with the same shape.

original: de bzhin du rang rang gi yul la 'jug pa yang mi 'gyur /
analyzed: de bzhin du rang rang gi yul la 'jug pa yang mi 'gyur /
translated: And they would not engage their own objects.

original: ci dbang po'i 'jug pas rigs rang tsam 'dzin par byed dam /
analyzed: ci dbang po'i 'jug pas rigs rang tsam 'dzin par byed dam /
translated: Do they apprehend just the mere type of object by engaging the object‚Äôs sense faculty?

original: bde ba la sogs pa'i khyad par du byas pa'i rigs 'dzin par byed /
analyzed: bde ba la sogs pa'i khyad par du byas pa'i rigs 'dzin par byed /
translated: Do the sense faculties apprehend just the mere type of object, or do they apprehend the type of object as qualified by pleasure and so on?

original: gal te rigs rang tsam 'dzin na ni don gyi rang bzhin 'dzin par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te rigs rang tsam 'dzin na ni don gyi rang bzhin 'dzin par mi 'gyur te /
translated: If they apprehend just the mere type of object, then they do not apprehend the nature of the object.

original: des ni dbyibs tsam 'dzin pa yin pas na sgra la sogs pa rnams kyi bde ba la sogs pa'i rang bzhin ma nges par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des ni dbyibs tsam 'dzin pa yin pas na sgra la sogs pa rnams kyi bde ba la sogs pa'i rang bzhin ma nges par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Since they apprehend just the shape, it follows that the nature of sound and so on is not ascertained.

original: dbyibs tsam 'dzin pa nyid yin no ;
analyzed: dbyibs tsam 'dzin pa nyid yin no ;
translated: They do not apprehend the mere shape.

original: / don gyi bye brag 'dzin par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: / don gyi bye brag 'dzin par mi 'gyur te /
translated: They do not apprehend the particular of the object.

original: gang gi dbyibs tsam gyi snang ba cung zad la dmigs kyi don yul gyi rang gi ngo bo la mi dmigs pas so //

analyzed: sgra la sogs pa'i bye brag kyang mi 'dzin par 'gyur ro //
translated: They do not apprehend the particular of sound and so on.üîΩThey do not apprehend the particular of sound and so on.üîΩThey do not apprehend the particular of sound and so on.üîΩThey do not apprehend the particular of sound and so on.üîΩThey do not apprehend the particular of sound and so on.üîΩThey do not apprehend the particular of sound and so on.üîΩThey do not apprehend the particular of sound and so on.üîΩThey do not apprehend the particular of sound and so on.üîΩThey do not apprehend the particular of sound and so on.üîΩThey do not apprehend the particular of sound and so on.üîΩThey do not apprehend the particular of sound and so on.üîΩThey do not apprehend the particular of sound and so on.üîΩThey do not apprehend the particular of sound and so on.üîΩThey do not apprehend the particular of sound and so on.üîΩThey do not apprehend the particular of sound and so on.üîΩThey do not apprehend the particular of sound and so on.üîΩThey do not apprehend the particular of sound and so on.üîΩThey do not apprehend the particular of sound and so on.üîΩThey do not apprehend the particular of sound and so on.üîΩThey do not apprehend the particular of sound and so on.üîΩThey do not apprehend the particular of sound and so on.üîΩThey do not apprehend the particular of sound and so on.üîΩThey do not apprehend the particular of sound and so on.üîΩThey do not apprehend the particular of sound and so on.üîΩThey do not apprehend the particular of sound and so on.üîΩThey do not apprehend the particular of sound and so on.üîΩThey do not apprehend the particular of sound and so on.

original: de bzhin du pi wang gi sgra dang rnga'i sgra zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i bye brag kyang mi 'dzin par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de bzhin du pi wang gi sgra dang rnga'i sgra zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i bye brag kyang mi 'dzin par 'gyur te /
translated: They do not apprehend the particular of sound and so on.üîΩThey do not

original: de dbyibs gzhan mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dbyibs gzhan mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is impossible for a shape to be different from that.

original: don 'dzin no zhe na yang /
analyzed: don 'dzin no zhe na yang /
translated: If you say that it apprehends an object,

original: yid bzhin rnam par rtog pa yin //
analyzed: yid bzhin rnam par rtog pa yin //
translated: then the mind is a conceptual

original: rang gi don khyad par can du byed na yang khyad par de 'dzin pa na yid kyi 'jug pa bzhin du rang gi yul la rtog pa dang bcas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rang gi don khyad par can du byed na yang khyad par de 'dzin pa na yid kyi 'jug pa bzhin du rang gi yul la rtog pa dang bcas par 'gyur ro //
translated: If it makes a specific object its own, then, like the operation of the mind, it will be conceptual with regard to its own object, when it apprehends that specific object.

original: ci ste bde ba la sogs pas khyad par du byas pa'i dbyibs 'dzin ni /
analyzed: ci ste bde ba la sogs pas khyad par du byas pa'i dbyibs 'dzin ni /
translated: If you say that it apprehends a shape qualified by pleasure, etc.,

original: de lta na yang gnas skabs de'i yid kyi 'jug pa bzhin du rnam par rtog pa nyid do zhes bya ba'i don to //üîΩbde ba la sogs pa yang so sor 'dzin par byed dam /
analyzed: de lta na yang gnas skabs de'i yid kyi 'jug pa bzhin du rnam par rtog pa nyid do zhes bya ba'i don to // bde ba la sogs pa yang so sor 'dzin par byed dam /
translated: then, like the operation of the mind in that situation, it will be conceptual.üîΩDo you say that it apprehends pleasure, etc.,

original: sdom pa yang 'dzin par 'gyur grang /
analyzed: sdom pa yang 'dzin par 'gyur grang /
translated: individually or collectively?

original: de la re zhig so sor ni mi 'dzin te /
analyzed: de la re zhig so sor ni mi 'dzin te /
translated: First, it does not apprehend them individually,

original: rang gi yul la 'dzin pa la sogs pa'i dbang po'i 'jug pa ni sgra la sogs pa'i gzung bar bya ba la yin gyi /
analyzed: rang gi yul la 'dzin pa la sogs pa'i dbang po'i 'jug pa ni sgra la sogs pa'i gzung bar bya ba la yin gyi /
translated: because the operation of the sense faculties, such as the apprehension of their own objects, is with regard to objects such as sound, etc.,

original: snying stobs la sogs pa la ni ma yin no //
analyzed: snying stobs la sogs pa la ni ma yin no //
translated: but not with regard to sattva, etc.

original: snying stobs la sogs pa dang sgra la sogs pa'i rang bzhin so so ni ma yin no //
analyzed: snying stobs la sogs pa dang sgra la sogs pa'i rang bzhin so so ni ma yin no //
translated: The nature of each of the qualities, such as sound, is not the nature of the other qualities, such as courage.

original: de'i phyir de dag rnams rna ba la sogs pa'i 'jug pa'i gzung bar bya ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir de dag rnams rna ba la sogs pa'i 'jug pa'i gzung bar bya ba ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, they are not objects apprehended by the ear, etc.

original: gzhan min zhe na /
analyzed: gzhan min zhe na /
translated: If you say they are not different,

original: snying stobs la sogs pa sgra la sogs pa las gzhan nyid ni ma yin te /
analyzed: snying stobs la sogs pa sgra la sogs pa las gzhan nyid ni ma yin te /
translated: the qualities, such as courage, are not different from sound, etc.

original: de yang gzung bar bya ba yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de yang gzung bar bya ba yin no zhe na /
translated: If they are not different, they are objects apprehended.

original: 'bras min pa'am /
analyzed: 'bras min pa'am /
translated: If they are not effects,

original: gal te snying stobs la sogs pa sgra las gzhan ma yin na ni tha mi @23a * //
analyzed: gal te snying stobs la sogs pa sgra las gzhan ma yin na ni tha mi @23a * //
translated: if the qualities, such as courage, are not different from sound, etc., they are not different from the body.

original: dad kyi lus kyi sgra la sogs pa 'bras bu ma yin la /
analyzed: dad kyi lus kyi sgra la sogs pa 'bras bu ma yin la /
translated: Sound, etc., are not effects of the body.

original: snying stobs la sogs pa la yang sgra la sogs pa'i rgyu ma yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: snying stobs la sogs pa la yang sgra la sogs pa'i rgyu ma yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: Courage, etc., are not causes of sound, etc.

original: snying stobs sgra'i rang bzhin du rnam par gzhag par byas nas ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang brjod pa de yang 'gal bar 'gyur ro ;
analyzed: snying stobs sgra'i rang bzhin du rnam par gzhag par byas nas ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang brjod pa de yang 'gal bar 'gyur ro ;
translated: The statement, ‚ÄúHaving established courage, etc., as the nature of sound, etc.,‚Äù is contradicted.

original: / snying stobs la sogs pa phan tshun tha mi dad de sgra la sogs pa dang gcig pa nyid du 'gyur na ni tha mi dad kyi rang bzhin yin pas rgyu dang 'bras bu dag tu 'dod pa la gnod do zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni'am zhes
analyzed: / snying stobs la sogs pa phan tshun tha mi dad de sgra la sogs pa dang gcig pa nyid du 'gyur na ni tha mi dad kyi rang bzhin yin pas rgyu dang 'bras bu dag tu 'dod pa la gnod do zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni'am zhes
translated: If sound and so on were not different from pleasure and so on, then they would be one, and since they would have the same nature, the assertion of cause and effect would be undermined.

original: brtag pa'i sgra'i don yin no //
analyzed: brtag pa'i sgra'i don yin no //
translated: The meaning of the word ‚Äúor‚Äù is to consider this.

original: gzhan yang / gzhan nyid min na gzung bya min //
analyzed: gzhan yang / gzhan nyid min na gzung bya min //
translated: Moreover: If they are not different, they are not apprehended.

original: gal te yang bde ba la sogs pa sgra la sogs pa las gzhan ma yin pa de lta na ni so sor gzung bar bya bar mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: gal te yang bde ba la sogs pa sgra la sogs pa las gzhan ma yin pa de lta na ni so sor gzung bar bya bar mi 'gyur la /
translated: If pleasure and so on are not different from sound and so on, then they would not be apprehended individually.

original: rdul phra rab kyang gzung bar bya bar mi 'gyur zhing de la tsam la sogs pa yang ngo //
analyzed: rdul phra rab kyang gzung bar bya bar mi 'gyur zhing de la tsam la sogs pa yang ngo //
translated: The subtle particle would not be apprehended, and so on.

original: gang don gzhan ma yin pa'i dbang po'i yul de thams cad dbang po'i yul ma yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang don gzhan ma yin pa'i dbang po'i yul de thams cad dbang po'i yul ma yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: If something is not a different object, then it is not an object of the sense faculties.

original: 'bras bu nyid la sogs par 'dzin pa ni spyi'i yul can nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'bras bu nyid la sogs par 'dzin pa ni spyi'i yul can nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The apprehension of the effect and so on would be the subject of a universal.

original: de ltar na re zhig so sor ni mi 'dzin to //
analyzed: de ltar na re zhig so sor ni mi 'dzin to //
translated: Thus, they are not grasped individually.

original: ci ste sdom pa la 'dzin na ni de lta na yang dbang po thams cad 'jug par 'gyur te sna tshogs rnam par ro //
analyzed: ci ste sdom pa la 'dzin na ni de lta na yang dbang po thams cad 'jug par 'gyur te sna tshogs rnam par ro //
translated: But if they are grasped as a collection, then in that case all the sense faculties would be engaged, because the object is manifold.

original: sna tshogs kyi rnam pa'i gzung bya ba la tha mi dad pa'i rnam par 'dzin pa ni 'thad pa ma yin te /
analyzed: sna tshogs kyi rnam pa'i gzung bya ba la tha mi dad pa'i rnam par 'dzin pa ni 'thad pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not tenable that the grasping is undifferentiated with regard to the manifold objects that are grasped,

original: de'i dbang gis gzung bar bya ba yongs su bcad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i dbang gis gzung bar bya ba yongs su bcad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the object is delimited by the sense faculty.

original: sgra la sogs pa la tha mi dad par 'dzin pa yang mthong ngo //
analyzed: sgra la sogs pa la tha mi dad par 'dzin pa yang mthong ngo //
translated: And the grasping of sound, etc., is also seen to be undifferentiated.

original: bde ba la sogs pa'i yul nyid kyang mtshungs par 'gyur /
analyzed: bde ba la sogs pa'i yul nyid kyang mtshungs par 'gyur /
translated: And the objects of pleasure, etc., would be the same.

original: dbang po rnams kyi yul nyid mtshungs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dbang po rnams kyi yul nyid mtshungs par 'gyur ro //
translated: The objects of the sense faculties would be the same.

original: dbang po rnams rang gi yul la 'jug par mi 'gyur te bde ba la sogs pa yul gzhan la rigs kyi bye brag yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dbang po rnams rang gi yul la 'jug par mi 'gyur te bde ba la sogs pa yul gzhan la rigs kyi bye brag yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The sense faculties would not engage their own objects, because pleasure, etc., are of a different type with regard to other objects.

original: de lta na yang dbang po gcig nyid du thal par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta na yang dbang po gcig nyid du thal par 'gyur ro //
translated: And in that case, it would follow, absurdly, that there would be only one sense faculty.

original: ma yin te rang rang gi dbyibs kyis khyad par du byas pa 'dzin no zhes brjod do zhe na /
analyzed: ma yin te rang rang gi dbyibs kyis khyad par du byas pa 'dzin no zhes brjod do zhe na /
translated: But it is said that the mind apprehends the shape of each object.

original: de skad du ni brjod na rigs par ni mi brjod de /
analyzed: de skad du ni brjod na rigs par ni mi brjod de /
translated: If that is said, it is not reasonable to say that,

original: gang gi phyir du mar 'dzin phyir gzugs kyi rigs gcig la yang dbyibs tha dad kyi sgo nas du mar 'dzin par byed pa yin gyi dbyibs gcig @23b gi rjes su zhugs nas 'dzin pa ni ma mthong ngo //
analyzed: gang gi phyir du mar 'dzin phyir gzugs kyi rigs gcig la yang dbyibs tha dad kyi sgo nas du mar 'dzin par byed pa yin gyi dbyibs gcig @23b gi rjes su zhugs nas 'dzin pa ni ma mthong ngo //
translated: because the mind apprehends many shapes, it apprehends many shapes of a single type of form, but it is not seen to apprehend by engaging a single shape.

original: der dbyibs kyi tha dad las rigs kyi tha dad 'dod na ni de nyid dbang po thug pa med par thal bar 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: der dbyibs kyi tha dad las rigs kyi tha dad 'dod na ni de nyid dbang po thug pa med par thal bar 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: If it is asserted that the difference of type is due to the difference of shape, then it follows that the sense faculties would be infinite.

original: 'di ni grangs can gyi bye brag las mi 'dod do //
analyzed: 'di ni grangs can gyi bye brag las mi 'dod do //
translated: This is not asserted by the SƒÅ·πÉkhya subsect.

original: sngon gyi ser skya pa'i lugs la 'das par smra ba grangs can phung bar byed pa'i ma rdum pa na re sgra'i mtshan nyid gsum pa las tha mi dad pa ma yin te /
analyzed: sngon gyi ser skya pa'i lugs la 'das par smra ba grangs can phung bar byed pa'i ma rdum pa na re sgra'i mtshan nyid gsum pa las tha mi dad pa ma yin te /
translated: The SƒÅ·πÉkhya who asserts the past as the former ·πõ·π£i Kapila‚Äôs system says: Sound is not different from the three qualities.

original: rigs gzhan nyid las ni ma yin pas reg bya la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid gsum po dbang po tha dad gzhan gyis gzung bar 'thad pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rigs gzhan nyid las ni ma yin pas reg bya la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid gsum po dbang po tha dad gzhan gyis gzung bar 'thad pa ma yin no //
translated: But it is not tenable that the three characteristics of tactile objects and so on are apprehended by different sense faculties.

original: de'i phyir bde ba la sogs pa rnams la tha dad yod pas dbang po rnams rang rang gi yul dbang byed par brjod do //
analyzed: de'i phyir bde ba la sogs pa rnams la tha dad yod pas dbang po rnams rang rang gi yul dbang byed par brjod do //
translated: Therefore, since pleasure and so on are different, the sense faculties are said to control their objects.

original: rang gi yul la 'jug pa'i dbang po rnams la tha mi dad pa'i rang gi bye brag yod pa yin pas dbang po rnams thug pa med par thal bar 'gyur ro zhes zer ro //
analyzed: rang gi yul la 'jug pa'i dbang po rnams la tha mi dad pa'i rang gi bye brag yod pa yin pas dbang po rnams thug pa med par thal bar 'gyur ro zhes zer ro //
translated: Since the sense faculties that engage their objects have their own distinct specific natures, it follows that the sense faculties are infinite.

original: gal te rigs kyi tha dad las kyang bde ba la sogs pa'i yul dbang po nus pa dang ldan par bya'o zhes sngon ma rnams las khyad par du byed pa lta na ni de bas kyang ches lhag par du kho bos smra bar bya ba nyid de /üîΩre re'i ngo bor thams cad ni //
analyzed: gal te rigs kyi tha dad las kyang bde ba la sogs pa'i yul dbang po nus pa dang ldan par bya'o zhes sngon ma rnams las khyad par du byed pa lta na ni de bas kyang ches lhag par du kho bos smra bar bya ba nyid de / re re'i ngo bor thams cad ni //
translated: If you say that the sense objects of pleasure and so on are controlled by the sense faculties that possess the capacity for specific types of objects, then I would say that this is even more so.üîΩAll are the nature of each

original: gtso bor rdul phran so sor yod //
analyzed: gtso bor rdul phran so sor yod //
translated: and the primary atom exists individually.

original: bde ba dang sdug bsngal dang gti mug dang sgra dang reg bya dang bya ba dag gis tha dad kyi rigs las tha dad pa'i gtso bo rdul phra rab thams cad du song ba yod do zhes brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: bde ba dang sdug bsngal dang gti mug dang sgra dang reg bya dang bya ba dag gis tha dad kyi rigs las tha dad pa'i gtso bo rdul phra rab thams cad du song ba yod do zhes brjod par bya'o //
translated: Pleasure, pain, error, sound, touch, and action are different, but the primal substance, which is not different from the universal, is present in all atoms.

original: rab tu sbyor ba'i bye brag las //üîΩ'bras bu'i ngo bor mtshon par byed //üîΩde 'di ltar yang dag par rab tu sbyor ba'i bye brag las rang gi rigs las ma 'das par 'bras bu'i ngo bor grub pa ni dbang po rnams kyi yul du 'gyur ro //üîΩrdul phran gsum po'i rang bzhin du //üîΩgcig de'i ngo bor gang gis 'gro //
analyzed: rab tu sbyor ba'i bye brag las // 'bras bu'i ngo bor mtshon par byed // de 'di ltar yang dag par rab tu sbyor ba'i bye brag las rang gi rigs las ma 'das par 'bras bu'i ngo bor grub pa ni dbang po rnams kyi yul du 'gyur ro // rdul phran gsum po'i rang bzhin du // gcig de'i ngo bor gang gis 'gro //
translated: The effect is designated by the particular application.

original: rab tu sbyor bar 'dod ma yin //
analyzed: rab tu sbyor bar 'dod ma yin //
translated: One does not wish to apply oneself.üîΩ

original: gsum po sbyar ba las gcig tu gyur pa ni yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gsum po sbyar ba las gcig tu gyur pa ni yod pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not the case that the three are applied to make one.

original: grangs can rnams kyi rigs tha dad du 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: grangs can rnams kyi rigs tha dad du 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the SƒÅ·πÉkhyas would have different types.

original: sgra gcig brjod pa ni yod pa la rag las na dngos po gcig pa ni yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: sgra gcig brjod pa ni yod pa la rag las na dngos po gcig pa ni yod pa ma yin no //
translated: If the expression of one word depends on existence, there is no single entity.

original: ci ste gsum po'i rang bzhin du 'gyur ba'i sgra @24a * //
analyzed: ci ste gsum po'i rang bzhin du 'gyur ba'i sgra @24a * //
translated: If it is said that the sound that becomes the nature of the three

original: dang bde ba la sogs par gang brjod pa shes par 'dod pa'i rang bzhin te dbang po'i yul du 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: dang bde ba la sogs par gang brjod pa shes par 'dod pa'i rang bzhin te dbang po'i yul du 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: and the nature of pleasure, etc., which is what is intended to be known, arises as an object of the sense faculties,

original: tshul gnyis shes par mi 'dod na //
analyzed: tshul gnyis shes par mi 'dod na //
translated: If one does not assert the cognition of two modes,

original: 'bras bu gcig gi ngo bor 'gyur //
analyzed: 'bras bu gcig gi ngo bor 'gyur //
translated: it would become the nature of a single effect.

original: gal te rna bas sgra nyan pa la sogs pa'i blo ni bde ba la sogs pa la mi ltos par gzhan las khyad par du gyur pa 'di la 'jug par byed de de nyid kho nas gcig gi rang bzhin ro //
analyzed: gal te rna bas sgra nyan pa la sogs pa'i blo ni bde ba la sogs pa la mi ltos par gzhan las khyad par du gyur pa 'di la 'jug par byed de de nyid kho nas gcig gi rang bzhin ro //
translated: If the cognition that hears sound with the ear, etc. does not depend on pleasure, etc., it engages in distinguishing from others. Just by that, it has the nature of one.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: don gyi rang bzhin du ma ste //
analyzed: don gyi rang bzhin du ma ste //
translated: Because the nature of the object is not multiple.

original: dbang po'i yul ni khyad par can //
analyzed: dbang po'i yul ni khyad par can //
translated: The object of the sense faculty is a particular.

original: sgra la sogs pa'i don gyi rang bzhin du ma yod pa las rang bzhin gang la blo 'jug pa de dbang po'i don te /
analyzed: sgra la sogs pa'i don gyi rang bzhin du ma yod pa las rang bzhin gang la blo 'jug pa de dbang po'i don te /
translated: From among the many natures of the object such as sound, etc., that which the mind engages is the object of the sense faculty.

original: de nyid dbang po'i yul yin no //
analyzed: de nyid dbang po'i yul yin no //
translated: That is the object of the sense faculty.

original: de yang gcig kho na ste /
analyzed: de yang gcig kho na ste /
translated: And that is only one.

original: reg bya la sogs pa rnams la yang mtshungs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: reg bya la sogs pa rnams la yang mtshungs pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not the same for tangible objects, etc.

original: de'i phyir rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is not reasonable.

original: de'i phyir re re'i dngos po la //üîΩgrangs can lugs las khyad par 'phags //
analyzed: de'i phyir re re'i dngos po la // grangs can lugs las khyad par 'phags //
translated: Therefore, in the state of each individual,üîΩthe SƒÅ·πÉkhya system is superior.

original: sngon grags pa'i grangs can gyi lta ba las khyad par du 'phags shing mchog tu gyur pa ni bden pa kho na ste /
analyzed: sngon grags pa'i grangs can gyi lta ba las khyad par du 'phags shing mchog tu gyur pa ni bden pa kho na ste /
translated: The truth alone is superior and supreme to the SƒÅ·πÉkhya view that was previously renowned.

original: rigs kyi bye brag gcig gi rang bzhin tsam gyi rgyu las 'bras bu skye bar brtags pa ste /
analyzed: rigs kyi bye brag gcig gi rang bzhin tsam gyi rgyu las 'bras bu skye bar brtags pa ste /
translated: The effect arises from a cause that is the nature of a single type of category.

original: de lta na ni rigs mi mthun gyi 'bras bu mi rtsom mo zhes mdzes par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: de lta na ni rigs mi mthun gyi 'bras bu mi rtsom mo zhes mdzes par 'gyur gyi /
translated: In that case, it would be beautiful to say that an effect of a different type does not arise,

original: gsum gyi rang bzhin gcig pa nyid las ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gsum gyi rang bzhin gcig pa nyid las ni ma yin no //
translated: but not from the nature of the three alone.

original: gal te yang da ltar ba'i sgra tsam 'dzin par byed pa'i dbang po'i 'jug pa mngon sum du 'dod pa de lta na ni yul gcig ma yin /
analyzed: gal te yang da ltar ba'i sgra tsam 'dzin par byed pa'i dbang po'i 'jug pa mngon sum du 'dod pa de lta na ni yul gcig ma yin /
translated: If you maintain that the operation of the sense faculty that apprehends mere present sound is direct perception, then it is not a single object.

original: gzhal bar bya ba thams cad kyang yul ma yin pa tshad ma yin pa bsal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhal bar bya ba thams cad kyang yul ma yin pa tshad ma yin pa bsal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: And it would follow that all objects of comprehension are not objects of valid knowledge.

original: 'jug pa de tshad mar brjod pa ma yin no ;
analyzed: 'jug pa de tshad mar brjod pa ma yin no ;
translated: The operation is not described as valid knowledge.

original: / dbang po'i 'jug pa yang dag par myong bar byed pa'i yid kyi dbang po la ni rtags la sogs pa med pas /
analyzed: / dbang po'i 'jug pa yang dag par myong bar byed pa'i yid kyi dbang po la ni rtags la sogs pa med pas /
translated: The operation of the sense faculty that experiences sound does not have a sign, etc.,

original: tshad mar ma brjod pa'i phyir nyams pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tshad mar ma brjod pa'i phyir nyams pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: and because it is not described as valid knowledge, it would be defective.

original: der 'jug pa'i yang dag par myong ba tshad ma gzhan gyi khongs su 'du bar ni mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: der 'jug pa'i yang dag par myong ba tshad ma gzhan gyi khongs su 'du bar ni mi 'gyur ro //
translated: The experience of that operation would not be included in another valid knowledge.

original: nyes pa de ni med de /
analyzed: nyes pa de ni med de /
translated: That fault does not exist.

original: der zhugs pa'i nyams su myong ba ni dran pa ste /
analyzed: der zhugs pa'i nyams su myong ba ni dran pa ste /
translated: The experience of engaging that is memory.

original: 'dod pa la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: 'dod pa la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: It is like desire, etc.

original: gang ji skad du dran pa ni mngon sum gyi 'jug pa'i bye brag go zhes brjod do //
analyzed: gang ji skad du dran pa ni mngon sum gyi 'jug pa'i bye brag go zhes brjod do //
translated: It is said that memory is a specific operation of direct perception.

original: de'i phyir dbang po'i shes pa ni phyi rol gyi don la mngon sum ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir dbang po'i shes pa ni phyi rol gyi don la mngon sum ste /
translated: Therefore, the sense consciousness is the direct perception of the external object.

original: dbang po'i 'jug pa dang bar du ma chod pa yin no //
analyzed: dbang po'i 'jug pa dang bar du ma chod pa yin no //
translated: It is the engagement of the sense faculty, and it is not interrupted.

original: dran ba'o @24b zhe na /
analyzed: dran ba'o @24b zhe na /
translated: If you say that it is memory,

original: dran min nyams su ma myong phyir //
analyzed: dran min nyams su ma myong phyir //
translated: because it is not remembered, it is not experienced.

original: bar ma chod pa'i yid ni dbang po'i 'jug pa 'dzin par byed pa'i dran par rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: bar ma chod pa'i yid ni dbang po'i 'jug pa 'dzin par byed pa'i dran par rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not reasonable that the mind that is interrupted should grasp the engagement of the sense faculty, because it is memory.

original: sngar nyams su ma myong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sngar nyams su ma myong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it does not experience it previously.

original: cig car gnyis ka 'byung bar 'gyur //
analyzed: cig car gnyis ka 'byung bar 'gyur //
translated: Both occur simultaneously.

original: cig car ba yin na yang dbang pos shes pa dang / de nyams su myong bar byed pa'i yid gnyis ka bsal bar khas blangs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: cig car ba yin na yang dbang pos shes pa dang / de nyams su myong bar byed pa'i yid gnyis ka bsal bar khas blangs par 'gyur ro //
translated: Even if it is simultaneous, you accept that both the consciousness and the mind that experiences it are the engagement of the sense faculty.

original: de lta na ni yul gyi rgyu mtshan yul can la yang yod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta na ni yul gyi rgyu mtshan yul can la yang yod par 'gyur ro //
translated: In that case, the object-condition would also exist for the subject.

original: de ni tshad ma'i dbang po nyams su myong ba'i yid de ni tshad mar ma brjod de des ni de'i gnas skabs la zhugs pa po yang tshad mar ma brjod pa'i phyir myangs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ni tshad ma'i dbang po nyams su myong ba'i yid de ni tshad mar ma brjod de des ni de'i gnas skabs la zhugs pa po yang tshad mar ma brjod pa'i phyir myangs par 'gyur ro //
translated: That is the mind that experiences the object through the valid cognition of perception, but it is not called valid cognition, because it is not called valid cognition with regard to the state of the object that it has experienced.

original: rang rig tu 'dod pa la sogs pa la ni nyes pa med do //
analyzed: rang rig tu 'dod pa la sogs pa la ni nyes pa med do //
translated: There is no fault in the assertion of autocognition.

original: dran pa zhes bya ba ni long ba'i gom pa nyid de /
analyzed: dran pa zhes bya ba ni long ba'i gom pa nyid de /
translated: Memory is like the steps of a blind person.

original: de yod pa lta na ni dran pa 'di mngon sum 'dzin pa'i bye brag go zhes bya bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de yod pa lta na ni dran pa 'di mngon sum 'dzin pa'i bye brag go zhes bya bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If it were to exist, then this memory would be a particular type of apprehension of direct perception.

original: de lta na yang bar mchod pa'i dbang po'i yul 'dzin na ni dran par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta na yang bar mchod pa'i dbang po'i yul 'dzin na ni dran par mi 'gyur te /
translated: Even so, if it apprehends the object of a present sense faculty, it is not memory,

original: yid kyis nyams su ma myong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yid kyis nyams su ma myong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it does not experience it with the mind.

original: sngar yid kyis phyi rol gyi don nyams su myong ba ni med do //
analyzed: sngar yid kyis phyi rol gyi don nyams su myong ba ni med do //
translated: There is no experience of an external object by the mind.

original: dran pa nyams pa'am /üîΩdran pa yin na'ang gzhan mthong 'gyur //
analyzed: dran pa nyams pa'am / dran pa yin na'ang gzhan mthong 'gyur //
translated: If memory is impaired,üîΩthen it is not memory.

original: dbang po'i 'jug pa tsam zhig myong ba'i phyir nyams su ma myong ba'am /
analyzed: dbang po'i 'jug pa tsam zhig myong ba'i phyir nyams su ma myong ba'am /
translated: If it is memory, then it is the experience of the mere engagement of the sense faculty, and so it is not experienced.

original: dran pa nyams pa zhes bya ba'i'am zhes pa'i sgra rnams rnam par brtag pa'i don to //
analyzed: dran pa nyams pa zhes bya ba'i'am zhes pa'i sgra rnams rnam par brtag pa'i don to //
translated: The words ‚Äúor‚Äù and ‚Äúand‚Äù have the sense of ‚Äúor‚Äù and ‚Äúand‚Äù respectively.

original: ji ltar nyams par 'gyur te /
analyzed: ji ltar nyams par 'gyur te /
translated: How is it that memory is impaired?

original: phyi rol gyi don la dbang po'i 'jug pa dang lhan cig tu skyes pa yod kyis nyams su myong ba 'dod pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: phyi rol gyi don la dbang po'i 'jug pa dang lhan cig tu skyes pa yod kyis nyams su myong ba 'dod pa yin no zhe na /
translated: It is maintained that there is an experience that arises simultaneously with the operation of the sense faculty with regard to an external object.

original: gang ji skad du don gcig gis dbang po gnyis bskyed pa'i nus pa ni brtag par mi nus so zhes brjod pa'i phyir de ni nyams pa nyid do //
analyzed: gang ji skad du don gcig gis dbang po gnyis bskyed pa'i nus pa ni brtag par mi nus so zhes brjod pa'i phyir de ni nyams pa nyid do //
translated: But that is impaired, because it is impossible to imagine that a single object can produce two sense faculties.

original: nyes pa de dag ni yod pa ma yin no //üîΩdran pa'i yid rtag tu 'dzin par bstan pa'i ched du lhan cig kho nar skye ba bkag pa yin no //
analyzed: nyes pa de dag ni yod pa ma yin no // dran pa'i yid rtag tu 'dzin par bstan pa'i ched du lhan cig kho nar skye ba bkag pa yin no //
translated: These faults do not exist.üîΩThe simultaneous arising of memory and experience is refuted in order to demonstrate that the mind that remembers is always the appropriator.

original: lhan cig par grub pa nyid la ci phyir rol gyi don la dbang po dang yid dag gis lhan cig tu 'dzin par byed dam zhes 'dzin lugs  la brgal te /
analyzed: lhan cig par grub pa nyid la ci phyir rol gyi don la dbang po dang yid dag gis lhan cig tu 'dzin par byed dam zhes 'dzin lugs  la brgal te /
translated: But why is it that the sense faculty and the mind grasp the external object simultaneously?

original: gang gi tshe la lar dus gcig tu dbang dang ldan pa'i yid 'byung ngo zhes sngar brjod pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: gang gi tshe la lar dus gcig tu dbang dang ldan pa'i yid 'byung ngo zhes sngar brjod pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: because it was said earlier that sometimes the mind that is dominant with regard to something arises at the same time.

original: de lta na yang /
analyzed: de lta na yang /
translated: Even if that is so,

original: dran pa lhag par brjod phyir na //üîΩrnam bsal / gal te dran pa lhag par brjod par bya ba'i phyir phyi rol gyi don la yid dang lhan cig @25a * //
analyzed: dran pa lhag par brjod phyir na // rnam bsal / gal te dran pa lhag par brjod par bya ba'i phyir phyi rol gyi don la yid dang lhan cig @25a * //
translated: because memory is emphasized,üîΩthe objection is removed.üîΩIf the external object is refuted in order to emphasize memory,

original: bkag pa yin na ni de lta na yang gang ji skad du 'di ltar dbang pos gzung gi /
analyzed: bkag pa yin na ni de lta na yang gang ji skad du 'di ltar dbang pos gzung gi /
translated: then the objection is removed, because it is said that the mind apprehends the object that is grasped by the sense faculty.

original: rjes la yid kyis 'dzin par byed de /
analyzed: rjes la yid kyis 'dzin par byed de /
translated: After that, the mind grasps it.

original: de ltar yid kyis bzung nas dbang po ji lta ba bzhin du rig par byed do zhes bya ba la sogs pa brjod pa de rnam par bsal ba yin no //
analyzed: de ltar yid kyis bzung nas dbang po ji lta ba bzhin du rig par byed do zhes bya ba la sogs pa brjod pa de rnam par bsal ba yin no //
translated: Having grasped it in that way, it is cognized in accordance with the sense faculty.

original: de'i phyir phyi rol gyi don la dran pa ni yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir phyi rol gyi don la dran pa ni yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore memory does not exist with regard to an external object.

original: gal te yid phyi rol gyi don la dngos su 'jug pa de lta na yang /
analyzed: gal te yid phyi rol gyi don la dngos su 'jug pa de lta na yang /
translated: Even if the mind actually engages an external object,

original: dbang gzhan don med 'gyur /
analyzed: dbang gzhan don med 'gyur /
translated: the other sense faculties would be useless.

original: dbang po gzhan rnams phyi rol gyi don la 'jug pa don med par 'gyur te /
analyzed: dbang po gzhan rnams phyi rol gyi don la 'jug pa don med par 'gyur te /
translated: The other sense faculties would be purposeless with respect to external objects,

original: skyes bu'i don yid kyis sgrub ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skyes bu'i don yid kyis sgrub ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because the purpose of a person is accomplished by the mental faculty.

original: de'i phyir de ltar yul gyi rang bzhin nges par gzung bar mi nus pa'i phyir grangs can gyi mngon sum tshad ma ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar yul gyi rang bzhin nges par gzung bar mi nus pa'i phyir grangs can gyi mngon sum tshad ma ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, because the nature of the object cannot be ascertained in this way, the perception of the SƒÅ·πÉkhya is not a valid means of knowledge.

original: dpyod pa rnams ni yod pa dang yang dag par phrad nas skyes pa'i skyes bu'i dbang po rnams kyi blo de mngon sum mo zhes zer ro //
analyzed: dpyod pa rnams ni yod pa dang yang dag par phrad nas skyes pa'i skyes bu'i dbang po rnams kyi blo de mngon sum mo zhes zer ro //
translated: The NaiyƒÅyikas say that the cognition of the sense faculties of a person that arises from contact with an existent and a real object is perception.üîΩIn response to that, Aryadeva says:

original: de la / yod pa'i gsal bya med pa ste //
analyzed: de la / yod pa'i gsal bya med pa ste //
translated: The existent is not something to be clarified.

original: phrad ces pa las de rig bya //
analyzed: phrad ces pa las de rig bya //
translated: The word ‚Äúcontact‚Äù indicates that it is to be known.

original: yang dag par phrad pa ni yod pa kho na dang yin par nges pa'i phyir med pa bsal bar bya ba'i don du yod pa smos pa ni rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: yang dag par phrad pa ni yod pa kho na dang yin par nges pa'i phyir med pa bsal bar bya ba'i don du yod pa smos pa ni rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not logical to say that the existent is mentioned in order to eliminate the nonexistent, because contact definitely occurs only with the existent.

original: lan du phrad pa bstan zhe na /
analyzed: lan du phrad pa bstan zhe na /
translated: If you say that contact is taught in response to that,

original: ci ste yang /
analyzed: ci ste yang /
translated: then what is the point of mentioning the existent?

original: dbang po rnams kyis ni yang dag par phrad nas so zhes brjod par bya ba la gang gis sbyor zhing yang dag par phrad par byed ces dogs na /
analyzed: dbang po rnams kyis ni yang dag par phrad nas so zhes brjod par bya ba la gang gis sbyor zhing yang dag par phrad par byed ces dogs na /
translated: The sense faculties contact their objects, but what is it that connects them and causes them to contact?

original: lan du phrad par gzung bar byas pa ste /
analyzed: lan du phrad par gzung bar byas pa ste /
translated: The response is that they are connected by contact.

original: de'i don du yod pa smos so zhe na /
analyzed: de'i don du yod pa smos so zhe na /
translated: The word ‚Äúexists‚Äù is used in that sense.

original: de lta na ni dbang po'i khyad par du brjod kyis /
analyzed: de lta na ni dbang po'i khyad par du brjod kyis /
translated: But if that is so, then the sense faculties are described as distinct,

original: dbang po khyad par can du bya ba'i don du so sor sbyar ba brjod par rigs so //
analyzed: dbang po khyad par can du bya ba'i don du so sor sbyar ba brjod par rigs so //
translated: and it is proper to say that they are connected in order to make the sense faculties distinct.

original: ci ste yang 'dir bdag la sogs pa dang yid la sogs pa dang yang sbyor zhing phrad pa brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: ci ste yang 'dir bdag la sogs pa dang yid la sogs pa dang yang sbyor zhing phrad pa brjod par bya ste /
translated: But if you say that the self, etc., and the mind, etc., are connected and contact each other,

original: de spyi'i sgras brjod pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de spyi'i sgras brjod pa yin no zhe na /
translated: then that is expressed by the general term ‚Äúexists.‚Äù

original: de yang rigs pa ma yin no //üîΩyod pa tsam dang phrad pa rung //
analyzed: de yang rigs pa ma yin no // yod pa tsam dang phrad pa rung //
translated: That is not reasonable.üîΩIt is not that they do not exist,

original: ma yin min te gang gis brjod //
analyzed: ma yin min te gang gis brjod //
translated: but rather that they are not expressed.

original: skyes bu la sogs pa spyir yod pa tsam dang phrad pa nyid ni grub pa kho na ste /
analyzed: skyes bu la sogs pa spyir yod pa tsam dang phrad pa nyid ni grub pa kho na ste /
translated: The mere existence of the self, etc., and the mind, etc., is established as contact.

original: de'i phyir med pa la ni mi 'jug ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir med pa la ni mi 'jug ste /
translated: Therefore, they do not engage in what does not exist.

original: gang yang smig rgyu la sogs pa yod pa ma yin pa mngon sum ltar snang ba de dang yang 'ga' zhig tu phrad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang yang smig rgyu la sogs pa yod pa ma yin pa mngon sum ltar snang ba de dang yang 'ga' zhig tu phrad par 'gyur ro //
translated: And just as a mirage and so on, which do not exist, appear to be directly perceived, so too they would sometimes come into contact with something.

original: yul khyad par can dang nyi ma'i gdung ba dang / 'byung ba'i bye brag rnams ni yod pa tsam kho na ste /
analyzed: yul khyad par can dang nyi ma'i gdung ba dang / 'byung ba'i bye brag rnams ni yod pa tsam kho na ste /
translated: The special object, the heat of the sun, and the particular elements are merely existent.

original: de mig gi blo dang phrad nas don med pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa rgyu ba las /
analyzed: de mig gi blo dang phrad nas don med pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa rgyu ba las /
translated: When they come into contact with the eye cognition, a mental consciousness that is devoid of an object arises.

original: rim gyis 'khrul pa'i shes pa 'byung ste /
analyzed: rim gyis 'khrul pa'i shes pa 'byung ste /
translated: From that, a mistaken cognition gradually arises.

original: @25b de'i phyir de dag dgag par yod pa smos pa rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: @25b de'i phyir de dag dgag par yod pa smos pa rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is not logical to say that they exist in order to refute them.

original: ci ste yod sgra dam par 'dod //
analyzed: ci ste yod sgra dam par 'dod //
translated: But if you assert that the word ‚Äúexists‚Äù is definitive,

original: dbang po mdzes par brjod pa yin //
analyzed: dbang po mdzes par brjod pa yin //
translated: then it is a description of a beautiful sense faculty.

original: gang yang 'di ltar brtag par bya ste /
analyzed: gang yang 'di ltar brtag par bya ste /
translated: But this should be investigated:

original: gang du dbang po gang zhig dam par grub pa de ni gzhan la mi 'jug ste /
analyzed: gang du dbang po gang zhig dam par grub pa de ni gzhan la mi 'jug ste /
