translated: wherever a sense faculty is established as beautiful, it does not engage with another.

original: des na de dang yang dag par phrad pa'am /
analyzed: des na de dang yang dag par phrad pa'am /
translated: Therefore, it is either in contact with that or

original: yang na gang dbang po rab tu mdzes pa dang phrad nas brjod pa'o zhe na /
analyzed: yang na gang dbang po rab tu mdzes pa dang phrad nas brjod pa'o zhe na /
translated: it is a description of that which comes into contact with a beautiful sense faculty.

original: dam par grub dang mdzes pa ste //
analyzed: dam par grub dang mdzes pa ste //
translated: and the eye-salve, etc.

original: mig sman la sogs bzhin las kyang //
analyzed: mig sman la sogs bzhin las kyang //
translated: are established as the best and most beautiful.

original: de grub ces bya ba ni tshig kha bskang ba'i don du'o //
analyzed: de grub ces bya ba ni tshig kha bskang ba'i don du'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúare established‚Äù is for the purpose of completing the meter.

original: rdul sogs pa gzhan gyis kyang dbang po dam par sgrub par byed pa ste don tsam 'ba' zhig las ni ma yin no //üîΩdbang po'i rab tu mdzes pa yang /
analyzed: rdul sogs pa gzhan gyis kyang dbang po dam par sgrub par byed pa ste don tsam 'ba' zhig las ni ma yin no // dbang po'i rab tu mdzes pa yang /
translated: The eye-salve, etc. are established as the best by other things, such as dust, etc., but not by the mere object.üîΩThe eye-salve, etc. are also established as the most beautiful

original: mig sman dang rkang pa byugs pa la sogs pa las kyang yin pas de dang rab tu sbyar ba yang mngon sum du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mig sman dang rkang pa byugs pa la sogs pa las kyang yin pas de dang rab tu sbyar ba yang mngon sum du 'gyur ro //
translated: by the application of the eye-salve, the anointing of the feet, etc.

original: gal te de de ltar ni mi 'gyur te /üîΩdper na 'gro ba'i sgra las ba lang mtshon gyi gzhan la 'gro ba'i bya ba yod kyang ma yin pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: gal te de de ltar ni mi 'gyur te / dper na 'gro ba'i sgra las ba lang mtshon gyi gzhan la 'gro ba'i bya ba yod kyang ma yin pa de bzhin du /
translated: If you say that this is not so,üîΩthen just as the word ‚Äúgoer‚Äù does not refer to the action of going in other things,

original: don kho nas dam par grub cing mtshon par byed kyi gzhan las ni ma yin no //
analyzed: don kho nas dam par grub cing mtshon par byed kyi gzhan las ni ma yin no //
translated: in the same way, the word ‚Äúobject‚Äù would not refer to the best and the most beautiful, but would refer only to the object.

original: de bzhin du rab tu mdzes pa la yang brjod par bya'o zhe na /
analyzed: de bzhin du rab tu mdzes pa la yang brjod par bya'o zhe na /
translated: The same argument applies to the most beautiful.

original: brgal ba 'di ni mi bzad pa ste /
analyzed: brgal ba 'di ni mi bzad pa ste /
translated: This objection is not cogent.

original: grags las de ltar brtags grangs na //
analyzed: grags las de ltar brtags grangs na //
translated: If you imagine that sound is like that,

original: sgra de dbang po'i yul la min //
analyzed: sgra de dbang po'i yul la min //
translated: then sound is not the object of the sense faculty.

original: 'gro ba'i sgra ni ba lang kho na la grag pas 'gro ba'i sgra la mtshon pa ste /
analyzed: 'gro ba'i sgra ni ba lang kho na la grag pas 'gro ba'i sgra la mtshon pa ste /
translated: The word ‚Äúsound‚Äù is a metaphor for the word ‚Äúgoer.‚Äù

original: de bzhin du dam pa dang rab tu mdzes par bya ba'i phyir yod pa'i sgras dbang po la gnas pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du dam pa dang rab tu mdzes par bya ba'i phyir yod pa'i sgras dbang po la gnas pa ni ma yin no //
translated: In the same way, the word ‚Äúexistent‚Äù is not a metaphor for something that exists as the object of the sense faculty, in order to make it more sublime and beautiful.

original: de'i phyir yod pa'i sgra las de ltar brtags pa yang rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir yod pa'i sgra las de ltar brtags pa yang rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is not logical to imagine that the word ‚Äúexistent‚Äù is like that.

original: kun tu don dang phrad gang na //
analyzed: kun tu don dang phrad gang na //
translated: When it is in contact with its object,üîΩit sees forms and sounds that are obstructed

original: gzugs sgra bar du chod pa dang // chen po'ang 'dzin par mthong bas na //
analyzed: gzugs sgra bar du chod pa dang // chen po'ang 'dzin par mthong bas na //
translated: and even large ones.

original: bar du ma chod pa la gnong //
analyzed: bar du ma chod pa la gnong //
translated: It is not impaired by what is not obstructed.

original: 'di ltar thams cad du dbang pos don thob par byed pa la ni rag na /
analyzed: 'di ltar thams cad du dbang pos don thob par byed pa la ni rag na /
translated: In this way, if the sense faculty always makes contact with its object,

original: gang 'di gzugs dang sgra dag las ni bar du chod bzhin pa la 'dzin zhing /
analyzed: gang 'di gzugs dang sgra dag las ni bar du chod bzhin pa la 'dzin zhing /
translated: why is it that it sometimes grasps forms and sounds that are obstructed,

original: dbang po'i tshad las lhag pa la yang 'dzin par byed do //
analyzed: dbang po'i tshad las lhag pa la yang 'dzin par byed do //
translated: and sometimes grasps things that are larger than the sense faculty?

original: de ltar gnyis kar yang mi 'gyur ba'i phyir dbang po ni dri la sogs pa bzhin du bar du ma chod pa na 'dzin par ni ma mthong ngo //
analyzed: de ltar gnyis kar yang mi 'gyur ba'i phyir dbang po ni dri la sogs pa bzhin du bar du ma chod pa na 'dzin par ni ma mthong ngo //
translated: Thus, since neither is the case, the sense faculty is not seen to apprehend the object when there is no obstruction, as is the case with smell and so on.

original: blo yi rgyu yi tshogs pa ru //üîΩbrjod pa bor nas gang las de //
analyzed: blo yi rgyu yi tshogs pa ru // brjod pa bor nas gang las de //
translated: The collection of causes of cognitionüîΩis said to be the cause of cognition.

original: tshad ma / 'grel pa byed mkhan gyis ni don gzhan 'bras bur smra ste /
analyzed: tshad ma / 'grel pa byed mkhan gyis ni don gzhan 'bras bur smra ste /
translated: The author of the commentary states that the effect is a different object.

original: tshad ma'i 'bras bu @26a * //
analyzed: tshad ma'i 'bras bu @26a * //
translated: The effect of valid knowledge

original: blo'i skye ba las gzhan du ma mthong ba gang las blo skye bar grub pa de mngon sum mo zhes 'dod do //
analyzed: blo'i skye ba las gzhan du ma mthong ba gang las blo skye bar grub pa de mngon sum mo zhes 'dod do //
translated: is not seen to be anything other than the arising of cognition. Whatever is established as the cause of the arising of cognition is direct perception.

original: de la brjod pa de la yang ji lta ba bzhin du brjod pa'i bdag la sogs pa dang sbyor ba dang 'du byed pa dang bcas pa dag bor nas blo la rgyu gzhan ni med na gang gis mngon sum nyid kyi tha snyad du byas /
analyzed: de la brjod pa de la yang ji lta ba bzhin du brjod pa'i bdag la sogs pa dang sbyor ba dang 'du byed pa dang bcas pa dag bor nas blo la rgyu gzhan ni med na gang gis mngon sum nyid kyi tha snyad du byas /
translated: To that, we reply: In that case, just as before, having discarded the self and so on that are connected with the application and composition of the expression, if there is no other cause of cognition, by what is the term direct perception applied?

original: ci ste don yin pa'am /
analyzed: ci ste don yin pa'am /
translated: If it is the object,üîΩor if the collection of causes of direct perception is said to be the object itself,

original: ci ste yang don kho na mngon sum gyi rgyu'i tshogs par rjod par byed pa de lta na /
analyzed: ci ste yang don kho na mngon sum gyi rgyu'i tshogs par rjod par byed pa de lta na /
translated: then in that case,

original: blo yi skye ba zhes cis bsnan //
analyzed: blo yi skye ba zhes cis bsnan //
translated: What is the point of adding ‚Äúarising of cognition‚Äù to that?

original: 'di skad du yod pa dang yang dag par phrad pa skyes bu'i dbang po rnams mngon sum mo zhes bshad pas chog mod /
analyzed: 'di skad du yod pa dang yang dag par phrad pa skyes bu'i dbang po rnams mngon sum mo zhes bshad pas chog mod /
translated: It would be sufficient to say that the sense faculties of a person who has contact with an existent object are direct perception.

original: blo dang skye ba bsnan pas ci zhig bya /
analyzed: blo dang skye ba bsnan pas ci zhig bya /
translated: What is the point of adding ‚Äúcognition‚Äù and ‚Äúarising‚Äù?

original: gang las byung ba de zhes pa de yang rnam par brtags pa las yin no //
analyzed: gang las byung ba de zhes pa de yang rnam par brtags pa las yin no //
translated: And that from which it arises is also just a conceptual imputation.

original: gzhan yang / don dang dbang po'i yid skyes bu //
analyzed: gzhan yang / don dang dbang po'i yid skyes bu //
translated: Moreover: The object, the sense faculty, and the mind arise from the person.

original: sbyor dang 'du byed pa las gzhan //üîΩmngon sum gyi ni blo bskyed pa'i //
analyzed: sbyor dang 'du byed pa las gzhan // mngon sum gyi ni blo bskyed pa'i //
translated: They are not different from the one who combines and the one who instigates.

original: tshogs pa brjod pa de ji lta //üîΩtshogs pa de dag gis mngon sum du skyed par byed pa nyid ni ma yin no //
analyzed: tshogs pa brjod pa de ji lta // tshogs pa de dag gis mngon sum du skyed par byed pa nyid ni ma yin no //
translated: How can you describe the collection of thoseüîΩas the cause of the arising of cognition that is direct perception?üîΩThat collection does not cause the arising of direct perception.

original: gang dbang po dang don du phrad par brtag pa de ni ma yin te /
analyzed: gang dbang po dang don du phrad par brtag pa de ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not the case that the sense faculty and the object are posited as direct perception because they come into contact.

original: mngon sum zhes bya ba de gnyis la gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mngon sum zhes bya ba de gnyis la gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: That is because direct perception is posited in dependence on those two.

original: yang dag par 'du ba yang mngon sum ma yin pa nyid de /
analyzed: yang dag par 'du ba yang mngon sum ma yin pa nyid de /
translated: Also, the mere coming together of those is not direct perception.

original: 'di so sor sgrub par byed pa'o zhes mi brtag go //
analyzed: 'di so sor sgrub par byed pa'o zhes mi brtag go //
translated: It is not the case that it is posited as the one that individually accomplishes that.

original: gal te yang brjod pa /
analyzed: gal te yang brjod pa /
translated: But if you say,

original: ba lang nyid 'di rta nyid 'di'o zhes gang las nges par 'byung ba de mngon sum mo zhe na /
analyzed: ba lang nyid 'di rta nyid 'di'o zhes gang las nges par 'byung ba de mngon sum mo zhe na /
translated: ‚ÄúThe cow itself is the horse itself,‚Äù then that which is ascertained is direct perception.

original: de yang rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de yang rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: That is also illogical.

original: gang gi phyir /üîΩglang nyid yod sbyor las don ni //
analyzed: gang gi phyir / glang nyid yod sbyor las don ni //
translated: Because,üîΩThe object is cognized as cow and so on

original: ba glang nyid sogs su 'jal byed //
analyzed: ba glang nyid sogs su 'jal byed //
translated: Through the application of cow itself.üîΩThe sense consciousnesses do not have the capacityüîΩTo apply objects.

original: dbang po'i blo la don rnams dang // sbyor ba'i nus pa yod ma yin //üîΩba lang nyid tsam la lta ba ste /
analyzed: dbang po'i blo la don rnams dang // sbyor ba'i nus pa yod ma yin // ba lang nyid tsam la lta ba ste /
translated: The sense consciousnesses do not have the capacity to apply objects.

original: khyod kyi lugs kyi dbang po'i blo la de tsam las brten nas lta ba'i nus pa med par 'gyur te /
analyzed: khyod kyi lugs kyi dbang po'i blo la de tsam las brten nas lta ba'i nus pa med par 'gyur te /
translated: In your system, the sense consciousnesses do not have the capacity to view objects in dependence on mere cow and so on.

original: de dag sbyor bar ni mi byed la /
analyzed: de dag sbyor bar ni mi byed la /
translated: They do not apply those objects.

original: ma sbyor bar ba lang la sogs pa nges par yang mi rigs so //
analyzed: ma sbyor bar ba lang la sogs pa nges par yang mi rigs so //
translated: Without applying them, it is also illogical to ascertain cow and so on.

original: de'i phyir khyad par du bya ba dang khyad par du byed pa dang brjod par bya ba dang / rjod par byed pa'i rnam par rtog pa 'di dag thams cad yid kyis nye bar 'dogs par byed kyis dbang po'i blo ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir khyad par du bya ba dang khyad par du byed pa dang brjod par bya ba dang / rjod par byed pa'i rnam par rtog pa 'di dag thams cad yid kyis nye bar 'dogs par byed kyis dbang po'i blo ni ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, all these conceptualizations of the object qualified, the qualifying, the expressed, and the expresser are mental superimpositions, not perceptions by the senses.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /üîΩrang rang rig par bya ba'i don //
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na / rang rang rig par bya ba'i don //
translated: Why is this?üîΩThe object of the senses is not a general thing,

original: bstan bya min tshul dbang po'i yul //
analyzed: bstan bya min tshul dbang po'i yul //
translated: because it is not the object of verbalization.

original: chos du ma yod du zin kyang dbang po'i yul ni gang thun mong ma yin pa'i bdag nyid dbang po la snang ba @26b ste 'thob par bya ba'i yul yin la /
analyzed: chos du ma yod du zin kyang dbang po'i yul ni gang thun mong ma yin pa'i bdag nyid dbang po la snang ba @26b ste 'thob par bya ba'i yul yin la /
translated: Even though many things exist, the object of the senses is that which is not common to all, which appears to the sense faculty, and is the object to be obtained.

original: rang gi snang ba'i shes pa skyes pa de'i bdag so sor rig par byed de shes pa'i rang gi cha shas bzhin no //
analyzed: rang gi snang ba'i shes pa skyes pa de'i bdag so sor rig par byed de shes pa'i rang gi cha shas bzhin no //
translated: The arising of the cognition that appears as that object is the awareness of its individual self-existence, like the cognition of the parts of the object.

original: de lta bu bdag nyid kyis brjod par bya ba la sogs pa ni bstan par mi nus te /
analyzed: de lta bu bdag nyid kyis brjod par bya ba la sogs pa ni bstan par mi nus te /
translated: Such an object cannot be the object of verbalization, etc.,

original: brjod par bya ba la sogs pa ni spyi'i yul yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: brjod par bya ba la sogs pa ni spyi'i yul yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because verbalization, etc., have general things as their objects.

original: ci ste yang spyi'i rnam pa'i tshul nas kyang don de nyid yin te /
analyzed: ci ste yang spyi'i rnam pa'i tshul nas kyang don de nyid yin te /
translated: But if you say that the object is the same in general form,

original: dbang po'i yul yin pa'i phyir dang / rnam pa thams cad kyi nges pa yin pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: dbang po'i yul yin pa'i phyir dang / rnam pa thams cad kyi nges pa yin pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: because it is the object of the sense faculty and because it is the ascertainment of all aspects,

original: de lta na yang /üîΩdon min shes pa'ang rnam kun tu //
analyzed: de lta na yang / don min shes pa'ang rnam kun tu //
translated: then even so,

original: mngon sum blo ru gnas par 'gyur //
analyzed: mngon sum blo ru gnas par 'gyur //
translated: the cognition of the object would be a perception in every way.

original: mngon sum gyi sgra ni gsum la 'jug ste /
analyzed: mngon sum gyi sgra ni gsum la 'jug ste /
translated: The term perception applies to three things:

original: tshad ma dang / shes pa dang / yul rnams la'o //
analyzed: tshad ma dang / shes pa dang / yul rnams la'o //
translated: valid cognition, consciousness, and objects.

original: de yang tshad ma la ni dngos su yin la cig shos gnyis po la ni brtags nas so //
analyzed: de yang tshad ma la ni dngos su yin la cig shos gnyis po la ni brtags nas so //
translated: It applies directly to valid cognition and figuratively to the other two.

original: de la yul la ni mngon sum gyis gzhal bar bya ba yin pa'i phyir mngon sum zhes gdags so //
analyzed: de la yul la ni mngon sum gyis gzhal bar bya ba yin pa'i phyir mngon sum zhes gdags so //
translated: With regard to objects, it is designated as perception because it is to be perceived by perception.

original: shes pa dbang po la brten pa tshad ma dang mtshungs pa yin pa'i phyir mngon sum du gdags par rigs pa yin no //
analyzed: shes pa dbang po la brten pa tshad ma dang mtshungs pa yin pa'i phyir mngon sum du gdags par rigs pa yin no //
translated: It is reasonable to designate consciousness as perception because it is the valid cognition that is based on the sense faculty.

original: gal te gzugs la sogs pa'i spyi'i rnam pa la dmigs pa'i blo ni dbang po la mi ltos par tha mi dad du nye bar brtag cing 'jug par byed de //
analyzed: gal te gzugs la sogs pa'i spyi'i rnam pa la dmigs pa'i blo ni dbang po la mi ltos par tha mi dad du nye bar brtag cing 'jug par byed de //
translated: If you say that the cognition that perceives the general aspect of form, etc., is not dependent on the sense faculty, because it is imagined to be engaged without distinction,

original: dbang po'i gzhan dbang du gyur pa ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: dbang po'i gzhan dbang du gyur pa ma yin no zhe na /
translated: and is not under the control of the sense faculty,

original: rnam pa thams cad du don gyi shes pa gzugs la sogs pa'i yon tan nyid la sogs pa'i don yod pa'i shes pas dbang po gzhan gyi spyod yul la yang rgyu bar byed na ni dbang po du ma don med par 'gyur ro zhes sngar brjod zin to
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad du don gyi shes pa gzugs la sogs pa'i yon tan nyid la sogs pa'i don yod pa'i shes pas dbang po gzhan gyi spyod yul la yang rgyu bar byed na ni dbang po du ma don med par 'gyur ro zhes sngar brjod zin to
translated: then we have already stated that if the cognition of the object in all aspects moves to the sphere of another sense faculty, such as the cognition of the quality of form, etc., of an existent object, then many sense faculties would be purposeless.

original: // de'i phyir thun mong ma yin pa'i yul gyi rang gi ngo bo nyid dbang po'i spyod yul yin no //üîΩde ltar na re zhig gang las blo skyes pa de mngon sum yin par ni mi rigs so //
analyzed: // de'i phyir thun mong ma yin pa'i yul gyi rang gi ngo bo nyid dbang po'i spyod yul yin no // de ltar na re zhig gang las blo skyes pa de mngon sum yin par ni mi rigs so //
translated: Therefore, the nature of the uncommon object is the sphere of the sense faculty.üîΩThus, it is not reasonable that what produces cognition is perception.

original: ci ste blo yi skye ba 'dod //
analyzed: ci ste blo yi skye ba 'dod //
translated: If you assert that the production of cognitionüîΩis perception of the external object,

original: blo'i skye ba nyid kyi phyi rol gyi don la mngon sum mo zhes thos te /
analyzed: blo'i skye ba nyid kyi phyi rol gyi don la mngon sum mo zhes thos te /
translated: we have heard that the production of cognition itself is perception of the external object.

original: de'i tshe dogs pa bsu nas lan brjod pa /
analyzed: de'i tshe dogs pa bsu nas lan brjod pa /
translated: At that time, anticipating a qualm, he responds:

original: don gzhan 'bras bur smra ba yis //
analyzed: don gzhan 'bras bur smra ba yis //
translated: By one who advocates that a different object is the effect,

original: don gzhan thob par 'gyur ma yin //
analyzed: don gzhan thob par 'gyur ma yin //
translated: a different object is not obtained.

original: ji ltar byas na zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar byas na zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: don gyi blo shar 'bras yin na //
analyzed: don gyi blo shar 'bras yin na //
translated: If the arising of the cognition of the object is the effect,

original: de las gzhan 'bras med pas so //
analyzed: de las gzhan 'bras med pas so //
translated: there is no effect other than that.

original: lhag par rtogs shing khong du chud pas ni 'bras bu yin la /
analyzed: lhag par rtogs shing khong du chud pas ni 'bras bu yin la /
translated: Since it is the realization and comprehension of that, it is the effect.

original: tshad ma ni blo las gzhan ma yin pas blo tshad ma nyid las 'bras bu yod pa ma @27a * //
analyzed: tshad ma ni blo las gzhan ma yin pas blo tshad ma nyid las 'bras bu yod pa ma @27a * //
translated: Since valid knowledge is not different from cognition, there is no effect other than cognition itself being valid knowledge.

original: yin no // blo yi skye ba gzhan yin no //
analyzed: yin no // blo yi skye ba gzhan yin no //
translated: The arising of cognition is different.

original: 'phro 'du rang gi rgyu las te //
analyzed: 'phro 'du rang gi rgyu las te //
translated: From its own cause,

original: tshad ma 'phrod pa 'du ba las //
analyzed: tshad ma 'phrod pa 'du ba las //
translated: from the contact of valid knowledge,

original: bye brag pa rnams kyi ni blo //
analyzed: bye brag pa rnams kyi ni blo //
translated: the cognition of the particulars arises.

original: rang gi rgyu las skyes pa'i 'bras bu'i chos 'phrod pa 'du ba dang yod pa la sogs pa yin la gal te 'phrod pa 'du ba de las dbang po'i blo skye bar 'dod na ni 'phrod pa 'du ba mngon sum du 'gyur la /
analyzed: rang gi rgyu las skyes pa'i 'bras bu'i chos 'phrod pa 'du ba dang yod pa la sogs pa yin la gal te 'phrod pa 'du ba de las dbang po'i blo skye bar 'dod na ni 'phrod pa 'du ba mngon sum du 'gyur la /
translated: For the Vai≈õe·π£ikas, the effect that arises from its own cause is the contact of the qualities of existence and so on. If they assert that the cognition of the sense faculty arises from that contact, then the contact would be direct perception.

original: de ni rtag pa yin pa'i phyir 'ga' zhig tu yang skye ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de ni rtag pa yin pa'i phyir 'ga' zhig tu yang skye ba ma yin no //
translated: because it is permanent, it does not arise at all.

original: de'i phyir gnyis ka'i ltar yang tshad ma de sbyar bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir gnyis ka'i ltar yang tshad ma de sbyar bar mi bya'o //
translated: Therefore, in neither case is that valid cognition applied.

original: ci ste gzhan min 'di don med /
analyzed: ci ste gzhan min 'di don med /
translated: If it is not different, this is meaningless.

original: gal te blo dang skye ba gzhan nyid ma yin na ni de ltar na blo nyid mngon sum ste /
analyzed: gal te blo dang skye ba gzhan nyid ma yin na ni de ltar na blo nyid mngon sum ste /
translated: If the cognition is not different from the arising, then the cognition itself is direct perception.

original: de bas na skye ba smos pa don med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bas na skye ba smos pa don med par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, it would be meaningless to mention arising.

original: skyes bu rnam par gyur nas blo //
analyzed: skyes bu rnam par gyur nas blo //
translated: If the person transforms and produces cognition,

original: bskyed na mi rtag pa ru 'gyur //
analyzed: bskyed na mi rtag pa ru 'gyur //
translated: it would be impermanent.

original: gal te blo bskyed par bya ba'i phyir skyes bu sngar gyi gnas skabs las rnam par 'gyur te gzhal bya la 'jug par byed do zhes brjod na ni de ltar na skyes bu mi rtag par 'gyur ba'i phyir mi 'dod pa thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te blo bskyed par bya ba'i phyir skyes bu sngar gyi gnas skabs las rnam par 'gyur te gzhal bya la 'jug par byed do zhes brjod na ni de ltar na skyes bu mi rtag par 'gyur ba'i phyir mi 'dod pa thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: If you say that the person transforms from its previous state in order to produce cognition and engages in the object of comprehension, then since the person would be impermanent, you would obtain an undesirable consequence.

original: ci ste bdag de mi 'gyur na //
analyzed: ci ste bdag de mi 'gyur na //
translated: If that self does not transform,

original: de la tshad ma zhes mi sbyar //
analyzed: de la tshad ma zhes mi sbyar //
translated: it is not called valid cognition.

original: skyes bu la 'gyur ba med na ni tshad ma ma yin pa'i gnas skabs dang 'di la khyad par med pa'i phyir de las skyes pa'i blo tshad mar byed pa ni mi 'thad pa nyid do //
analyzed: skyes bu la 'gyur ba med na ni tshad ma ma yin pa'i gnas skabs dang 'di la khyad par med pa'i phyir de las skyes pa'i blo tshad mar byed pa ni mi 'thad pa nyid do //
translated: If the person were immutable, then there would be no difference between the state of being a valid cognition and the state of not being a valid cognition, and it would not be tenable that the cognition produced from it is a valid cognition.

original: de ltar na gzhan dag gis 'dod pa'i mngon sum ni bsgrub par dka'o //
analyzed: de ltar na gzhan dag gis 'dod pa'i mngon sum ni bsgrub par dka'o //
translated: Thus, the perception that is accepted by others is difficult to establish.

original: tshad ma kun las btus pa las mngon sum gyi le'u ste dang po'o /
analyzed: tshad ma kun las btus pa las mngon sum gyi le'u ste dang po'o /
translated: This concludes the first chapter, on perception, in the Compendium of Valid Cognition.

original: // / rjes dpag rnam gnyis te /
analyzed: // / rjes dpag rnam gnyis te /
translated: Inference is of two kinds:

original: rang gi don dang / gzhan gyi don no //
analyzed: rang gi don dang / gzhan gyi don no //
translated: for one's own sake and for the sake of others.

original: de ltar rang don ni /
analyzed: de ltar rang don ni /
translated: Thus, for one's own sake,

original: tshul gsum rtags las don mthong ba'o //
analyzed: tshul gsum rtags las don mthong ba'o //
translated: one sees the object from the reason with three modes.

original: 'chad par 'gyur ba'i mtshan nyid gsum pa'i rtags las rjes su dpag par bya ba'i don mthong ba de ni rang gi don rjes su dpag go //
analyzed: 'chad par 'gyur ba'i mtshan nyid gsum pa'i rtags las rjes su dpag par bya ba'i don mthong ba de ni rang gi don rjes su dpag go //
translated: Seeing the object to be inferred from the reason with the three modes that will be explained is the inference for one's own sake.

original: 'di yang 'bras bu sngar bzhin te /
analyzed: 'di yang 'bras bu sngar bzhin te /
translated: This also has the same result as before.

original: ji ltar mngon sum las rtog pa gnyis nyid las 'bras bur brjod pa de bzhin du 'di la yang gal te gnyis ka yang rtog pa'i mtshan nyid can yin na 'di gnyis la bye brag ci zhig yod ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar mngon sum las rtog pa gnyis nyid las 'bras bur brjod pa de bzhin du 'di la yang gal te gnyis ka yang rtog pa'i mtshan nyid can yin na 'di gnyis la bye brag ci zhig yod ce na /
translated: Just as perception and inference are said to be effects of the two kinds of object, in the same way, if both are characterized by conceptualization, what is the difference between them?

original: yul dang ni /
analyzed: yul dang ni /
translated: The object

original: ngo bo mtshungs min de gnyis kyi //
analyzed: ngo bo mtshungs min de gnyis kyi //
translated: and the nature are not the same for the two.

original: mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa gnyis kyi yul ni tha dad pa ste /
analyzed: mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa gnyis kyi yul ni tha dad pa ste /
translated: The objects of perception and inference are different,

original: de'i rnam pa dang bye brag gi sgo nas so //
analyzed: de'i rnam pa dang bye brag gi sgo nas so //
translated: because they are distinguished by the form of the object.

original: rang gi ngo bo yang tha dad pa yin no //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo yang tha dad pa yin no //
translated: Their natures are also different.

original: gal te ci'i phyir rjes su @27b dpag pa kho na gnyis su dbye zhe na /
analyzed: gal te ci'i phyir rjes su @27b dpag pa kho na gnyis su dbye zhe na /
translated: If you ask why inference is divided into two,

original: 'di'i phyir te /
analyzed: 'di'i phyir te /
translated: it is for this reason.üîΩThe definition of the object to be known is:

original: rang gi mtshan nyid bstan bya yin /
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid bstan bya yin /
translated: The object to be known is the particular inherent characteristic,

original: gzung tha dad phyir //
analyzed: gzung tha dad phyir //
translated: because it is grasped as different.

original: mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa dag ni rang gi ngo bo bzhin du gzung bar bya ba yang tha dad pa yin no //
analyzed: mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa dag ni rang gi ngo bo bzhin du gzung bar bya ba yang tha dad pa yin no //
translated: Perception and inference are different in the way they grasp their objects, just as they are different in their natures.

original: gal te mngon sum gyi don la tha snyad du byed na sgra de gnyis kyi sgo nas rjes su dpag par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te mngon sum gyi don la tha snyad du byed na sgra de gnyis kyi sgo nas rjes su dpag par 'gyur ro //
translated: If the meaning of perception is taken as the conventional object, then inference would be engaged by means of those two terms.

original: gal te la lar mngon sum gyi don la rjes su dpag pa 'jug pa mthong ste /
analyzed: gal te la lar mngon sum gyi don la rjes su dpag pa 'jug pa mthong ste /
translated: If you see that the meaning of perception is sometimes engaged by inference,

original: dper na gzugs las reg bya bzhin no zhe na /
analyzed: dper na gzugs las reg bya bzhin no zhe na /
translated: like the tangible object from form.

original: de lta na ni mthong na don de la mngon sum bzhin du rjes su dpag pa zhugs pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta na ni mthong na don de la mngon sum bzhin du rjes su dpag pa zhugs pa ni ma yin no //
translated: In that case, when seeing, inference is not engaged in that object as if it were perception.

original: gang gi phyir zhe na /üîΩde las gzhan /
analyzed: gang gi phyir zhe na / de las gzhan /
translated: Why is that?üîΩBecause it is different from that.

original: de las gzhan zhes bya ba ni /üîΩsngon mthong ba zhugs pa'i rgyu las reg bya rjes su dpog pa ste /
analyzed: de las gzhan zhes bya ba ni / sngon mthong ba zhugs pa'i rgyu las reg bya rjes su dpog pa ste /
translated: Different from that meansüîΩinferring the tangible object from something other than that,

original: 'di ltar gzugs de nyid mngon sum gyi rnam pa dang bral nas gzugs kyi spyi la reg bya'i spyi'i rjes su dpog pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar gzugs de nyid mngon sum gyi rnam pa dang bral nas gzugs kyi spyi la reg bya'i spyi'i rjes su dpog pa yin no //
translated: because that form, separated from the aspect of perception, infers the universal of the tangible object from the universal of form.

original: mngon sum du byas pa'i reg par bya ba'i bye brag ni bstan par bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir tshad ma gnyis kyi spyod yul gcig par gyur pa ni yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: mngon sum du byas pa'i reg par bya ba'i bye brag ni bstan par bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir tshad ma gnyis kyi spyod yul gcig par gyur pa ni yod pa ma yin no //
translated: The particular of the tangible that is perceived is not to be indicated, therefore, the two valid cognitions do not have the same domain.

original: gal te 'di ltar mthong ba la sogs pa la mthong ba la sogs pa'i tha snyad du byed pa'i phyir ji ltar mngon sum bstan par bya ba yin zhe na /
analyzed: gal te 'di ltar mthong ba la sogs pa la mthong ba la sogs pa'i tha snyad du byed pa'i phyir ji ltar mngon sum bstan par bya ba yin zhe na /
translated: If it is asked, ‚ÄúSince seeing, etc., are conventionally designated as seeing, etc., in that way, how are they taught to be perception?‚Äù

original: 'di la 'gal ba yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di la 'gal ba yod pa ma yin te /
translated: There is no contradiction here.üîΩIn that regard,

original: der yang / mthong sogs nyid sgo nas bstan pa //
analyzed: der yang / mthong sogs nyid sgo nas bstan pa //
translated: it is taught by way of seeing, etc.,

original: rang gi ngo bo brjod pa yin //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo brjod pa yin //
translated: but its own nature is not expressed.

original: mthong ngo // thos so //
analyzed: mthong ngo // thos so //
translated: ‚ÄúI see,‚Äù ‚ÄúI hear,‚Äù

original: shes so zhes bya ba'i rgyu mtshan gyi sgra'i sgo nas don de rnams brjod pa yin gyi rang gi ngo bo'i sgo nas ni ma yin te /
analyzed: shes so zhes bya ba'i rgyu mtshan gyi sgra'i sgo nas don de rnams brjod pa yin gyi rang gi ngo bo'i sgo nas ni ma yin te /
translated: ‚ÄúI know‚Äù ‚Äî those objects are expressed by way of the terms that are the reasons for those, but they are not expressed by way of their own nature.

original: 'di ltar mig gi rnam par shes pas mthong bar 'gyur ba'i don la yid kyi rnam par shes pas sngon po ji lta bar shes so //
analyzed: 'di ltar mig gi rnam par shes pas mthong bar 'gyur ba'i don la yid kyi rnam par shes pas sngon po ji lta bar shes so //
translated: In this way, the object that is seen by eye consciousness is known by mental consciousness as blue.

original: 'di sngon po'o zhes rjod par byed do //
analyzed: 'di sngon po'o zhes rjod par byed do //
translated: One says, This is blue.

original: der yang / ming las shes phyir rnam pa gzhan //
analyzed: der yang / ming las shes phyir rnam pa gzhan //
translated: And there, Because of the knowledge from the name, the other aspect,

original: bstan bya yid kyi rnam pa gnyis //
analyzed: bstan bya yid kyi rnam pa gnyis //
translated: The object to be indicated, is of two kinds for the mental consciousness.

original: gang gi phyir mig gi rnam par shes pas sngon po ma yin pa las log pa'i don nyams su myong ba la yid kyi rnam par shes pa thob par nus so zhes tha snyad du byed pa la yid kyi rnam pa gnyis po zhes brjod do //
analyzed: gang gi phyir mig gi rnam par shes pas sngon po ma yin pa las log pa'i don nyams su myong ba la yid kyi rnam par shes pa thob par nus so zhes tha snyad du byed pa la yid kyi rnam pa gnyis po zhes brjod do //
translated: Because of the expression, The mental consciousness is able to experience the object that is the opposite of non-blue, the two aspects of the mental consciousness are mentioned.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid bstan bya min //
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid bstan bya min //
translated: The specific characteristic is not the object to be indicated.

original: zhes byas pas na rtogs par bya ba'i don gyi bdag nyid mngon sum gyi yul yin zhing spyi rjes su dpag pa'i yul nyid du mngon par brjod pas mngon par brjod @28a * //
analyzed: zhes byas pas na rtogs par bya ba'i don gyi bdag nyid mngon sum gyi yul yin zhing spyi rjes su dpag pa'i yul nyid du mngon par brjod pas mngon par brjod @28a * //
translated: Since it is said, The object to be realized is the domain of direct perception, and the universal is the domain of inference, the universal is indicated by the expression indicated.

original: do ; / gal te 'di ltar rjes dpag thams cad spyi'i yul can no zhes ni brjod par mi bya ste /
analyzed: do ; / gal te 'di ltar rjes dpag thams cad spyi'i yul can no zhes ni brjod par mi bya ste /
translated: If it is said that all inferences have a universal as their domain, that is not so.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: spyi ma yin la'ang mthong ba'i phyir //
analyzed: spyi ma yin la'ang mthong ba'i phyir //
translated: Because it is seen even in the absence of a universal.

original: spyi ma yin la'ang zhes bya ba ni mthong ba'i rlung la sogs pa'i rang bzhin reg bya la sogs pas rjes su dpog pa'o //
analyzed: spyi ma yin la'ang zhes bya ba ni mthong ba'i rlung la sogs pa'i rang bzhin reg bya la sogs pas rjes su dpog pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúAlso in the non-universal‚Äù means that the nature of the wind seen, etc. is inferred by means of the tactile sensation, etc.

original: de skad du yang reg bya ni reg bya mthong ba rnams kyi ma yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pas brjod do zhe na /
analyzed: de skad du yang reg bya ni reg bya mthong ba rnams kyi ma yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pas brjod do zhe na /
translated: Thus it is said: ‚ÄúThe tactile sensation is not of those who see the tactile sensation, etc.‚Äù

original: de min mtshon bya spyi yin phyir //
analyzed: de min mtshon bya spyi yin phyir //
translated: That is not so, because the object indicated is a universal.

original: rlung la sogs pa de rjes su dpag pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: rlung la sogs pa de rjes su dpag pa ni ma yin te /
translated: The wind, etc. is not inferred.

original: gang gi phyir reg bya la sogs pa'i yon tan nyid kyi rten nyid kyi phyir mtshon pa'i phyir ram /
analyzed: gang gi phyir reg bya la sogs pa'i yon tan nyid kyi rten nyid kyi phyir mtshon pa'i phyir ram /
translated: Because the tactile sensation, etc. is the very substratum of the quality itself, it is indicated as the substratum.

original: yang na rlung la sogs pa'i rang bzhin khyad par can du rjes su dpag pa ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: yang na rlung la sogs pa'i rang bzhin khyad par can du rjes su dpag pa ni ma yin gyi /
translated: Or else, the special nature of the wind, etc. is not inferred.

original: gang gi phyir rdzas nyid tsam gyi spyi de la reg bya la sogs pa rnams kyi rten rdzas nyid du mtshon par bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir rdzas nyid tsam gyi spyi de la reg bya la sogs pa rnams kyi rten rdzas nyid du mtshon par bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the universal of mere substance is indicated as the substratum of the tactile sensation, etc. in the substance itself.

original: gal te kun gyi rjes thogs las //
analyzed: gal te kun gyi rjes thogs las //
translated: If it were immediately after all,

original: grub ste 'di ltar kun gyi rjes thogs las rlung la sogs pa'i rang bzhin rjes su dpag par grub pa'o //
analyzed: grub ste 'di ltar kun gyi rjes thogs las rlung la sogs pa'i rang bzhin rjes su dpag par grub pa'o //
translated: It is established, because the nature of wind, etc., is inferred from the fact that they follow all the qualities.

original: de skad du yang reg bya ni mthong ba rnams kyi yang ma yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa brjod do zha na /
analyzed: de skad du yang reg bya ni mthong ba rnams kyi yang ma yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa brjod do zha na /
translated: But it is said that the tangible is not of those that are seen, etc.

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: No, it is not so,

original: de yod par ma grub pa'i phyir dang / ldog pa yang mtshungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de yod par ma grub pa'i phyir dang / ldog pa yang mtshungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because its existence is not established, and because the negation is the same.

original: rlung la sogs pa yod par grub na ni mi ldog pa yang srid de /
analyzed: rlung la sogs pa yod par grub na ni mi ldog pa yang srid de /
translated: If the existence of wind, etc., were established, then the negation would be possible.

original: yon tan gyi bye brag dang 'brel pa las yon tan gyi spyi bor nas yon tan gyi bye brag gis rdzas kyi bye brag rjes su dpog par byed la /
analyzed: yon tan gyi bye brag dang 'brel pa las yon tan gyi spyi bor nas yon tan gyi bye brag gis rdzas kyi bye brag rjes su dpog par byed la /
translated: From the connection with a particular quality, the particular substance is inferred from the particular quality, because of the universal of quality.

original: reg na yod par ni grub pa med do //
analyzed: reg na yod par ni grub pa med do //
translated: But the existence of the tangible is not established.

original: sa la sogs pa las log pa dang yang mtshungs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: sa la sogs pa las log pa dang yang mtshungs par 'gyur te /
translated: And it would be the same as the negation of earth, etc.

original: yon tan gyi bye brag ma mthong zhing ma mthong ba tsam gyis mthong ba las log par grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yon tan gyi bye brag ma mthong zhing ma mthong ba tsam gyis mthong ba las log par grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the particular quality is not seen, and the mere non-seeing is not established as the negation of seeing.

original: de ltar yang rigs pa ma yin te /üîΩmthong ba lus can thogs pa dang bcas pa tsam las /
analyzed: de ltar yang rigs pa ma yin te / mthong ba lus can thogs pa dang bcas pa tsam las /
translated: But that is not logical.

original: yid kyi yon tan rjes su dpog pa'i phyir reg bya ldog par grub pa ma yin no //
analyzed: yid kyi yon tan rjes su dpog pa'i phyir reg bya ldog par grub pa ma yin no //
translated: Because the tactile is inferred from the qualities of the mind, which are seen in the body, which is obstructed.üîΩThe tactile is not established as being obstructed.

original: gang gi phyir mthong ba rnams las mthong ba'i phyir dang / ma mthong ba rnams las ma mthong ba'i phyir reg bya ni mthong ba rnams kho na'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir mthong ba rnams las mthong ba'i phyir dang / ma mthong ba rnams las ma mthong ba'i phyir reg bya ni mthong ba rnams kho na'o //
translated: Because the tactile is seen among the seen, and is not seen among the unseen, the tactile is only among the seen.

original: de rnams ni du ma yin pa'i phyir 'di gang gi yin zhes the tshom du ni 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de rnams ni du ma yin pa'i phyir 'di gang gi yin zhes the tshom du ni 'gyur ro //
translated: Because those are many, there is doubt as to which one it is.

original: de'i phyir thams cad bkag nas rlung rjes su dpog pa ni rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir thams cad bkag nas rlung rjes su dpog pa ni rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is not logical to infer wind after refuting all of them.üîΩMoreover,

original: gzhan yang / yid ches tshig gi sgrub byed kyis //
analyzed: gzhan yang / yid ches tshig gi sgrub byed kyis //
translated: The proof by the words of the trustworthy

original: @28b de las gzhan la 'gegs par byed //
analyzed: @28b de las gzhan la 'gegs par byed //
translated: Refutes the other.

original: 'dis kyang ste /
analyzed: 'dis kyang ste /
translated: This also

original: gang 'di rdzas kyi spyi rjes su dpag nas de la yod par rjes su dpog pa bor nas /
analyzed: gang 'di rdzas kyi spyi rjes su dpag nas de la yod par rjes su dpog pa bor nas /
translated: After inferring the universal of substance, it is illogical to infer that it exists there.

original: yid ches pa'i tshig gi tshad mas rdzas gzhan la yod pa bkag nas rlung la yod pa sgrub par byed pas na yang de nyid kyi'o //
analyzed: yid ches pa'i tshig gi tshad mas rdzas gzhan la yod pa bkag nas rlung la yod pa sgrub par byed pas na yang de nyid kyi'o //
translated: The valid cognition of trustworthy words refutes that sound exists as a different substance and establishes that it exists in the vƒÅyu.

original: de bzhin du gzhan rnams kyi yang yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du gzhan rnams kyi yang yin no //
translated: The same is true of the others.

original: de'i phyir rlung la sogs pa lung las grub pa tsam du ni 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir rlung la sogs pa lung las grub pa tsam du ni 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore sound and so on are established by mere scripture.

original: gal te tha mi dad du grub ce na /
analyzed: gal te tha mi dad du grub ce na /
translated: If it is established as undifferentiated,

original: 'di ltar lung dang rjes su dpag pa dag gis tha mi dad du grub pa'i phyir rjes su dpag pa rang gi mtshan nyid kyi yul can nyid du 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: 'di ltar lung dang rjes su dpag pa dag gis tha mi dad du grub pa'i phyir rjes su dpag pa rang gi mtshan nyid kyi yul can nyid du 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: since it is established as undifferentiated by scripture and inference, inference would have a nature that is its object.

original: de ni / ma yin tha dad kyang srid phyir //
analyzed: de ni / ma yin tha dad kyang srid phyir //
translated: That is not so, because it is possible that it is different.

original: rab tu grags pa'i dbang gis dpe ni bstan par mi bya'o zhes kha cig gis rjes su dpag pa las sgra tha dad du 'byed par byed do //
analyzed: rab tu grags pa'i dbang gis dpe ni bstan par mi bya'o zhes kha cig gis rjes su dpag pa las sgra tha dad du 'byed par byed do //
translated: Some say that sound is differentiated from inference because an example is not indicated by the power of renown.

original: de ltar grags pa'i phyir dpe bstan par mi bya ba yin na ni dper na dud pa las me rjes su dpog pa lta bu der don yod pa'i rjes su dpog pa yang sgrar thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar grags pa'i phyir dpe bstan par mi bya ba yin na ni dper na dud pa las me rjes su dpog pa lta bu der don yod pa'i rjes su dpog pa yang sgrar thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If the example is not taught because it is well known, then it follows that the example of inferring fire from smoke is also a word, since the existence of the object is inferred there.

original: gzhan dag ni don gyi sgra la tha mi dad kyi /
analyzed: gzhan dag ni don gyi sgra la tha mi dad kyi /
translated: Others say that the word is not different from the object,

original: sgras nye bar brtags pa ste don de nyid rjes su dpog pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni khyad par ro zhes zer ro //
analyzed: sgras nye bar brtags pa ste don de nyid rjes su dpog pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni khyad par ro zhes zer ro //
translated: but is imagined by the word. The object itself is not inferred. This is the difference.

original: de lta na yang sgras tha mi dad du nye bar brtags pa las don rjes su dpog go zhes ji ltar brjod par bya /
analyzed: de lta na yang sgras tha mi dad du nye bar brtags pa las don rjes su dpog go zhes ji ltar brjod par bya /
translated: Even so, how can it be said that the object is inferred from what is imagined to be non-different from the word?

original: shing gi sgra'i brjod bya'i don gzhan ma yin pas rdzas kyi sgras don de nyid go ru zin kyang tshul gzhan gyi sgo nas rdzas gzhan ma yin pa las bzlog pa go ba yin no //
analyzed: shing gi sgra'i brjod bya'i don gzhan ma yin pas rdzas kyi sgras don de nyid go ru zin kyang tshul gzhan gyi sgo nas rdzas gzhan ma yin pa las bzlog pa go ba yin no //
translated: Since the meaning expressed by the word tree is not different, even though the meaning of that is understood from the word substance, it is understood in a different way, as the opposite of non-substance.

original: gal te shing gi sgras rdzas ma yin pa las log pa go bar byed du zin mod kyis kyang don las yin gyi sgra las ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gal te shing gi sgras rdzas ma yin pa las log pa go bar byed du zin mod kyis kyang don las yin gyi sgra las ni ma yin no //
translated: Even if the word tree does cause one to understand the opposite of non-substance, it does so by the meaning, not by the word.

original: de'i phyir skyon med de zhe na /
analyzed: de'i phyir skyon med de zhe na /
translated: Therefore, there is no fault.

original: skyon du ni mi 'gyur la rag la /
analyzed: skyon du ni mi 'gyur la rag la /
translated: There is no fault, but

original: shing la sogs pa'i tshig las gzhan pa'i sgra nyid tshad mar brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: shing la sogs pa'i tshig las gzhan pa'i sgra nyid tshad mar brjod par bya ste /
translated: the word itself, which is different from the words tree and so on, should be stated as the valid means of knowledge.

original: bya ba brjod pa'i sgras kyang don gyi tshul de nyid go bar byed do //
analyzed: bya ba brjod pa'i sgras kyang don gyi tshul de nyid go bar byed do //
translated: The word that expresses the action also causes one to understand that very mode of the meaning.

original: gang dag ngag kho na sgra yin te /
analyzed: gang dag ngag kho na sgra yin te /
translated: Those who say that speech alone is the word

original: tshig ni de rtog par byed pa'i rgyu ma yin la /
analyzed: tshig ni de rtog par byed pa'i rgyu ma yin la /
translated: say that the word is not the cause of the conception of the meaning,üîΩbecause the meaning is understood from the mere nature of that sound.

original: sgra de'i ngo bo tsam las don rtogs pa'i phyir ro zhes khyad par can gzhan tsam nye bar blangs nas rjes su dpag pa las sgra tha dad du brjod ces brjod do //üîΩde la bsam pa ni sgra dang bral ba'i rtags de rjes su dpag par brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: sgra de'i ngo bo tsam las don rtogs pa'i phyir ro zhes khyad par can gzhan tsam nye bar blangs nas rjes su dpag pa las sgra tha dad du brjod ces brjod do //üîΩde la bsam pa ni sgra dang bral ba'i rtags de rjes su dpag par brjod pa yin no //
translated: The intention is that the inference stated is free from sound.

original: sgra yang yul thun mong ma yin pa dang 'brel ba yod pa ma yin pas @29a * //
analyzed: sgra yang yul thun mong ma yin pa dang 'brel ba yod pa ma yin pas @29a * //
translated: Sound is not related to a unique object.

original: rnam pa gnyis ka rjes su dpag pa brtag par bya ste /
analyzed: rnam pa gnyis ka rjes su dpag pa brtag par bya ste /
translated: Both are to be examined as to their being inferences.

original: mthong ba'i don dang ma mthong ba'i don no //
analyzed: mthong ba'i don dang ma mthong ba'i don no //
translated: The meaning of what is seen and the meaning of what is not seen.

original: de la mthong ba'i don la ni mi gsal bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: de la mthong ba'i don la ni mi gsal bar byed pa'o //
translated: In the meaning of what is seen, it is not clear.

original: ma mthong ba'i don la ni rnam par rtog pa tsam 'ba' zhig ste /
analyzed: ma mthong ba'i don la ni rnam par rtog pa tsam 'ba' zhig ste /
translated: In the meaning of what is not seen, it is only a mere conception.

original: don gyi bye brag rtog par byed pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: don gyi bye brag rtog par byed pa ni ma yin no //
translated: It does not conceive the particulars of the meaning.

original: gal te mtho ris la sogs pa'i sgras don tsam brjod pa ni ma yin na ji ltar rjes su dpag pa nyid du 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: gal te mtho ris la sogs pa'i sgras don tsam brjod pa ni ma yin na ji ltar rjes su dpag pa nyid du 'gyur zhe na /
translated: If the words such as heaven do not express the mere meaning, how can they be inferences?

original: yid ches tshig kyang mi slu bar //
analyzed: yid ches tshig kyang mi slu bar //
translated: Because the words of a trustworthy person are not deceptive,

original: mtshungs phyir rjes su dpag pa nyid //
analyzed: mtshungs phyir rjes su dpag pa nyid //
translated: they are like inferences.

original: yid ches pa'i tshig nyid bzung nas kyang mi bslu bar mtshungs pa'i phyir de yang rjes su dpag pa nyid du brjod do //
analyzed: yid ches pa'i tshig nyid bzung nas kyang mi bslu bar mtshungs pa'i phyir de yang rjes su dpag pa nyid du brjod do //
translated: Even when the words of a trustworthy person are accepted, because they are not deceptive, they are also said to be like inferences.

original: de skad du yang /
analyzed: de skad du yang /
translated: Thus it is said:

original: ming gi las rnams kyi don du mngon sum song ba'i phyir ro zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: ming gi las rnams kyi don du mngon sum song ba'i phyir ro zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: because they are directly perceived in the function of names.

original: de dag gis ni phyogs dang gtso bo la sogs pa'i rang bzhin la yang rjes su dpag pa dgag par bya'o //
analyzed: de dag gis ni phyogs dang gtso bo la sogs pa'i rang bzhin la yang rjes su dpag pa dgag par bya'o //
translated: And by these, inference is to be refuted even in regard to the nature of direction, principal, etc.

original: de'i phyir rjes su dpag pa'i yul ni rang gi mtshan nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir rjes su dpag pa'i yul ni rang gi mtshan nyid ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the own characteristic is not the object of inference.

original: tshul gsum pa'i rtags zhes gang brjod pa de brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: tshul gsum pa'i rtags zhes gang brjod pa de brjod par bya ste /
translated: Now, that which is called the trimodal logical reason should be stated.

original: rjes dpag bya dang de mthun la //
analyzed: rjes dpag bya dang de mthun la //
translated: The object of inference and that which is similar to it

original: yod dang med nyid la med pa'o //
analyzed: yod dang med nyid la med pa'o //
translated: do not exist in regard to existence and nonexistence.

original: rjes su dpag par bya ba ni chos kyi khyad par du byas pa'i chos can no //
analyzed: rjes su dpag par bya ba ni chos kyi khyad par du byas pa'i chos can no //
translated: The object of inference is the subject characterized by a property.

original: de la mngon sum mam rjes su dpag pas mthong gi rjes la de'i rigs dang mthun pa la yang spyi'i tshul gyis phyogs thams cad dam phyogs gcig la yod par grub pa'o //
analyzed: de la mngon sum mam rjes su dpag pas mthong gi rjes la de'i rigs dang mthun pa la yang spyi'i tshul gyis phyogs thams cad dam phyogs gcig la yod par grub pa'o //
translated: In regard to that, one sees by direct perception or by inference. Subsequently, in regard to that which is similar to it, by the method of the universal, one establishes its existence in all directions or in one direction.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de dang mthun pa kho na la yod ces nges par gzung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dang mthun pa kho na la yod ces nges par gzung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is ascertained that it exists only in that which is similar to it.

original: de dang mthun pa la yod pa kho na'o zhes ni brjod par mi bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dang mthun pa la yod pa kho na'o zhes ni brjod par mi bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: But it should not be said that it exists only in what is similar to it.

original: med pa nyid las med pa zhes pas ni slar yang de nyid nges par bya ba'i don du ste /
analyzed: med pa nyid las med pa zhes pas ni slar yang de nyid nges par bya ba'i don du ste /
translated: From ‚Äúnonexistence in the non-existent‚Äù on, he states this again in order to ascertain it.

original: med pa nyid la med pa nyid yin gyi gzhan la yang ma yin la 'gal ba la yang ma yin no zhes pa'i don no //
analyzed: med pa nyid la med pa nyid yin gyi gzhan la yang ma yin la 'gal ba la yang ma yin no zhes pa'i don no //
translated: The meaning is that it is nonexistence in nonexistence, not in anything else, nor in the contradictory.

original: bsgrub par bya ba'i rigs dang mthun pa la yod pa dang med pa la med pa nyid do zhes bya ba de dag gis ni gang tshul gsum pa'i rtags las rtags can rtogs so zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba'i rigs dang mthun pa la yod pa dang med pa la med pa nyid do zhes bya ba de dag gis ni gang tshul gsum pa'i rtags las rtags can rtogs so zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: ‚Äú Existence in the similar class of the probandum, and nonexistence in the dissimilar class of the probandum‚Äù ‚Äî by these two, he shows that the probandum is understood from the reason having the three modes.

original: ci ste shes par bya ba yin no zhe na smos par bya ba ma yin te gang gi phyir /
analyzed: ci ste shes par bya ba yin no zhe na smos par bya ba ma yin te gang gi phyir /
translated: If it is asked, ‚ÄúIs it to be known?‚Äù it is not to be stated, because

original: 'di ru shes pa'ang thob pa nyid //
analyzed: 'di ru shes pa'ang thob pa nyid //
translated: here, the knowledge is also obtained.

original: ma brjod pa de ji ltar thob ce na /
analyzed: ma brjod pa de ji ltar thob ce na /
translated: If it is asked, ‚ÄúHow is that obtained without stating it?‚Äù

original: shes byed skabs kyi dbang byas phyir //
analyzed: shes byed skabs kyi dbang byas phyir //
translated: Because it is controlled by the context of the knower.

original: 'dir gtan tshigs ni shes par byed pa'i dbang du byas @29b pa'i phyir de yang rtog pa po rang gi bdag nyid la ltos nas rtogs par byed pa'i rgyu yin gyi /
analyzed: 'dir gtan tshigs ni shes par byed pa'i dbang du byas @29b pa'i phyir de yang rtog pa po rang gi bdag nyid la ltos nas rtogs par byed pa'i rgyu yin gyi /
translated: Here, the reason is from the point of view of the one who makes known, and that is the cause of understanding in dependence on the self of the one who understands.

original: byed pa po bzhin du ltos pa ma yin pa'i phyir tshul gsum grub na rtags su brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: byed pa po bzhin du ltos pa ma yin pa'i phyir tshul gsum grub na rtags su brjod pa yin no //
translated: But, unlike the agent, it is not independent, so when the three modes are established, it is stated as the reason.

original: tshul re re dang gnyis gnyis pa //
analyzed: tshul re re dang gnyis gnyis pa //
translated: Each mode and two modes

original: rtags don min par don gyis byas //
analyzed: rtags don min par don gyis byas //
translated: are not the meaning of the reason, but are made to be the meaning.

original: de la tshul re re ba ni gang rjes su dpag par bya ba la yod do //
analyzed: de la tshul re re ba ni gang rjes su dpag par bya ba la yod do //
translated: Among those, each mode is that which exists in the inferable,

original: de dang mthun pa la ni med //
analyzed: de dang mthun pa la ni med //
translated: but does not exist in what is similar to it.

original: de med pa la ni med pa ma yin pa dang / de dang mthun pa la yod /üîΩrjes su dpag par bya ba la ni med /üîΩde med pa la ni sems med pa ma yin pa dang / de med pa la med /
analyzed: de med pa la ni med pa ma yin pa dang / de dang mthun pa la yod / rjes su dpag par bya ba la ni med / de med pa la ni sems med pa ma yin pa dang / de med pa la med /
translated: That which does not exist in the absence of that is not nonexistent,üîΩand that which exists in what is similar to it does not exist in the inferable.üîΩThat which does not exist in the absence of that is not nonexistent,

original: rjes su dpag par bya ba la yang med /
analyzed: rjes su dpag par bya ba la yang med /
translated: and that which does not exist in the absence of that does not exist in the inferable.üîΩThat which does not exist in the inferable

original: de dang mthun pa la yang med pa'o //
analyzed: de dang mthun pa la yang med pa'o //
translated: and that which does not exist in what is similar to it.

original: tshul gnyis pa ni 'di ltar rjes su dpag par bya ba la yod /üîΩde dang mthun pa la yang yod /
analyzed: tshul gnyis pa ni 'di ltar rjes su dpag par bya ba la yod / de dang mthun pa la yang yod /
translated: The second method is as follows: The evidence is present in the object of inference.üîΩIt is also present in what is similar to that.üîΩIt is not absent in what is not that.

original: de med pa la yang med pa ma yin pa dang / rjes su dpag par bya ba la yod do //
analyzed: de med pa la yang med pa ma yin pa dang / rjes su dpag par bya ba la yod do //
translated: It is present in the object of inference.

original: de med pa la med /üîΩde dang mthun pa la yang yod pa ma yin pa dang / de dang mthun pa la yod /
analyzed: de med pa la med / de dang mthun pa la yang yod pa ma yin pa dang / de dang mthun pa la yod /
translated: It is not present in what is not that.üîΩIt is present in what is similar to that.

original: de med pa la med /
analyzed: de med pa la med /
translated: It is not present in what is not that.üîΩIt is not present in the object of inference.

original: rjes su dpag par bya ba la yang med pa'o zhes bya ba de dag gis ni rtags ltar snang ba rnam pa drug tu bsgrubs par don gyis go bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rjes su dpag par bya ba la yang med pa'o zhes bya ba de dag gis ni rtags ltar snang ba rnam pa drug tu bsgrubs par don gyis go bar rig par bya'o //
translated: These six types of fallacious evidence are to be understood as established by implication.

original: dper na / sgra rtag byas pa'i phyir lus can //
analyzed: dper na / sgra rtag byas pa'i phyir lus can //
translated: For example: Sound is permanent because it is produced,

original: phyir dang gzhal bya min phyir ro //
analyzed: phyir dang gzhal bya min phyir ro //
translated: because it is an object of knowledge,

original: lus can min phyir ma nyan bya'i phyir //
analyzed: lus can min phyir ma nyan bya'i phyir //
translated: because it is not an embodied being, because it is not heard,

original: mig gis gzung ba'i phyir mi rtag / ces pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: mig gis gzung ba'i phyir mi rtag / ces pa lta bu'o //
translated: because it is perceived by the eyes, and because it is impermanent.

original: 'di la / kha cig gtan tshigs mi 'khrul pas //
analyzed: 'di la / kha cig gtan tshigs mi 'khrul pas //
translated: Some assert that the evidence is nonerroneous

original: chos gzhan dpag par bya bar 'dod //
analyzed: chos gzhan dpag par bya bar 'dod //
translated: and that another property is the object of inference.

original: kha cig ni gang gi phyir me dang dud pa ni lhan cig rgyu ba mthong gi me dang lhan cig pa'i sa phyogs dang ni ma yin no //
analyzed: kha cig ni gang gi phyir me dang dud pa ni lhan cig rgyu ba mthong gi me dang lhan cig pa'i sa phyogs dang ni ma yin no //
translated: Some say: Smoke and fire are seen to move together, but not the place occupied by fire and the place occupied by smoke.

original: de'i phyir me kho na dud pas rjes su dpag par bya ba'o zhes zer ro //üîΩchos dang chos can dag grub phyir //
analyzed: de'i phyir me kho na dud pas rjes su dpag par bya ba'o zhes zer ro // chos dang chos can dag grub phyir //
translated: Therefore, it is fire alone that is inferred by smoke.üîΩOthers say: Fire and the place occupied by fire are established for the world.üîΩTherefore, it is not fire and the place occupied by fire, but the relation between them that is inferred by smoke.

original: 'brel pa dpag byar kha cig 'dod //
analyzed: 'brel pa dpag byar kha cig 'dod //
translated: Some assert that the relation is to be inferred in order to establish the property and the subject.

original: gzhan dag na re gang gi phyir me dang sa phyogs dag ni 'jig rten pa la grub pa nyid de /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re gang gi phyir me dang sa phyogs dag ni 'jig rten pa la grub pa nyid de /
translated: Others say: Since fire and the place occupied by fire are established for the world,

original: de'i phyir me dang sa phyogs dag ni ma yin gyi 'brel pa de dud pas rjes su dpag par bya'o zhes zer ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir me dang sa phyogs dag ni ma yin gyi 'brel pa de dud pas rjes su dpag par bya'o zhes zer ro //
translated: it is not fire and the place occupied by fire, but the relation between them that is inferred by smoke.

original: re zhig de snga ma la lan brjod pa //
analyzed: re zhig de snga ma la lan brjod pa //
translated: First, the response to the former is:

original: chos la gtan tshigs grub na ni //
analyzed: chos la gtan tshigs grub na ni //
translated: If the property is established as the reason,üîΩwhat else is inferred from it by that?

original: de yis de las gzhan ci dpag / gal te chos gzhan me la gtan tshigs dud pa dmigs pa nyid yin pa lta @30a * //üîΩna yang dud pas ci zhig rjes su dpag par bya /
analyzed: de yis de las gzhan ci dpag / gal te chos gzhan me la gtan tshigs dud pa dmigs pa nyid yin pa lta @30a * //üîΩna yang dud pas ci zhig rjes su dpag par bya /
translated: If another property, such as fire, is the reason, then what is inferred by smoke?

original: don gang me dang dud pa dag gis 'brel pa dran par byed do zhe na /üîΩde ltar chos can de nyid la //
analyzed: don gang me dang dud pa dag gis 'brel pa dran par byed do zhe na / de ltar chos can de nyid la //
translated: ‚ÄúThe meaning is that fire and smoke are remembered as being related.‚ÄùüîΩWhy not accept that very same thing

original: dpag byar ci yi phyir mi 'dod //
analyzed: dpag byar ci yi phyir mi 'dod //
translated: as the object of inference?

original: gal te me dang 'brel pa'i sa phyogs su dud pa dmigs pa las rjes su dpag par bya ba lta na me dang ldan pa'i sa phyogs de nyid rjes su dpag par bya'o zhes ci'i phyir mi 'dod /
analyzed: gal te me dang 'brel pa'i sa phyogs su dud pa dmigs pa las rjes su dpag par bya ba lta na me dang ldan pa'i sa phyogs de nyid rjes su dpag par bya'o zhes ci'i phyir mi 'dod /
translated: If you say that smoke is inferred from the observation of smoke in a place related to fire, why not accept that the very same place that is related to fire is the object of inference?

original: der me yod par mi rtogs pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: der me yod par mi rtogs pa ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not that one does not understand that fire exists there.üîΩTo those who say that the relation is inferred, we reply:

original: gang dag 'brel pa dpag par bya'o zhes zer bde la brjod pa dang / 'brel pa'ang gnyis ni yod ma yin //
analyzed: gang dag 'brel pa dpag par bya'o zhes zer bde la brjod pa dang / 'brel pa'ang gnyis ni yod ma yin //
translated: The relation does not exist in two ways.

original: gang na dud pa yod pa de na me yod do zhes 'di ltar tha snyad byed kyi me'am dud pa'i 'brel ba la sogs pa yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gang na dud pa yod pa de na me yod do zhes 'di ltar tha snyad byed kyi me'am dud pa'i 'brel ba la sogs pa yod pa ma yin no //
translated: One uses the expression ‚Äúwhere there is smoke there is fire,‚Äù but the relation of fire and smoke does not exist in the way that the two are apprehended.üîΩMoreover,

original: gzhan yang / de bzhin drug pa'i sgra ru 'gyur //
analyzed: gzhan yang / de bzhin drug pa'i sgra ru 'gyur //
translated: the word ‚Äúsixth‚Äù would be meaningless.

original: 'brel pa rjes su dpag par bya ba byed pa'i lta na 'brel pa can gyi mes me 'di 'brel pa zhes drug pa'i sgra thob par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: 'brel pa rjes su dpag par bya ba byed pa'i lta na 'brel pa can gyi mes me 'di 'brel pa zhes drug pa'i sgra thob par 'gyur gyi /
translated: If the relation were inferred from the effect, then the relation of the fire that possesses the relation would be obtained by the word ‚Äúthis‚Äù in ‚Äúthis fire has the relation.‚Äù

original: 'di na ni me'o zhes ni ma yin no ;
analyzed: 'di na ni me'o zhes ni ma yin no ;
translated: But here it is not ‚Äúthis fire.‚Äù

original: / gang gi phyir 'brel pa ni me 'di la'o zhes dang po'i sgras brjod do //üîΩrang gi chos kyi 'brel par ni //
analyzed: / gang gi phyir 'brel pa ni me 'di la'o zhes dang po'i sgras brjod do // rang gi chos kyi 'brel par ni //
translated: Because the relation is stated by the word ‚Äúthis‚Äù in ‚Äúthis fire has the relation.‚Äù

original: brjod par mi bya'o //
analyzed: brjod par mi bya'o //
translated: It should not be stated as the relation of its own property.

original: gzhan ma brjod pa ni de ltar rjes su dpag par bya ba ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhan ma brjod pa ni de ltar rjes su dpag par bya ba ma yin te /
translated: The non-statement of another is not like that.üîΩBut,

original: 'on kyang / don smos phyir /
analyzed: 'on kyang / don smos phyir /
translated: because the meaning is stated,

original: me 'di la zhes smras pa'i don dang 'brel par brjod par 'gyur ba'i yin no zhe na /
analyzed: me 'di la zhes smras pa'i don dang 'brel par brjod par 'gyur ba'i yin no zhe na /
translated: it would be stated as the relation of the meaning of ‚Äúthis fire.‚Äù

original: sngar brjod pa'i 'thad pas de ni dud pas rjes su dpag par bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir //
analyzed: sngar brjod pa'i 'thad pas de ni dud pas rjes su dpag par bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir //
translated: Because of the previously stated reasoning, that is not to be inferred from smoke.

original: gtan tshigs 'di dang 'brel pa min //
analyzed: gtan tshigs 'di dang 'brel pa min //
translated: This reason is not related.

original: gang gi phyir dud pa las ma gtogs pa med na mi 'byung ba'i 'brel pa nyid ni bstan par bya ba ma yin te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir dud pa las ma gtogs pa med na mi 'byung ba'i 'brel pa nyid ni bstan par bya ba ma yin te /
translated: Because the relation of the invariable concomitance that does not occur without smoke is not to be stated.

original: 'di ltar me nyid la'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar me nyid la'o //
translated: In this way, it is in fire itself.

original: nyes pa de dag ni med de /
analyzed: nyes pa de dag ni med de /
translated: Those errors do not exist.

original: gang gi phyir me dud pa dang ldan pa'i sa phyogs dang med na mi 'byung ba'i 'brel pa bstan par bya ba ma yin yang de rjes su dpag byar byed pa de bzhin du 'brel ba la yang 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: gang gi phyir me dud pa dang ldan pa'i sa phyogs dang med na mi 'byung ba'i 'brel pa bstan par bya ba ma yin yang de rjes su dpag byar byed pa de bzhin du 'brel ba la yang 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: Because, although the connection of the place with smoke and fire is not taught, that is to be inferred, so it is also with the connection.

original: rnam gzhag de ni spang ba ste /
analyzed: rnam gzhag de ni spang ba ste /
translated: That presentation is rejected.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is it rejected?

original: rtags kyi 'khrul ba med pa ni //
analyzed: rtags kyi 'khrul ba med pa ni //
translated: The non-erroneous evidence

original: chos las gzhan du ston par byed //
analyzed: chos las gzhan du ston par byed //
translated: is taught as other than the property.

original: der grub de dang ldan pa yi //
analyzed: der grub de dang ldan pa yi //
translated: The property possessor that is established as possessing that

original: chos can go bar bya ba yin //
analyzed: chos can go bar bya ba yin //
translated: is to be understood.

original: gang me dang dud pa med na mi 'byung ba'i 'brel pa de gzhan du bstan par byas nas yul gzhan du dud pa de 'ba' zhig tsam mthong yang gang na dud pa yod pa de na me yod @30b do ;
analyzed: gang me dang dud pa med na mi 'byung ba'i 'brel pa de gzhan du bstan par byas nas yul gzhan du dud pa de 'ba' zhig tsam mthong yang gang na dud pa yod pa de na me yod @30b do ;
translated: When the connection of fire and smoke is taught as not occurring without the other, then in another place, even though only smoke is seen, it is taught that ‚Äúwherever there is smoke, there is fire.‚Äù

original: / me dang ldan par grub pa ston par byed do //
analyzed: / me dang ldan par grub pa ston par byed do //
translated: It is established as possessing fire.

original: de lta ma yin na sa phyogs gzhan du bsgrub bya dang dud pa med na mi 'byung ba bye brag tu bstan par mi nus so //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na sa phyogs gzhan du bsgrub bya dang dud pa med na mi 'byung ba bye brag tu bstan par mi nus so //
translated: Otherwise, it would be impossible to teach the particular non-erroneous concomitance of the probandum and the probans in another place.

original: gzhi thun mong ba nyid du bstan pa ste gang na dud pa yod pa de na me yod do zhes bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhi thun mong ba nyid du bstan pa ste gang na dud pa yod pa de na me yod do zhes bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The common ground is taught, because it is taught that where there is smoke, there is fire.

original: de'i phyir gtan tshigs chos las gzhan du mi 'khrul par bstan pa de ltar 'thad pa yin gyi /
analyzed: de'i phyir gtan tshigs chos las gzhan du mi 'khrul par bstan pa de ltar 'thad pa yin gyi /
translated: Therefore, it is correct to teach that the reason is non-erroneous with respect to the property.

original: chos tsam yang bsgrub par bya ba ma yin la 'brel pa yang ma yin no //üîΩrtags kyi rjes su bstan bya ba'i //
analyzed: chos tsam yang bsgrub par bya ba ma yin la 'brel pa yang ma yin no // rtags kyi rjes su bstan bya ba'i //
translated: But the mere property is neither the probandum nor the relation.üîΩThe examination of the propertyüîΩthat is taught as the reason is applied elsewhere.

original: chos la dpyad pa gzhan yang 'jug / rtags dang chos dang chos la mi 'khrul pa yod pa yin pa bstan par bya ste /
analyzed: chos la dpyad pa gzhan yang 'jug / rtags dang chos dang chos la mi 'khrul pa yod pa yin pa bstan par bya ste /
translated: The existence of the reason, the property, and the non-erroneous property must be taught.

original: de dang ldan pa'i chos can du grub pa de'i /üîΩchos don du ma gtan tshigs kyis //
analyzed: de dang ldan pa'i chos can du grub pa de'i / chos don du ma gtan tshigs kyis //
translated: The property that is established as the subject that possesses that

original: rnam pa thams cad du rtogs min //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad du rtogs min //
translated: is not understood in all aspects by the reason,

original: gang dang 'brel pa yongs bcad nas //
analyzed: gang dang 'brel pa yongs bcad nas //
translated: which has a different purpose.

original: chos gzhan dang bral thob par byed //
analyzed: chos gzhan dang bral thob par byed //
translated: It is the mere exclusion of the other.

original: dper na me la 'bar ba dang rno ba la sogs pa du ma yod kyang dud pas bye brag de go bar mi byed de 'khrul pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dper na me la 'bar ba dang rno ba la sogs pa du ma yod kyang dud pas bye brag de go bar mi byed de 'khrul pa'i phyir ro //
translated: For example, fire has many qualities, such as heat and burning, but smoke does not indicate them all, because it is confused.

original: gang dang rjes su 'brel pa de las gzhan pa ni me ma yin te /
analyzed: gang dang rjes su 'brel pa de las gzhan pa ni me ma yin te /
translated: That which is related to fire is not non-fire.

original: rdzas nyid dang yon tan nyid la sogs pa de dag gis rdzas ma yin pa la sogs pa las log pa tsam 'ba' zhig thob par byed pa ste /
analyzed: rdzas nyid dang yon tan nyid la sogs pa de dag gis rdzas ma yin pa la sogs pa las log pa tsam 'ba' zhig thob par byed pa ste /
translated: It merely causes the attainment of the mere exclusion of non-substance, etc. from substance, quality, etc.

original: dper na mes me yin pa las log pa'i rang dang 'brel pa tsam thob par byed pa de bzhin du 'di yang me ma yin pa thams cad la ma mthong ba nyid gzhan la ni mthong ba yin no //üîΩyon tan dri dang dri bsung sogs //
analyzed: dper na mes me yin pa las log pa'i rang dang 'brel pa tsam thob par byed pa de bzhin du 'di yang me ma yin pa thams cad la ma mthong ba nyid gzhan la ni mthong ba yin no // yon tan dri dang dri bsung sogs //
translated: Just as fire causes the attainment of the mere relation to itself, which is the exclusion of non-fire, in the same way, it is seen that non-fire is not seen in all cases.üîΩSmell, fragrance, etc.üîΩare its particular qualities.

original: de yi bye brag gi rim pas //
analyzed: de yi bye brag gi rim pas //
translated: By their order,

original: rdzas min la sogs rnam bcad nas //
analyzed: rdzas min la sogs rnam bcad nas //
translated: non-substance, etc. are excluded,

original: autpala sogs re re rtogs //
analyzed: autpala sogs re re rtogs //
translated: and each is cognized, such as lotus, etc.

original: de la yon tan nyid kyis rdzas ma yin pa las log pa dang / dri nyid kyis sa'i rdzas ma yin pa las log pa dang / dri bsung ba nyid kyis dri nga ba'i spyi las log pa dang / dri bsung ba'i bye brag gis autpala ma yin pa la sogs pa las log pa re re rtogs par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: de la yon tan nyid kyis rdzas ma yin pa las log pa dang / dri nyid kyis sa'i rdzas ma yin pa las log pa dang / dri bsung ba nyid kyis dri nga ba'i spyi las log pa dang / dri bsung ba'i bye brag gis autpala ma yin pa la sogs pa las log pa re re rtogs par byed pa yin no //
translated: The quality of the smell is distinguished from the substance which is not a substance; the smell of earth is distinguished from the substance which is not earth; the pleasant smell is distinguished from the smell which is not pleasant; the particular smell of the blue lotus is distinguished from the smell which is not of the blue lotus.

original: de lta ma yin na ni /üîΩgal te mthong ba bzhin gtan tshigs //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na ni / gal te mthong ba bzhin gtan tshigs //
translated: If it were otherwise,

original: sgrub pa'i sgo nas 'jug pa ni //
analyzed: sgrub pa'i sgo nas 'jug pa ni //
translated: if the proof were to operate by way of perception,

original: thams cad rtogs par mi 'gyur ram //
analyzed: thams cad rtogs par mi 'gyur ram //
translated: would one not understand everything?

original: yang na thams cad rtogs par 'gyur //
analyzed: yang na thams cad rtogs par 'gyur //
translated: Or else, would one understand everything?

original: gal te yang dper na me la dud pa mthong ba bzhin du phyis kyi tshe yang 'jug par byed na ni nam yang rtogs @31a * //
analyzed: gal te yang dper na me la dud pa mthong ba bzhin du phyis kyi tshe yang 'jug par byed na ni nam yang rtogs @31a * //
translated: If, as in the case of the perception of smoke, the proof operates by way of perception, then one would never understand,

original: par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: par mi 'gyur te /
translated: because,

original: dper na me mtha' dag la ma mthong ba bzhin du mi 'di yang mi rtogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dper na me mtha' dag la ma mthong ba bzhin du mi 'di yang mi rtogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: as in the case of the non-perception of all fire, one would not understand this man.

original: gal te ji ltar mthong ba bzhin du rtogs par byed na ni gsal ba dang rno ba la sogs pa'i bye brag rnams kyang rtogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te ji ltar mthong ba bzhin du rtogs par byed na ni gsal ba dang rno ba la sogs pa'i bye brag rnams kyang rtogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: If one understands in accordance with what is seen, then the particulars, such as clarity, sharpness, etc., would also be understood.

original: gal te me ma yin pa rnam par bkag ste spyi'i tshul gyis 'jug par byed na ni de'i phyir sgrub pa'i sgo nas 'jug pa la yang tshul de nyid blta'o zhes shes par bya'o //
analyzed: gal te me ma yin pa rnam par bkag ste spyi'i tshul gyis 'jug par byed na ni de'i phyir sgrub pa'i sgo nas 'jug pa la yang tshul de nyid blta'o zhes shes par bya'o //
translated: If one engages in the general mode by way of the exclusion of what is not fire, then one should understand that the same mode applies to engagement by way of proof.

original: bye brag gi tshul gyis ni ma yin no //
analyzed: bye brag gi tshul gyis ni ma yin no //
translated: But not by way of particulars.

original: gal te spyi las yin grang na //
analyzed: gal te spyi las yin grang na //
translated: If it is from the universal,

original: de ni de las gzhan du 'gyur //
analyzed: de ni de las gzhan du 'gyur //
translated: then it would be different from that.

original: rten rnams ma mthong ba yi phyir //
analyzed: rten rnams ma mthong ba yi phyir //
translated: Because the supports are not seen,

original: tha dad min gcig mthong mi 'gyur //
analyzed: tha dad min gcig mthong mi 'gyur //
translated: the non-different is not seen as one.

original: re zhig me las gzhan pa'i me nyid ces pa'i spyi ni yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: re zhig me las gzhan pa'i me nyid ces pa'i spyi ni yod pa ma yin no //
translated: First, the universal ‚Äúfireness‚Äù that is different from fire does not exist.

original: yod du chug na yang de mthong ba ni mi srid do //
analyzed: yod du chug na yang de mthong ba ni mi srid do //
translated: Even if it did exist, seeing it is impossible.

original: rten mtha' dag ma mthong ba'i phyir du ma rnams las gnyis nyid la sogs pa'i thun mong ba ni yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rten mtha' dag ma mthong ba'i phyir du ma rnams las gnyis nyid la sogs pa'i thun mong ba ni yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Because the totality of supports is not seen, the universal that is common to two or more is not possible.

original: gang dag spyi mthong zhing gzung ba po yang rten ma bzung ba po dang mtshungs shing 'dra bar 'gyur ro //
