original: med na mi 'byung ba nyid kyi me dang dud pa dag la ni 'brel ba'i skyon de yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: med na mi 'byung ba nyid kyi me dang dud pa dag la ni 'brel ba'i skyon de yod pa ma yin te /
translated: In the case of fire and smoke, which are related as cause and effect, there is no fault in the relation.

original: gang gi phyir /
analyzed: gang gi phyir /
translated: For,

original: de ni gnyis gnas min phyir /üîΩdud pa nyid ni me med na mi 'byung ba yin gyi ;
analyzed: de ni gnyis gnas min phyir / dud pa nyid ni me med na mi 'byung ba yin gyi ;
translated: because it does not exist in the absence of the other.üîΩSmoke does not exist in the absence of fire,

original: me ni du ba med na mi 'byung ba ma yin pas nyes pa yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: me ni du ba med na mi 'byung ba ma yin pas nyes pa yod pa ma yin no //
translated: but fire does not not exist in the absence of smoke. Therefore, there is no fault.

original: de ltar na re zhig 'brel ba de dag ni yod du chug kyang rgyu ma yin pa nyid do //
analyzed: de ltar na re zhig 'brel ba de dag ni yod du chug kyang rgyu ma yin pa nyid do //
translated: Thus, even if those relations do exist, they are not the cause.

original: gnod bya gnod byed kyi dngos po ni ma 'brel pa nyid de /
analyzed: gnod bya gnod byed kyi dngos po ni ma 'brel pa nyid de /
translated: The relation of the object to be harmed and the object that harms is not a relation at all.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de la rtags dang rtags can med //
analyzed: de la rtags dang rtags can med //
translated: Because there is no reason and the characterized in that.

original: gang gnod bya @37a * //
analyzed: gang gnod bya @37a * //
translated: The object that harms

original: gnod byed ni sbrul dang ne'u le lta bu ste /
analyzed: gnod byed ni sbrul dang ne'u le lta bu ste /
translated: The harmful are like the snake and the mongoose.

original: de dag la ni rtags dang rtags can yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de dag la ni rtags dang rtags can yod pa ma yin no //
translated: They do not have the sign and the one who has the sign.

original: 'di ltar sbrul rgyal ba dang ne'u le pham pa dag la ni 'gal ba med do //
analyzed: 'di ltar sbrul rgyal ba dang ne'u le pham pa dag la ni 'gal ba med do //
translated: Thus, there is no contradiction in the snake being victorious and the mongoose being defeated.

original: de bzhin du gzhan yang rig par bya'o //üîΩgang yang rjes su dpog par byed pa'i rgyu'i 'brel ba ni de dag nyid do zhes nges par bzung bar byed pa de la gang gi tshe tha dad pa dang rjes su 'gro ba la sogs pa rtogs par byed pa de'i tshe 'brel ba gang las yin /
analyzed: de bzhin du gzhan yang rig par bya'o // gang yang rjes su dpog par byed pa'i rgyu'i 'brel ba ni de dag nyid do zhes nges par bzung bar byed pa de la gang gi tshe tha dad pa dang rjes su 'gro ba la sogs pa rtogs par byed pa de'i tshe 'brel ba gang las yin /
translated: It should be understood in the same way for others.üîΩWhen one ascertains that the connection of the cause of inference is just those, then when one realizes the difference, the subsequent conformity, and so on, at that time, from what connection?

original: rgyu dang rgyu can no zhe na /
analyzed: rgyu dang rgyu can no zhe na /
translated: If it is said that it is the connection of cause and effect,

original: dpyad par bya ste /
analyzed: dpyad par bya ste /
translated: it should be analyzed.

original: ci bskyed par bya ba dang skyed par byed pas yin nam /
analyzed: ci bskyed par bya ba dang skyed par byed pas yin nam /
translated: Is it that which is produced and that which produces it,

original: 'on te gsal bar bya ba dang gsal bar byed pas yin grang /
analyzed: 'on te gsal bar bya ba dang gsal bar byed pas yin grang /
translated: or is it that which is manifested and that which manifests it?

original: gal te snga ma ltar na ni 'di ltar rjes 'gro yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gal te snga ma ltar na ni 'di ltar rjes 'gro yod pa ma yin te /
translated: If it is the former, then there is no subsequent conformity because

original: so sor mi brjod tha dad las //
analyzed: so sor mi brjod tha dad las //
translated: there is no expression of each individually from the difference.

original: rgyu can ni tha dad pa nyid yin la /
analyzed: rgyu can ni tha dad pa nyid yin la /
translated: The qualified is different from the qualifier.

original: rgyu ni gtso bo yin pas rjes su 'gro ba tha dad pa las ston pa'i gtan tshigs nyid kyi so sor brjod par mi bya'o //
analyzed: rgyu ni gtso bo yin pas rjes su 'gro ba tha dad pa las ston pa'i gtan tshigs nyid kyi so sor brjod par mi bya'o //
translated: Since the cause is the principal factor, the reason is not stated separately, because the qualifier is different from the qualified.

original: nyes pa de ni med do //üîΩrjes su 'gro ba gzhan min phyir //
analyzed: nyes pa de ni med do // rjes su 'gro ba gzhan min phyir //
translated: This fault does not exist.üîΩBecause the qualifier is not different from the qualified.

original: rjes su 'gro ba gzhan tha dad pa las ni ma yin no zhe na /üîΩgal te gzhan min rnam lnga min //
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba gzhan tha dad pa las ni ma yin no zhe na / gal te gzhan min rnam lnga min //
translated: The qualifier is not different from the qualified.

original: gal te rjes su 'gro ba gzhan tha dad nyid las ltos par mi brjod na /
analyzed: gal te rjes su 'gro ba gzhan tha dad nyid las ltos par mi brjod na /
translated: If the qualifier is not different from the qualified,

original: rnam pa lnga ru thob par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: rnam pa lnga ru thob par mi 'gyur te /
translated: it would not be obtained in five ways.

original: de dag tha mi dad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag tha mi dad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are not different.

original: gtso bo'i cha nas brgya lam na'ang //üîΩskyed byed nyid du 'gyur ma yin //
analyzed: gtso bo'i cha nas brgya lam na'ang // skyed byed nyid du 'gyur ma yin //
translated: Even in part, the principal factorüîΩis never the producer.

original: tha dad na yang skye byed min //
analyzed: tha dad na yang skye byed min //
translated: Even if different, it is not the producer.

original: de las kun tu 'thob 'gyur min //
analyzed: de las kun tu 'thob 'gyur min //
translated: It is not obtained from that.

original: bskyed par bya ba dang skyed par byed pa'i dngos po'i 'brel pa ni gtso bo la sogs pa nyid kyi cha nas ma yin no //
analyzed: bskyed par bya ba dang skyed par byed pa'i dngos po'i 'brel pa ni gtso bo la sogs pa nyid kyi cha nas ma yin no //
translated: The relation of the produced and the producer does not exist in the principal factor and so on.

original: tha dad ni yod pa tsam la sogs pas kyang rtogs par 'gyur ro ;
analyzed: tha dad ni yod pa tsam la sogs pas kyang rtogs par 'gyur ro ;
translated: And difference is also understood by mere existence and so on.

original: ; gtso bo la sogs kyi gcig sogs //
analyzed: ; gtso bo la sogs kyi gcig sogs //
translated: The one of prakriti and so on

original: tha dad rnams kyi rjes 'gro nyid //
analyzed: tha dad rnams kyi rjes 'gro nyid //
translated: is the mere follower of the different.

original: la sogs gang las yongs su 'dzin //
analyzed: la sogs gang las yongs su 'dzin //
translated: From what is the ‚Äúand so on‚Äù taken?

original: de yi phyir 'di gsal byed min //
analyzed: de yi phyir 'di gsal byed min //
translated: Therefore it is not an illuminator.

original: gang gi phyir tha dad rnams kyi rjes su 'gro ba bor tshod la sogs pas gtso bo dang skyes bu rtogs par byed pas na de nyid gtsug phud can gyi don bsgrubs pas te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir tha dad rnams kyi rjes su 'gro ba bor tshod la sogs pas gtso bo dang skyes bu rtogs par byed pas na de nyid gtsug phud can gyi don bsgrubs pas te /
translated: Because the mere follower of the different is understood by the measure of prakriti and purusha and so on, that alone accomplishes the meaning of the crest.

original: de'i phyir gtso bo yod pa nyid la sogs pa rtogs par byed pa'i gtan tshigs yin gyi /
analyzed: de'i phyir gtso bo yod pa nyid la sogs pa rtogs par byed pa'i gtan tshigs yin gyi /
translated: Therefore it is a reason that proves the existence of prakriti and so on.

original: bskyed bya skyed byed kyi dngos po ni ma yin no //
analyzed: bskyed bya skyed byed kyi dngos po ni ma yin no //
translated: But it is not a thing that is produced and a producer.

original: 'di ltar gtso bo yod pa nyid la sogs pa dang rjes su 'gro ba la sogs pa de rjes su bsgrubs na ni /
analyzed: 'di ltar gtso bo yod pa nyid la sogs pa dang rjes su 'gro ba la sogs pa de rjes su bsgrubs na ni /
translated: In this way, if the mere follower of the existence of prakriti and so on is established,

original: de bzhin nor @37b dang nor can la //
analyzed: de bzhin nor @37b dang nor can la //
translated: then it is the same for wealth and the wealthy.

original: mtshon nas gsal byed ma yin nyid //
analyzed: mtshon nas gsal byed ma yin nyid //
translated: From the illustration, it is not an illuminator.

original: 'brel ba las kyang de mtshon phyir //
analyzed: 'brel ba las kyang de mtshon phyir //
translated: Because it is illustrated from a connection.

original: 'brel med nyid du yang dag brjod //
analyzed: 'brel med nyid du yang dag brjod //
translated: And it is not tenable that they are unrelated.

original: 'brel ba cig shos la ni cha 'ga' zhig las rtags dang rtags can du 'gyur gyi gang nor dang nor can la sogs pa la ni ma yin te /
analyzed: 'brel ba cig shos la ni cha 'ga' zhig las rtags dang rtags can du 'gyur gyi gang nor dang nor can la sogs pa la ni ma yin te /
translated: In the case of the relation of indicator and indicated, the indicator is related to the indicated through a part of itself. But in the case of the possessor of wealth and the wealth, the possessor of wealth is not related to the wealth through a part of itself.

original: 'di ltar rnam pa thams cad du phan tshun gzung ba dang 'dzin par 'gyur bas na'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar rnam pa thams cad du phan tshun gzung ba dang 'dzin par 'gyur bas na'o //
translated: Because in every case, they would be the apprehended object and apprehending subject of each other.

original: nor la sogs pa ni cha gang gi sgo nas kyang gsal byed nyid ma mthong ngo //
analyzed: nor la sogs pa ni cha gang gi sgo nas kyang gsal byed nyid ma mthong ngo //
translated: But the possessor of wealth is not seen to be the indicator of the wealth through any part of itself.

original: de'i phyir 'brel pa gzhan nyid las don brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'brel pa gzhan nyid las don brjod pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the meaning is expressed through a relation that is different from the indicator.üîΩMoreover,

original: gzhan yang / nor dang nor can la sogs tsam //
analyzed: gzhan yang / nor dang nor can la sogs tsam //
translated: If the possessor of wealth and the wealth, etc.

original: rtags can 'dzin pa yin na ni ;
analyzed: rtags can 'dzin pa yin na ni ;
translated: Were the indicator and the indicated,

original: /'brel ba las gzhan shes pas na //
analyzed: /'brel ba las gzhan shes pas na //
translated: Then, through a relation that is different from the indicator,

original: rnam pa kun tu 'dzin par 'gyur //
analyzed: rnam pa kun tu 'dzin par 'gyur //
translated: The apprehender would apprehend in every way.

original: nor gyi cha nas nor can nyid tsam gsal bar byed cing rtags can go bar byed pa yin na ni 'brel ba'i sgo nas 'dzin pa por nas rtags gzhan las nor gyi don brjod par nus pa ma yin no //
analyzed: nor gyi cha nas nor can nyid tsam gsal bar byed cing rtags can go bar byed pa yin na ni 'brel ba'i sgo nas 'dzin pa por nas rtags gzhan las nor gyi don brjod par nus pa ma yin no //
translated: If the possessor of wealth were the indicator of the mere possessor of wealth through a part of itself, then the possessor of wealth would not be able to express the meaning of the wealth through a relation that is different from the indicator.

original: de las shin tu 'das na yang bdag nyid thams cad nas rtags can 'dzin par 'gyur ro zhes thal 'gyur sems pas chog go //
analyzed: de las shin tu 'das na yang bdag nyid thams cad nas rtags can 'dzin par 'gyur ro zhes thal 'gyur sems pas chog go //
translated: But if it is more than that, then the whole of it would be the apprehender.

original: de ltar re zhig gtso bo dang rjes su 'gro ba la sogs pa rgyu dang rgyu can nyid kyi bskyed par bya ba dang skyed par byed pa po'i dngos po ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar re zhig gtso bo dang rjes su 'gro ba la sogs pa rgyu dang rgyu can nyid kyi bskyed par bya ba dang skyed par byed pa po'i dngos po ma yin no //
translated: Thus, the principal and the secondary, etc., are not the relation of the produced and the producer.

original: gsal bya gsal byed kyi dngos po'o //
analyzed: gsal bya gsal byed kyi dngos po'o //
translated: The relation of the manifested and the manifester.

original: gal te gcig yin rnam bdun min //
analyzed: gal te gcig yin rnam bdun min //
translated: If it is one, it is not sevenfold.

original: gsal bya gsal byed kyi dngos po nyid yin na ni nor dang nor can la sogs pa'i tha dad pa las de dag rnam pa bdun du dbye bar mi bya'o //üîΩde'i gcig kho na gsal byed ma yin pa ma yin du chug na /
analyzed: gsal bya gsal byed kyi dngos po nyid yin na ni nor dang nor can la sogs pa'i tha dad pa las de dag rnam pa bdun du dbye bar mi bya'o // de'i gcig kho na gsal byed ma yin pa ma yin du chug na /
translated: If the relation of the manifested and the manifester is the relation of the produced and the producer, then the sevenfold division of the relation of the manifested and the manifester would not be made, because of the difference between the possessor of wealth and wealth, etc.üîΩLet it be that one of them is not the manifester.

original: cig shos rnams ni gsal byed du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: cig shos rnams ni gsal byed du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: The others would not be the manifested.

original: rgyu dang rgyu can gyi dngos po las tha dad pa yin pa'i phyir 'brel ba gzhan nye bar dmigs pa nyid 'dir 'di'i gsal bar byed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rgyu dang rgyu can gyi dngos po las tha dad pa yin pa'i phyir 'brel ba gzhan nye bar dmigs pa nyid 'dir 'di'i gsal bar byed par 'gyur ro //
translated: Because it is different from the entity that is the cause and the entity that is the effect, the observation of another relation is what makes it manifest here.üîΩTherefore, it is meaningless to posit another cause of inference.

original: de'i phyir rjes su dpog par byed pa'i rgyu gzhan ni don med do zhes sngar brjod zin to //
analyzed: de'i phyir rjes su dpog par byed pa'i rgyu gzhan ni don med do zhes sngar brjod zin to //
translated: We have already stated this earlier.

original: rgyu dang rgyu can gyi dngos po'i zhes kyang brjod par mi bya ste /
analyzed: rgyu dang rgyu can gyi dngos po'i zhes kyang brjod par mi bya ste /
translated: Nor should one say that the relation is between the entity that is the cause and the entity that is the effect,

original: gang gi phyir rjes su dpog par byed pa'i rgyu nyid ni gsal bar byed pa nyid yin pas na'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir rjes su dpog par byed pa'i rgyu nyid ni gsal bar byed pa nyid yin pas na'o //
translated: because the cause of inference itself is what makes it manifest.

original: rgyu can nyid ces pa ni gsal bar bya ba gsal bar byed pa nyid la sogs pa yin no //
analyzed: rgyu can nyid ces pa ni gsal bar bya ba gsal bar byed pa nyid la sogs pa yin no //
translated: The relation of the entity that is the effect to the entity that is the cause is the relation of the manifest to the manifestor, and so on.üîΩAs for the relation of co-occurrence, it is the relation of the primary nature and so on to that which is subsequent.

original: gang yang lhan cig rgyu ba'i dngos po'i 'brel ba ni gtso bo la sogs pa dang rjes su 'gro ba'i zhes pa la'ang /üîΩgal @38a * //üîΩte gcig yin rnam bdun min //
analyzed: gang yang lhan cig rgyu ba'i dngos po'i 'brel ba ni gtso bo la sogs pa dang rjes su 'gro ba'i zhes pa la'ang / gal @38a * // te gcig yin rnam bdun min //
translated: The response to the objection that the relation of co-occurrence is not established is the same as the response to the objection that the relation of inherence is not established.üîΩThe response to the objection that the relation of inherence is not established is the same as the response to the objection that the relation of co-occurrence is not established.üîΩThe response to the objection that the relation of inherence is not established is the same as the response to the objection that the relation of co-occurrence is not established.üîΩThe response to the objection that the relation of inherence is not established is the same as the response to the objection that the relation of co-occurrence is not established.

original: zhes pa de nyid kyi lan gdab po //
analyzed: zhes pa de nyid kyi lan gdab po //
translated: The response to the objection that the relation of inherence is not established is the same as the response to the objection that the relation of co-occurrence is not established.

original: gang lhan cig tu rgyu ba de gcig bu med na mi 'byung ba nyid yin na ni nor dang nor can la sogs pa lhan cig rgyu ba ma yin pas de dag las rjes dpag ma yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang lhan cig tu rgyu ba de gcig bu med na mi 'byung ba nyid yin na ni nor dang nor can la sogs pa lhan cig rgyu ba ma yin pas de dag las rjes dpag ma yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: If it is the case that that which moves together is not produced without the other, then wealth and the possessor of wealth, etc., do not move together, and therefore inference would not be possible from them.

original: lhan cig rgyu ba'i dngos po las lhag ma dang ldan pa'i rjes su dpag pa srid do zhes pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: lhan cig rgyu ba'i dngos po las lhag ma dang ldan pa'i rjes su dpag pa srid do zhes pa ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not possible that the remainder of the things that move together is the basis of inference.

original: des dbang po las 'das pa'i don ji ltar khong du chud /
analyzed: des dbang po las 'das pa'i don ji ltar khong du chud /
translated: How can one understand a thing that is beyond the senses?

original: de'i phyir de lta bu'i 'brel ba ni rjes su dpag pa'i rgyu ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir de lta bu'i 'brel ba ni rjes su dpag pa'i rgyu ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, such a relation is not the cause of inference.

original: gang yang rjes su dpag pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: gang yang rjes su dpag pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Moreover, it is said that inference is of two kinds:üîΩfrom the perception of a particular and from the perception of a universal.

original: bye brag mthong ba dang spyi mthong ba'o zhes brjod pa de la re zhig bye brag mthong ba ni rjes su dpag pa nyid du mi 'dod do //
analyzed: bye brag mthong ba dang spyi mthong ba'o zhes brjod pa de la re zhig bye brag mthong ba ni rjes su dpag pa nyid du mi 'dod do //
translated: First, the perception of a particular is not accepted as inference.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de dran par 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dran par 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is desired to be remembered.

original: sngar nyams su myong ba'i dran pa gzhag nas shes pa gzhan la de 'di nyid yin no zhes pa ni rjes su dpag pa ma yin no //
analyzed: sngar nyams su myong ba'i dran pa gzhag nas shes pa gzhan la de 'di nyid yin no zhes pa ni rjes su dpag pa ma yin no //
translated: But when one posits a memory of a previous experience, and says, ‚ÄúThis is that,‚Äù it is not an inference.

original: spyir mthong ba ni rnam pa gnyis po zhes pa 'di la re re'am gnyis ka yang rung ste /
analyzed: spyir mthong ba ni rnam pa gnyis po zhes pa 'di la re re'am gnyis ka yang rung ste /
translated: In general, seeing is twofold. It is either one or the other.

original: nges par gzung ba rigs pa min //üîΩji lta bur zhes par gzung bar bya ba gal te re zhig spyir mthong pa kho na rnam pa gnyis se zhes pa de lta na ni /
analyzed: nges par gzung ba rigs pa min // ji lta bur zhes par gzung bar bya ba gal te re zhig spyir mthong pa kho na rnam pa gnyis se zhes pa de lta na ni /
translated: It is not reasonable to hold that it is both.

original: 'bras bu dang rgyu dag las yang nas yang du rjes su dpog pa med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'bras bu dang rgyu dag las yang nas yang du rjes su dpog pa med par 'gyur ro //
translated: If it is held that seeing is twofold, then it is not the case that an effect is repeatedly inferred from a cause.

original: ci ste spyir mthong ba rnam pa gnyis kho na yin na ni nor dang nor can dang lhan cig tu rgyu ba dang / gnod bya gnod byed kyi 'brel ba can de rnams kyi dang po ni rjes su dpag par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ci ste spyir mthong ba rnam pa gnyis kho na yin na ni nor dang nor can dang lhan cig tu rgyu ba dang / gnod bya gnod byed kyi 'brel ba can de rnams kyi dang po ni rjes su dpag par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If seeing is twofold, then the first of those who are related as a thief and a guard, or as a debtor and a creditor, would not be inferred.

original: de dag ni rgyu 'bras kyi dang po ma yin zhing bye brag 'dzin pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: de dag ni rgyu 'bras kyi dang po ma yin zhing bye brag 'dzin pa yang ma yin no //
translated: These are not the first cause, nor are they the particular.

original: de skad du /
analyzed: de skad du /
translated: Thus it is said:

original: yang smras pa /
analyzed: yang smras pa /
translated: Again it is said:

original: 'brel ba bdun du bstan pa dang // rjes su dpag pa gnyis nyid dang // de sngon song ba'i rjes dpag gsum //
analyzed: 'brel ba bdun du bstan pa dang // rjes su dpag pa gnyis nyid dang // de sngon song ba'i rjes dpag gsum //
translated: The sevenfold relation, the two kinds of inference, and the three kinds of inference based on what has gone before,

original: 'di dag gang gi khongs su bsdu //
analyzed: 'di dag gang gi khongs su bsdu //
translated: in which of these are they included?

original: gal te yang 'di ltar nor bdag ni byed pa po yin zhing nor ni bya ba ma yin no //
analyzed: gal te yang 'di ltar nor bdag ni byed pa po yin zhing nor ni bya ba ma yin no //
translated: If it is said that the owner of the wealth is the agent and the wealth is not the object,

original: rjes su gzung bar bya ba dang 'dzin par byed pa nyid kyi phyir ro zhe ni ;
analyzed: rjes su gzung bar bya ba dang 'dzin par byed pa nyid kyi phyir ro zhe ni ;
translated: because of the relation of the one to be cared for and the one who cares,

original: de ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni ma yin te /
translated: that is not so,

original: 'brel ba gzhan med par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'brel ba gzhan med par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would follow that there would be no other relation.

original: thams cad du shes par bya ba dang shes par byed pa nyid du khas len par byed pa yin na ni phan 'dogs pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thams cad du shes par bya ba dang shes par byed pa nyid du khas len par byed pa yin na ni phan 'dogs pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If it is accepted that everything is the object and the agent of cognition, then it is because of the benefit.

original: de dag ni gnyis so zhes nges par bzung ba de dag nges par gzung bar mi bya ste /
analyzed: de dag ni gnyis so zhes nges par bzung ba de dag nges par gzung bar mi bya ste /
translated: Those two are ascertained, but they are not ascertained.

original: 'bras @38b bu med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'bras @38b bu med pa'i phyir /
translated: because there is no effect.

original: spyir mthong ba ni rnam pa gnyis so zhes pa'i tshig gi 'bras bu ci zhig yin /
analyzed: spyir mthong ba ni rnam pa gnyis so zhes pa'i tshig gi 'bras bu ci zhig yin /
translated: What is the point of the statement ‚ÄúIn general, seeing is of two kinds‚Äù?

original: gal te gzhan la yang rnam pa gnyis yod pa de lta na ni rnam pa mang po nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te gzhan la yang rnam pa gnyis yod pa de lta na ni rnam pa mang po nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: If the other is also of two kinds, then there would be many kinds.

original: gang yang ji skad du snga ma dang ldan pa'i rjes su dpag pa ni 'khrul pa can no zhes brjod pa de yang rigs pa ma yin te ;
analyzed: gang yang ji skad du snga ma dang ldan pa'i rjes su dpag pa ni 'khrul pa can no zhes brjod pa de yang rigs pa ma yin te ;
translated: Also, it is not right to say that inference based on what is commonly recognized is mistaken,

original: 'brel pa can rnams la 'khrul pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'brel pa can rnams la 'khrul pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no mistake in what is related.üîΩInference is not based on a cause, because it is possible that an obstruction, etc.,

original: rgyu la ni gegs byed pa la sogs pa yang srid la 'bras bu med par yang 'byung ba'i phyir 'khrul pas na rjes su dpag pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rgyu la ni gegs byed pa la sogs pa yang srid la 'bras bu med par yang 'byung ba'i phyir 'khrul pas na rjes su dpag pa ma yin no //
translated: occurs to the cause, and because the effect arises even when it does not exist.

original: gal te rgyu nyid rjes su dpag par byed pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir rjes su dpag pa nye bar brtags nas brjod par bya'o zhe na /
analyzed: gal te rgyu nyid rjes su dpag par byed pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir rjes su dpag pa nye bar brtags nas brjod par bya'o zhe na /
translated: If you say that the cause is the cause of inference because it is inferred, then inference should be stated after it is imagined.

original: de ltar yang rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de ltar yang rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: Even so, it is not right,

original: gang gi phyir gal te 'khrul na ni /
analyzed: gang gi phyir gal te 'khrul na ni /
translated: because if there is a mistake,

original: de rtags min /
analyzed: de rtags min /
translated: That is not a reason.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: de las ni don de'i rtags ma yin te /
analyzed: de las ni don de'i rtags ma yin te /
translated: Because that is not a reason for that object,

original: the tshom bskyed pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: the tshom bskyed pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the cause of the production of doubt.

original: de'i phyir 'dir rjes su dpag pa nye bar gdags pa yang rigs pa ma yin no ;
analyzed: de'i phyir 'dir rjes su dpag pa nye bar gdags pa yang rigs pa ma yin no ;
translated: Therefore, it is not reasonable to impute inference here.

original: / rgyu la 'bras bu'i shes pa de 'byung ba srid kyang rtags 'khrul par ngo shes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: / rgyu la 'bras bu'i shes pa de 'byung ba srid kyang rtags 'khrul par ngo shes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Even though the arising of the cognition of an effect from a cause is possible, the reason is recognized as mistaken.

original: 'khrul par brjod do zhe na /
analyzed: 'khrul par brjod do zhe na /
translated: If it is said that it is mistaken,

original: de ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni ma yin te /
translated: that is not so,

original: de'i tshe de'i rgyu ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe de'i rgyu ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because at that time it is not the cause of that.

original: gang gi tshe der don ji lta ba ma yin pa'i nyes pa 'byung ba de'i tshe ni de'i rjes su dpag pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gi tshe der don ji lta ba ma yin pa'i nyes pa 'byung ba de'i tshe ni de'i rjes su dpag pa ma yin no //
translated: When the fault of not being the object as it is occurs, at that time it is not inference.

original: gal te yang rgyu dang 'bras bu'i shes pa dang mi ldan pas yang 'khrul par byed pa nyid ma yin la /
analyzed: gal te yang rgyu dang 'bras bu'i shes pa dang mi ldan pas yang 'khrul par byed pa nyid ma yin la /
translated: If, moreover, it is not mistaken because it is not endowed with the cognition of cause and effect,

original: rag las pa yin na ni de ltar na /
analyzed: rag las pa yin na ni de ltar na /
translated: and if it is dependent, then

original: 'brel pa gzhan dag 'os pa yin /
analyzed: 'brel pa gzhan dag 'os pa yin /
translated: it is suitable to have another relation.

original: de lta na ni gang mi 'khrul ba la ltos pa de nyid med na mi 'byung ba nyid de /
analyzed: de lta na ni gang mi 'khrul ba la ltos pa de nyid med na mi 'byung ba nyid de /
translated: If that were so, then that which is nonerroneous in dependence on something would not occur if that did not exist.

original: de rjes su dpag pa'i rgyu yin gyi 'bras bu dang 'brel ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de rjes su dpag pa'i rgyu yin gyi 'bras bu dang 'brel ba ni ma yin no //
translated: That is the cause of inference, but it is not related to the effect.

original: gal te rnam par dpyod pa can gyi lhag ma dang ldan pa nyid ni rjes su dpag pa ste gzhan du gtan tshigs nyid la rjes su dpag par nye bar brtags nas brjod do zhe na /
analyzed: gal te rnam par dpyod pa can gyi lhag ma dang ldan pa nyid ni rjes su dpag pa ste gzhan du gtan tshigs nyid la rjes su dpag par nye bar brtags nas brjod do zhe na /
translated: If you say that the possession of the remainder of analysis is inference, but elsewhere the reason itself is imagined to be inference,

original: de bzhin du de'i rjes su dpag pa thams cad la /
analyzed: de bzhin du de'i rjes su dpag pa thams cad la /
translated: then in the same way, all inferences

original: dpyod dang bcas par brjod par bya //
analyzed: dpyod dang bcas par brjod par bya //
translated: would be said to possess analysis.

original: mngon sum gyis spyi tsam bzung yang 'di la don gyi bye brag mi nges pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: mngon sum gyis spyi tsam bzung yang 'di la don gyi bye brag mi nges pa'i phyir te /
translated: Even though a mere universal is apprehended by direct perception, the specific meaning is not ascertained.

original: de na lhag ma dang ldan pa kho na rnam par dpyod pa dang bcas pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de na lhag ma dang ldan pa kho na rnam par dpyod pa dang bcas pa ni ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, the possession of a remainder is not the only thing that possesses analysis.

original: yod pa'ang dpyod pa dang bcas phyir //
analyzed: yod pa'ang dpyod pa dang bcas phyir //
translated: Because existence also possesses analysis.

original: rtags yod par grub pa 'di la ci 'di las 'gyur ra ma 'on te mi 'gyur zhes rnam par dpyod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtags yod par grub pa 'di la ci 'di las 'gyur ra ma 'on te mi 'gyur zhes rnam par dpyod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is established that the reason exists, and because it is analyzed whether or not this is so.

original: 'di ltar chu klung gang @39a * //
analyzed: 'di ltar chu klung gang @39a * //
translated: In this way, the river

original: bas na mi 'khrul ba nyid yin zhing rnam par dpyod pa dang bcas pa yin yang bya ba dang byed pa las ni ma yin te /
analyzed: bas na mi 'khrul ba nyid yin zhing rnam par dpyod pa dang bcas pa yin yang bya ba dang byed pa las ni ma yin te /
translated: is not mistaken, and although it is analyzed, it is not from action and agent.

original: med na mi 'byung ba las yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: med na mi 'byung ba las yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is from the non-arising of that.

original: gal te de ltar nges par bzung ba byas pas gang spyi mthong ba'i rjes su dpag pa de dag ni lhag ma dang ldan pa dbang po'i yul las 'das pa rnams yang dag par rtogs par byed do zhe na /
analyzed: gal te de ltar nges par bzung ba byas pas gang spyi mthong ba'i rjes su dpag pa de dag ni lhag ma dang ldan pa dbang po'i yul las 'das pa rnams yang dag par rtogs par byed do zhe na /
translated: If it is done by ascertaining in this way, then those inferences that see the universal correctly understand the remaining transcendent objects.

original: de ni rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: That is not reasonable,

original: gang gi phyir /
analyzed: gang gi phyir /
translated: because

original: gzhan pa las kyang rab tu grub //
analyzed: gzhan pa las kyang rab tu grub //
translated: it is also established from other.

original: gang gi tshe rjes su 'gro ba la sogs pa de nyid nas yang nas yang du gtso bo yod pa nyid la sogs pa rtogs par byed pa de'i tshe bye brag mthong ba la yang khong du chud par mthong ba'i phyir nges par bzung ba rigs pa ma
analyzed: gang gi tshe rjes su 'gro ba la sogs pa de nyid nas yang nas yang du gtso bo yod pa nyid la sogs pa rtogs par byed pa de'i tshe bye brag mthong ba la yang khong du chud par mthong ba'i phyir nges par bzung ba rigs pa ma
translated: When one understands the existence of the principal, etc., again and again from the concomitance, etc., then it is proper to infer the existence of the principal, etc., because one sees that the particular is understood from seeing the universal.

original: yin no // gzhan yang /
analyzed: yin no // gzhan yang /
translated: Moreover,

original: gtsug phud can don gcig rtogs des //
analyzed: gtsug phud can don gcig rtogs des //
translated: when one understands the existence of one thing, such as ≈öiva,

original: lhag ma dang ldan pa'i rjes dpag gi yan lag las de'i gtso bo gcig yod pa nyid khong du chud pa ni 'thad pa ste /
analyzed: lhag ma dang ldan pa'i rjes dpag gi yan lag las de'i gtso bo gcig yod pa nyid khong du chud pa ni 'thad pa ste /
translated: it is reasonable to infer the existence of the principal, etc., which possess the remaining qualities,

original: de'i dngos po nyid rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i dngos po nyid rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because that very thing is the cause.

original: gal te de'i yang tha dad pa las rtogs par mi rigs so zhe na ma yin te /
analyzed: gal te de'i yang tha dad pa las rtogs par mi rigs so zhe na ma yin te /
translated: If it is unreasonable to understand from that difference, no,

original: de'i rjes 'gro la sogs pa las tha dad pa nyid 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i rjes 'gro la sogs pa las tha dad pa nyid 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the difference from that concomitance, etc., is the effect.

original: tha dad tha snyad yod min pa'am //
analyzed: tha dad tha snyad yod min pa'am //
translated: The difference does not exist in convention,

original: ci ste tha dad las gzhan ma yin pa'i rjes su 'gro ba la sogs pa las gtso bo gcig nyid la sogs pa bsgrubs pa'i phyir lhag ma dang ldan pa'i gtan tshigs kyis ci zhig go bar byed ces brjod do //
analyzed: ci ste tha dad las gzhan ma yin pa'i rjes su 'gro ba la sogs pa las gtso bo gcig nyid la sogs pa bsgrubs pa'i phyir lhag ma dang ldan pa'i gtan tshigs kyis ci zhig go bar byed ces brjod do //
translated: But if you say that the reason is not inconclusive because it proves that the one principal element, etc., is not different from the following, etc., then what does the reason, which has a remainder, prove?

original: de lta na ni rnam par ldan pa rnam lnga brjod par mi bya zhing gtsug phud can gyi don bcu yang ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta na ni rnam par ldan pa rnam lnga brjod par mi bya zhing gtsug phud can gyi don bcu yang ma yin no //
translated: If that were so, then the five kinds of logical mark would not be stated, and the ten topics of the SƒÅ·πÉkhya would not be so.üîΩMoreover,

original: gzhan yang / skyes bu'i rnam kun rtogs mi 'gyur /
analyzed: gzhan yang / skyes bu'i rnam kun rtogs mi 'gyur /
translated: the existence of a person is not understood in any way by inference.

original: skyes bu'i yod pa nyid dam /
analyzed: skyes bu'i yod pa nyid dam /
translated: Is the existence of a person understood by inference?

original: mang po nyid dam /üîΩtha dad pa'am /
analyzed: mang po nyid dam / tha dad pa'am /
translated: Is its plurality understood?üîΩIs its difference or nondifference understood?

original: tha mi dad pa yang rung rnam pa thams cad du rjes su dpag pas go bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: tha mi dad pa yang rung rnam pa thams cad du rjes su dpag pas go bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: In no way is it understood by inference.

original: skyes bu'i rgyu ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skyes bu'i rgyu ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not a cause of a person.

original: de lta bas na grangs can pa rnams kyi rjes dpag ni rigs pa dang mi ldan no //
analyzed: de lta bas na grangs can pa rnams kyi rjes dpag ni rigs pa dang mi ldan no //
translated: Therefore the inference of the SƒÅ·πÉkhyas is unreasonable.

original: dpyod pa rnams kyi ni rjes su dpag pa la sogs pa mngon sum sngon du 'gro ba can yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dpyod pa rnams kyi ni rjes su dpag pa la sogs pa mngon sum sngon du 'gro ba can yin pa'i phyir /
translated: For those who analyze, inference and so on are preceded by direct perception.

original: de dang mtshungs pa nyid yin pas mdor ma mtshon no //
analyzed: de dang mtshungs pa nyid yin pas mdor ma mtshon no //
translated: Since they are similar to that, they are not summarized in the sutra.

original: 'grel pa byed pas ni ngag byed mkhan gyi bsam pa rjes su bzlas nas rnam par phye'o zhes zer ro //
analyzed: 'grel pa byed pas ni ngag byed mkhan gyi bsam pa rjes su bzlas nas rnam par phye'o zhes zer ro //
translated: The author of the commentary says that he distinguishes them by repeating the thought of the speaker.üîΩIf you say that inference and so on are not summarized in the sutra

original: de la / mngon sum sngon 'gro can yin @39b phyir ;üîΩ/ rjes dpag la sogs mdor ma mtshon //
analyzed: de la / mngon sum sngon 'gro can yin @39b phyir ; / rjes dpag la sogs mdor ma mtshon //
translated: because they are preceded by direct perception,

original: zhe na dran 'dod zhe sdang dang // rtsol ba la sogs tshad mar 'gyur //üîΩgal te mngon sum sngon du 'gro ba can de nyid tshad ma nyid du shes zin pas ngag byed mkhan gyi rjes dpag la sogs pa ma brjod pa de lta na ni mngon sum sngon du song ba can yin pa'i phyir dran pa la sogs pa yang tshad
analyzed: zhe na dran 'dod zhe sdang dang // rtsol ba la sogs tshad mar 'gyur // gal te mngon sum sngon du 'gro ba can de nyid tshad ma nyid du shes zin pas ngag byed mkhan gyi rjes dpag la sogs pa ma brjod pa de lta na ni mngon sum sngon du song ba can yin pa'i phyir dran pa la sogs pa yang tshad
translated: then memory, desire, hatred, effort and so on would be valid cognitions.

original: ma gzhan nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ma gzhan nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: If inference and so on are not mentioned because direct perception alone is recognized as valid knowledge since it is preceded by direct perception, then memory and so on would also become separate valid cognitions because they are preceded by direct perception.

original: 'brel pa byed pas gzhan gzhung las bton te gcig tu bstun nas ni /
analyzed: 'brel pa byed pas gzhan gzhung las bton te gcig tu bstun nas ni /
translated: But since they are related, they are extracted from other treatises and combined into one.üîΩInference, etc., are taught.üîΩInference, etc., are taught.

original: rjes dpag la sogs bstan pa ste /üîΩmngon sum sngon 'gro can ma yin //
analyzed: rjes dpag la sogs bstan pa ste / mngon sum sngon 'gro can ma yin //

original: mngon sum sngon du 'gro ba can nyid ni 'brel ba'am ldan pa la sogs pa la mngon sum pa nyid du brjod par bya na 'brel pa can nam gnyis ka ltar na yang rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: mngon sum sngon du 'gro ba can nyid ni 'brel ba'am ldan pa la sogs pa la mngon sum pa nyid du brjod par bya na 'brel pa can nam gnyis ka ltar na yang rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: Inference, etc., are taught.

original: ldan sogs yul la dbang blo med //üîΩyul la'ang de dag yod ma yin //
analyzed: ldan sogs yul la dbang blo med // yul la'ang de dag yod ma yin //
translated: Inference, etc., are taught.

translated: Inference, etc., are taught.üîΩInference, etc., are taught.üîΩInference, etc., are taught.üîΩInference, etc., are taught.üîΩInference, etc., are taught.üîΩInference, etc., are taught.üîΩInference, etc., are taught.üîΩInference, etc., are taught.üîΩInference, etc., are taught.üîΩInference, etc., are taught.üîΩInference, etc., are taught.üîΩInference, etc., are taught.üîΩInference, etc., are taught.üîΩInference, etc., are taught.üîΩInference, etc., are taught.üîΩInference, etc., are taught.üîΩInference, etc., are taught.

original: 'brel ba can yang 'brel ba can nyid du bzung na ni rjes su dpag pa la sogs pa nye bar mkho bar 'gyur na mngon sum gyis ni de lta ma yin no //
analyzed: 'brel ba can yang 'brel ba can nyid du bzung na ni rjes su dpag pa la sogs pa nye bar mkho bar 'gyur na mngon sum gyis ni de lta ma yin no //
translated: Inference, etc., are taught.üîΩInference, etc., are taught.üîΩInference, etc., are taught.üîΩInference, etc., are taught.üîΩInference, etc., are taught.üîΩInference, etc., are taught.üîΩInference, etc., are taught.üîΩInference, etc., are taught.üîΩInference, etc., are taught.üîΩInference, etc., are taught.üîΩInference, etc., are taught.üîΩInference, etc., are taught.üîΩInference, etc., are taught.üîΩInference, etc., are taught

original: 'grel pa byed pas ni phal cher bye brag pa'i rjes su dpag pa nyid rjod par byed pa ste /
analyzed: 'grel pa byed pas ni phal cher bye brag pa'i rjes su dpag pa nyid rjod par byed pa ste /
translated: The author of the commentary, for the most part, expresses the Vai≈õe·π£ika‚Äôs own inferences,

original: mthong ba'i spyi dang ma mthong ba'i la sogs par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mthong ba'i spyi dang ma mthong ba'i la sogs par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because he uses the words ‚Äúthe general property that is seen‚Äù and ‚Äúthe general property that is not seen.‚Äù

original: de la 'du ba dang don gcig la 'du ba dang 'gal ba dang de dang ldan pa rnams ni mngon sum pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de la 'du ba dang don gcig la 'du ba dang 'gal ba dang de dang ldan pa rnams ni mngon sum pa ma yin te /
translated: Among them, the inherence that is the same as the object and the inherence that is contradictory to it and the possessor of that are not perceptible.

original: des ni ldan pa dang bcas pa'i 'brel ba can mngon sum par gyur pa yin par 'dod pa'i phyir ro//
analyzed: des ni ldan pa dang bcas pa'i 'brel ba can mngon sum par gyur pa yin par 'dod pa'i phyir ro//
translated: Because it is accepted that the possessor is related to the perceptible.

original: de ltar khas len pa la brjod pa /
analyzed: de ltar khas len pa la brjod pa /
translated: To one who accepts that, it is said:

original: ldan pa rjes dpag gis rtags min /
analyzed: ldan pa rjes dpag gis rtags min /
translated: The possessor is not a reason for inference.

original: ldan pa ni me dang du ba dag rjes su dpog pa ma yin te /
analyzed: ldan pa ni me dang du ba dag rjes su dpog pa ma yin te /
translated: The possessor is not inferred in the case of fire and smoke,

original: gnyis ka'i rgyur khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnyis ka'i rgyur khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no difference in the cause of both.

original: rnam pa thams cad nas go bar 'gyur ro zhes brjod zin to //üîΩldan pa can ni rang ngo bos //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad nas go bar 'gyur ro zhes brjod zin to // ldan pa can ni rang ngo bos //
translated: It has already been said that everything is understood.

original: khong du chud par byed ma yin ;
analyzed: khong du chud par byed ma yin ;
translated: The possessor is not understood by itself.

original: /'brel pa can gyi rang gi ngo bos ni rjes su dpag pa la 'ga' zhig tu yang phan mi 'dogs so //
analyzed: /'brel pa can gyi rang gi ngo bos ni rjes su dpag pa la 'ga' zhig tu yang phan mi 'dogs so //
translated: Nor does the intrinsic nature of the related object ever help in inference.

original: gzhan min mngon sum yang ma yin //
analyzed: gzhan min mngon sum yang ma yin //
translated: Nor is it perception of something else.

original: ji ltar rtogs pa des rjes su dpag pa la phan mi 'dogs pa de bzhin du mngon sum la yang ngo zhes sngar brjod zin to //
analyzed: ji ltar rtogs pa des rjes su dpag pa la phan mi 'dogs pa de bzhin du mngon sum la yang ngo zhes sngar brjod zin to //
translated: Just as it does not help in inference, so too it does not help in perception, as was previously explained.

original: rjes su dpag pa @40a * //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa @40a * //
translated: Inference

original: dang rjes su bstan pa dang nye bar gzhal ba rnams la ni 'dir dgag pa brjod par mi bya ste /
analyzed: dang rjes su bstan pa dang nye bar gzhal ba rnams la ni 'dir dgag pa brjod par mi bya ste /
translated: and teaching and evaluation are not to be refuted here.

original: gang gi phyir /üîΩgang du phyir /
analyzed: gang gi phyir / gang du phyir /
translated: Because

original: gang du rjes dpag la sogs 'di //
analyzed: gang du rjes dpag la sogs 'di //
translated: where inference, etc.

original: bkag pa de bzhin de yang bkag /'dir rang gi 'dod pa rjes su dpag pa la sogs pa cung zad kyang bsgrubs pa med do//
analyzed: bkag pa de bzhin de yang bkag /'dir rang gi 'dod pa rjes su dpag pa la sogs pa cung zad kyang bsgrubs pa med do//
translated: are refuted, so too is that. Here, inference, etc., are not established in the least according to our own assertions.

original: 'brel ba gzhan ma bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'brel ba gzhan ma bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because no other relation is taught.

original: 'dir cung zad brjod pa ni bye brag pa'i 'dod pa kha cig las so //
analyzed: 'dir cung zad brjod pa ni bye brag pa'i 'dod pa kha cig las so //
translated: Here, a little is stated from the assertions of some Vai≈õe·π£ikas.

original: des na de bkag pa bzhin du 'di yang bkag par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: des na de bkag pa bzhin du 'di yang bkag par rig par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, just as that is refuted, so too this should be understood as refuted.

original: don gyi go ba gnyis ka la 'gag par brjod par bya ste /üîΩdon go rnams ni mtha' gcig tu //
analyzed: don gyi go ba gnyis ka la 'gag par brjod par bya ste / don go rnams ni mtha' gcig tu //
translated: The understanding of the meaning is said to be blocked in both cases.

original: nges pa dang mtha' gcig tu ma nges pa'o //
analyzed: nges pa dang mtha' gcig tu ma nges pa'o //
translated: The understanding of the meaning is either certain or uncertain.

original: de la gang mtha' gcig tu nges te /
analyzed: de la gang mtha' gcig tu nges te /
translated: The certain one is the valid cognition.

original: rjes dpag gang du mtha' gcig tu nges pa can gyi go pa ni dper na de 'tshod pa las snod dang rten la sogs pa'i don 'dzin pa lta bu ste /
analyzed: rjes dpag gang du mtha' gcig tu nges pa can gyi go pa ni dper na de 'tshod pa las snod dang rten la sogs pa'i don 'dzin pa lta bu ste /
translated: The understanding of the meaning that is certain in one way is, for example, the apprehension of the meaning of a pot, a support, etc., from the burning of that.

original: de ni 'tshod pa'i rtags nyid las khong du chud par byed pa'i phyir rjes su dpag pa las tha dad pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de ni 'tshod pa'i rtags nyid las khong du chud par byed pa'i phyir rjes su dpag pa las tha dad pa ma yin no //
translated: That is not different from inference because it is understood from the sign of burning itself.

original: cig shos brdzun /
analyzed: cig shos brdzun /
translated: The other is false.

original: mtha' gcig tu ma nges pa can nyid kyi don gyis go bas ni tshad ma nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: mtha' gcig tu ma nges pa can nyid kyi don gyis go bas ni tshad ma nyid ma yin te /
translated: The understanding of the meaning that is uncertain in one way is not valid cognition,

original: the tshom gyi rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: the tshom gyi rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the cause of doubt.

original: dper na rtsol ba las byung ba'i phyir mi rtag go zhes brjod pa las rtsol ba las ma byung ba'i phyir rtag ces pa ma nges pa yin pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na rtsol ba las byung ba'i phyir mi rtag go zhes brjod pa las rtsol ba las ma byung ba'i phyir rtag ces pa ma nges pa yin pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, when it is said, ‚ÄúIt is impermanent because it is produced by effort,‚Äù the statement ‚ÄúIt is permanent because it is not produced by effort‚Äù is uncertain.

original: gang 'di skad du nag pa khyim na med pa las phyi rol na yod par mtshon par byed pa ni dngos po med pa'i tshad ma nyid do zhes brjod pa de la /üîΩnag pa khyim na med pa las //
analyzed: gang 'di skad du nag pa khyim na med pa las phyi rol na yod par mtshon par byed pa ni dngos po med pa'i tshad ma nyid do zhes brjod pa de la / nag pa khyim na med pa las //
translated: Someone says this: ‚ÄúThe valid knowledge that is the non-existence of a thing is the indication that black is not in the house but is outside.‚ÄùüîΩBlack is not indicated as being outside

original: phyi na yod pa mtshon pa min //
analyzed: phyi na yod pa mtshon pa min //
translated: from the non-existence of black in the house.

original: khyim gyi sgra yi don las 'dir //
analyzed: khyim gyi sgra yi don las 'dir //
translated: Here, by the meaning of the term ‚Äúhouse,‚Äù

original: phyi na yod par rab tu rtogs //
analyzed: phyi na yod par rab tu rtogs //
translated: it is understood that black is outside.

original: nag pa khyim na med ces bya ba 'di la khyim gyi sgra'i sbyor ba nyid las nag pa phyi rol na yod par don gyis go ba yin gyi /
analyzed: nag pa khyim na med ces bya ba 'di la khyim gyi sgra'i sbyor ba nyid las nag pa phyi rol na yod par don gyis go ba yin gyi /
translated: In this statement, ‚ÄúBlack is not in the house,‚Äù by the mere application of the term ‚Äúhouse,‚Äù it is understood that black is outside.

original: med pa las ni ma yin no //
analyzed: med pa las ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not from the non-existence of black.

original: gal te khyim dang phyi rol gnyis ka na med na ni med do zhes bya btsam nyid brjod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te khyim dang phyi rol gnyis ka na med na ni med do zhes bya btsam nyid brjod par 'gyur ro //
translated: If black did not exist in either the house or outside, it would be said that it simply does not exist.

original: de'i phyi rol don gyi go ba nyid ni dngos po med pa'i tshad ma gzhan ma yin no /üîΩgnyen po'i phyogs ma grub pa las //
analyzed: de'i phyi rol don gyi go ba nyid ni dngos po med pa'i tshad ma gzhan ma yin no / gnyen po'i phyogs ma grub pa las //
translated: The mere understanding of the meaning of ‚Äúoutside‚Äù is not another valid knowledge that is the non-existence of a thing.üîΩThe non-establishment of the side of the antidote

original: phyogs grub pa ru brjod pa yin //
analyzed: phyogs grub pa ru brjod pa yin //
translated: is said to be the establishment of the side of the object of negation.

original: gang du grangs can pa rnams kyis gzhan gyi phyogs bkag nas rang gi phyogs bsgrub par 'dod pa thal bar 'gyur pa sel ba 'di yang sel ba yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: gang du grangs can pa rnams kyis gzhan gyi phyogs bkag nas rang gi phyogs bsgrub par 'dod pa thal bar 'gyur pa sel ba 'di yang sel ba yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: And wherever the SƒÅ·πÉkhyas wish to refute the position of others and establish their own position, this consequence is to be eliminated. This should be understood as elimination.

original: rang gi don gyi rjes su dpag pa nges par bstan to //
analyzed: rang gi don gyi rjes su dpag pa nges par bstan to //
translated: The ascertainment of inference for oneself has been taught.

original: @40b tshad ma kun las btus pa las rang gi don gyi rjes su dpag pa ste le'u gnyis pa'o /
analyzed: @40b tshad ma kun las btus pa las rang gi don gyi rjes su dpag pa ste le'u gnyis pa'o /
translated: This concludes inference for oneself, the second chapter of the Compendium of Valid Cognition.

original: // / gzhan don rjes su dpag pa ni //
analyzed: // / gzhan don rjes su dpag pa ni //
translated: Inference for the sake of others

original: rang gi mthong don rab gsal byed //
analyzed: rang gi mthong don rab gsal byed //
translated: is that which clearly reveals one's own seen meaning.

original: ji ltar rang gi tshul gsum pa'i rtags las rtags can gyi shes pa skyes pa de bzhin du gzhan la rtags can gyi shes pa bskyed par 'dod nas tshul gsum pa'i rtags brjod pa ni gzhan gyi don gyi rjes su dpag pa ste /
analyzed: ji ltar rang gi tshul gsum pa'i rtags las rtags can gyi shes pa skyes pa de bzhin du gzhan la rtags can gyi shes pa bskyed par 'dod nas tshul gsum pa'i rtags brjod pa ni gzhan gyi don gyi rjes su dpag pa ste /
translated: Just as the cognition of the characterized object arises from one's own trimodal evidence, in the same way, desiring to generate the cognition of the characterized object in others, one states the trimodal evidence. This is inference for the sake of others,

original: rgyu las 'bras bu brtags pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu las 'bras bu brtags pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the effect is inferred from the cause.

original: 'dir yang tshul gang yang rung ba cig ma smras na yang ma tshang ba brjod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dir yang tshul gang yang rung ba cig ma smras na yang ma tshang ba brjod par 'gyur ro //
translated: If we do not state any of these modes, then we will be accused of having a defective syllogism.

original: gal te rjes su dpag par bya ba ston pa ni //
analyzed: gal te rjes su dpag par bya ba ston pa ni //
translated: If you are going to prove the object to be inferred,

original: dam bca' ba bya ste /
analyzed: dam bca' ba bya ste /
translated: then you must state a proposition.

original: rtog ge'i bstan bcos rnams su gzhan gyi don gyi rjes su dpag pa /
analyzed: rtog ge'i bstan bcos rnams su gzhan gyi don gyi rjes su dpag pa /
translated: In the treatises on logic, the proof of an object for the sake of anotherüîΩis called an inference.

original: dgod pa de ji ltar yin zhe na /
analyzed: dgod pa de ji ltar yin zhe na /
translated: How is that done?

original: de nyid dri bar bya'o //
analyzed: de nyid dri bar bya'o //
translated: You should ask them.

original: kho bo cag ni /
analyzed: kho bo cag ni /
translated: We maintain that

original: de la dpag bya bstan pa ni //
analyzed: de la dpag bya bstan pa ni //
translated: the object to be inferred is taught

original: rtags kyi don gyi yul du 'dod //
analyzed: rtags kyi don gyi yul du 'dod //
translated: as the referent of the reason.

original: yan lag rnams nas gang rjes su dpag par bya ba bstan pa de ni kho bo cag gi sgrub byed nyid du mi 'dod de //
analyzed: yan lag rnams nas gang rjes su dpag par bya ba bstan pa de ni kho bo cag gi sgrub byed nyid du mi 'dod de //
translated: We do not maintain that the object to be inferred, which is taught among the members of a syllogism, is the probandum.

original: de nyid the tshom skyed par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de nyid the tshom skyed par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: That is because it gives rise to doubt.

original: 'on kyang rtags kyi don du yul bstan pa'i phyir de ni des bsgrub par bya'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang rtags kyi don du yul bstan pa'i phyir de ni des bsgrub par bya'o //
translated: However, in order to teach the referent of the reason, it is established by that.üîΩMoreover,

original: de yang / rang gi ngo bo dang nyid ldan //üîΩrang dang 'dod 'gyur /
analyzed: de yang / rang gi ngo bo dang nyid ldan //üîΩrang dang 'dod 'gyur /
translated: it is endowed with its own natureüîΩand is accepted by both parties.

original: rang gi ngo bo kho na zhes bya ba ni bsgrub par bya ba'i ngo bo yin gyi grub pa las sgrub pa'i ngo bos ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo kho na zhes bya ba ni bsgrub par bya ba'i ngo bo yin gyi grub pa las sgrub pa'i ngo bos ni ma yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúOnly its own nature‚Äù means the nature of the probandum, not the nature of the proof.

original: de bzhin du rtags ma grub pa dang / dpe ltar snang ba dag kyang yongs su spangs par brjod pa ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du rtags ma grub pa dang / dpe ltar snang ba dag kyang yongs su spangs par brjod pa ste /
translated: Similarly, the author has also avoided the use of unestablished reasons and fallacious examples.

original: de dag sgrub par 'os pa'i ngo bor brjod par mi bya'o //
analyzed: de dag sgrub par 'os pa'i ngo bor brjod par mi bya'o //
translated: He does not use terms that are not suitable for proof.

original: rang dang 'dod 'gyur zhes smos pa 'dis ni rang gi bstan bcos la ltos nas khas blangs par bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: rang dang 'dod 'gyur zhes smos pa 'dis ni rang gi bstan bcos la ltos nas khas blangs par bstan pa yin no //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúwhat is accepted by ourselves‚Äù indicates that the author‚Äôs position is based on his own treatise.

original: de yang ma bsal ba'o //
analyzed: de yang ma bsal ba'o //
translated: This is also not refuted.

original: mngon sum don dang rjes dpag dang // yid ches grags pas rang rten la'o //
analyzed: mngon sum don dang rjes dpag dang // yid ches grags pas rang rten la'o //
translated: Direct perception, inference, testimony, and analogy are the means of valid cognition for everyone.

original: gang sgrub par 'dod pa'i chos kyi khyad par du byas pa'i chos can de la bsgrub par bya ba'i chos dang 'gal ba'i mngon sum dang / rjes su dpag pa dang / lung dang / grags pa rnams te /
analyzed: gang sgrub par 'dod pa'i chos kyi khyad par du byas pa'i chos can de la bsgrub par bya ba'i chos dang 'gal ba'i mngon sum dang / rjes su dpag pa dang / lung dang / grags pa rnams te /
translated: The subject, which is qualified by the specific property that is to be proven, is examined by means of direct perception, inference, testimony, and analogy that are in contradiction with the property to be proven.

original: chos gzhan gyis ma bsal ba'o //
analyzed: chos gzhan gyis ma bsal ba'o //
translated: These means of valid cognition are not refuted by other means of valid cognition.

original: de ltar na bsgrub par bya ba kha na ma tho ba med par bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na bsgrub par bya ba kha na ma tho ba med par bstan pa yin no //
translated: Thus, the thesis is shown to be free from fault.

original: de lta ma yin na ni de ltar snang ba ste /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na ni de ltar snang ba ste /
translated: Otherwise, it would be like this:

original: dper na sgra mnyan du mi rung ngo //
analyzed: dper na sgra mnyan du mi rung ngo //
translated: Sound is not to be heard.

original: bum pa rtag go //
analyzed: bum pa rtag go //
translated: A pot is permanent.

original: tshad mas gzhal bar bya ba'i don sgrub par mi byed do zhes pa lta bu dam bca' ba tsam dang 'gal ba dang / gang yang thun mong @41a * //
analyzed: tshad mas gzhal bar bya ba'i don sgrub par mi byed do zhes pa lta bu dam bca' ba tsam dang 'gal ba dang / gang yang thun mong @41a * //
translated: A thesis that is merely a contradiction is, for example, ‚ÄúThe object to be evaluated is not established by valid cognition.‚Äù

original: ma yin pa'i phyir rjes su dpag pa ni yod pa ma yin zhing sgrar grags pa dang 'gal ba'i don sbyor ba ni ri bong can ni zla ba ma yin te yod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba lta bu ste /
analyzed: ma yin pa'i phyir rjes su dpag pa ni yod pa ma yin zhing sgrar grags pa dang 'gal ba'i don sbyor ba ni ri bong can ni zla ba ma yin te yod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba lta bu ste /
translated: A thesis that is contradictory to commonly accepted usage is, for example, ‚ÄúThe rabbit-bearer is not the moon because it exists.‚Äù

original: de dag gis ni chos kyi rang gi ngo bo bsal ba'i sgo tsam cig bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de dag gis ni chos kyi rang gi ngo bo bsal ba'i sgo tsam cig bstan pa yin no //
translated: These show only a mere indication of the elimination of the intrinsic nature of phenomena.

original: phyogs 'dis ni chos dang chos can gyi bye brag gi rang gi ngo bo bsal ba yang mtshon par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: phyogs 'dis ni chos dang chos can gyi bye brag gi rang gi ngo bo bsal ba yang mtshon par rig par bya ste /
translated: By this approach, one should understand the indication of the elimination of the intrinsic nature of the distinction between the property and the subject.

original: 'di ltar dper na yan lag can ni yan lag las gzhan ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar dper na yan lag can ni yan lag las gzhan ma yin te /
translated: For example, the whole is not different from the parts,

original: srang mtho dman gyi bye brag ma bzung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: srang mtho dman gyi bye brag ma bzung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because the difference of the scale‚Äôs high and low points is not apprehended.

original: yan lag dang yan lag can dag ni gzhan ma yin te /
analyzed: yan lag dang yan lag can dag ni gzhan ma yin te /
translated: The parts and the whole are not identical,

original: mngon sum ma yin par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mngon sum ma yin par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would follow, absurdly, that they are not directly perceived.

original: rdzas ni yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rdzas ni yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Substance does not exist,

original: yon tan gyi rdzas rnams kyi rdzas rdzas ma yin par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yon tan gyi rdzas rnams kyi rdzas rdzas ma yin par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would follow, absurdly, that the substances of the qualities are not substances.

original: gnyis ka'i rang gi ngo bo'i bye brag ni /
analyzed: gnyis ka'i rang gi ngo bo'i bye brag ni /
translated: The difference between the natures of the two

original: dper na smra ba'i don thams cad brdzun no zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na smra ba'i don thams cad brdzun no zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
translated: is like saying, ‚ÄúAll speech is false.‚Äù

original: smra ba yod mod kyis kyang smras pa dang smra ba'i bdag nyid brdzun pa nyid du 'gyur ba'i lta na ni de'i smra ba'i bdag nyid dang yang brdzun pa nyid gnyis ka rnam pa thams cad du bsal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: smra ba yod mod kyis kyang smras pa dang smra ba'i bdag nyid brdzun pa nyid du 'gyur ba'i lta na ni de'i smra ba'i bdag nyid dang yang brdzun pa nyid gnyis ka rnam pa thams cad du bsal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Even if speech exists, it would follow, absurdly, that the nature of speech and the speaker are false, and in that case, both the nature of speech and the speaker would be completely eliminated.

original: de lta bu ni gnyis ka'i rang gi ngo bo bsal to //
analyzed: de lta bu ni gnyis ka'i rang gi ngo bo bsal to //
translated: Thus the natures of both are eliminated.

original: ci ste smra ba'i bdag nyid kyi brdzun pa nyid bsal ba ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: ci ste smra ba'i bdag nyid kyi brdzun pa nyid bsal ba ma yin no zhe na /
translated: But if you say that the falsity of the speaker is not refuted,

original: de lta na ni gnyis ka'i bye brag bsal ba yin no //
analyzed: de lta na ni gnyis ka'i bye brag bsal ba yin no //
translated: then you have refuted the distinction between the two.

original: rigs pa can rnams na re /
analyzed: rigs pa can rnams na re /
translated: The NaiyƒÅyikas say:

original: bsgrub bya ston zhes pa 'di la /
analyzed: bsgrub bya ston zhes pa 'di la /
translated: ‚ÄúThe statement of the probandum

original: grub pa med par don gyis byas //
analyzed: grub pa med par don gyis byas //
translated: is not established by the meaning.

original: bsgrub bya smos pas ni grub pa log pa tsam du bstan pa'i phyir bsgrub bya'i bye brag nyid ni ma yin par gnas so //
analyzed: bsgrub bya smos pas ni grub pa log pa tsam du bstan pa'i phyir bsgrub bya'i bye brag nyid ni ma yin par gnas so //
translated: Since the probandum is mentioned, the distinction of the probandum is not established merely by the negation of the established.

original: de lta na ni rtags dang dpe //
analyzed: de lta na ni rtags dang dpe //
translated: In that case, the reason and example

original: ma grub pa yang bsgrub byar 'gyur //
analyzed: ma grub pa yang bsgrub byar 'gyur //
translated: would also be unestablished probandums.

original: dper na sgra rtag ste /
analyzed: dper na sgra rtag ste /
translated: For example, sound is permanent

original: reg par bya ba yin pa'i phyir blo bzhin no zhes bya ba dang / de bzhin du mig gis gzung bya yin pa'i phyir mi rtag ces bya ba 'di yang bsgrub bya bstan pa'i phyir dam bca' bar thal bar 'gyur ro //üîΩ'di la yang ci chos bsgrub bya yin nam /
analyzed: reg par bya ba yin pa'i phyir blo bzhin no zhes bya ba dang / de bzhin du mig gis gzung bya yin pa'i phyir mi rtag ces bya ba 'di yang bsgrub bya bstan pa'i phyir dam bca' bar thal bar 'gyur ro // 'di la yang ci chos bsgrub bya yin nam /
translated: because it is tangible, like the intellect, and likewise, because it is apprehended by the eye, it is impermanent. This also would be a thesis because the probandum is stated.üîΩHere, is the property to be established or

original: ci ste chos can yin nam /
analyzed: ci ste chos can yin nam /
translated: is it the subject?

original: de ste gnyis ka yin zhes brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de ste gnyis ka yin zhes brjod par bya'o //
translated: If you say that it is both,

original: de las cir 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: de las cir 'gyur zhe na /
translated: then what follows from that?

original: bsgrub bya chos yin chos mthun med //üîΩgal te chos can mi rtag pa nyid tsam bsgrub bya yin pa lta na bsgrub bya'i chos kyi mthun zhes ni sbyar du mi btub ste /
analyzed: bsgrub bya chos yin chos mthun med // gal te chos can mi rtag pa nyid tsam bsgrub bya yin pa lta na bsgrub bya'i chos kyi mthun zhes ni sbyar du mi btub ste /
translated: The predicate is the property; there is no similarity of property.

original: mi rtag pa nyid kyi chos mthun pa'i dngos po can gyi dpe med pa'i phyir ro /
analyzed: mi rtag pa nyid kyi chos mthun pa'i dngos po can gyi dpe med pa'i phyir ro /
translated: If the mere impermanence of the subject is the predicate, then it is not possible to apply the expression ‚Äúsimilarity of property‚Äù because there is no example that has the property of similarity to the property of impermanence.

original: @41b chos can bsgrub bya'i rtags don med //
analyzed: @41b chos can bsgrub bya'i rtags don med //
translated: If the subject is the predicate, the reason is pointless.

original: chos can bsgrub bya yin pa lta na ni sgra ni grub pa yin pa'i phyir bsgrub bya sgrub pa'i gtan tshigs dgod par mi bya'o //
analyzed: chos can bsgrub bya yin pa lta na ni sgra ni grub pa yin pa'i phyir bsgrub bya sgrub pa'i gtan tshigs dgod par mi bya'o //
translated: If the subject is the predicate, then because sound is established, a reason proving it should not be stated.

original: gal te gnyis ka yin na ni skyon yang gnyis ka'o //üîΩ'di la yang bsgrub bya bstan pa nyid dam bca' ba'o zhes nges pa gong du sbyor ba'am /
analyzed: gal te gnyis ka yin na ni skyon yang gnyis ka'o // 'di la yang bsgrub bya bstan pa nyid dam bca' ba'o zhes nges pa gong du sbyor ba'am /
translated: If you say that it is both, then there are two faults.üîΩHere, if you apply the above syllogism, ‚ÄúThe statement of the predicate is the thesis,‚Äù then it is not correct.

original: bsgrub bya bstan pa dam bca' ba nyid do zhes ngas par bzung bar 'og tu sbyor grang /
analyzed: bsgrub bya bstan pa dam bca' ba nyid do zhes ngas par bzung bar 'og tu sbyor grang /
translated: If you apply the below syllogism, ‚ÄúThe statement of the predicate is the thesis,‚Äù then it is not correct.

original: de las cir 'gyur /
analyzed: de las cir 'gyur /
translated: What is the consequence of that?

original: gong du ngos bzung don med 'gyur //
analyzed: gong du ngos bzung don med 'gyur //
translated: If the demonstrative is connected to the first, it is meaningless.

original: cig shos ltar na 'dod mi 'gyur //
analyzed: cig shos ltar na 'dod mi 'gyur //
translated: If it is connected to the second, it is not acceptable.

original: gal te bsgrub bya bstan pa nyid do zhes nges bzung gong du sbyor na ni sgrub byed du bstan pa'i rtags la sogs pa 'phangs zin pa'i phyir gong du nges bzung byas pa las don med do //
analyzed: gal te bsgrub bya bstan pa nyid do zhes nges bzung gong du sbyor na ni sgrub byed du bstan pa'i rtags la sogs pa 'phangs zin pa'i phyir gong du nges bzung byas pa las don med do //
translated: If the demonstrative is connected to the first, the statement of the probandum, then, since the statement of the reason, etc. , which is the proof, has already been stated, it is meaningless to connect the demonstrative to the first.

original: ci ste ba sgrub bya bsten pa dam bca' ba nyid do zhes nges bzung 'og tu sbyor na ni rtags kyi dper brjod pa'i don du bstan pa yang dam bca' bar 'gyur ba'i phyir dam bca' ba rigs pa dang mi ldan no //
analyzed: ci ste ba sgrub bya bsten pa dam bca' ba nyid do zhes nges bzung 'og tu sbyor na ni rtags kyi dper brjod pa'i don du bstan pa yang dam bca' bar 'gyur ba'i phyir dam bca' ba rigs pa dang mi ldan no //
translated: If the demonstrative is connected to the second, the statement of the proof, then, since the statement of the example, which is the illustration of the reason, would also be a thesis, the thesis would not be consistent with reason.

original: de bzhin bsgrub bya brjod pa la'ang //üîΩde bzhin te rigs pa can rnams la skyon brjod pa de bzhin du rtsod pa sgrub pa la yang /
analyzed: de bzhin bsgrub bya brjod pa la'ang // de bzhin te rigs pa can rnams la skyon brjod pa de bzhin du rtsod pa sgrub pa la yang /
translated: Similarly, in the statement of the probandum.

original: rtags bsgrub par bya ba dang / dpe ltar snang ba brjod par yang dam bca' bar thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rtags bsgrub par bya ba dang / dpe ltar snang ba brjod par yang dam bca' bar thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Similarly, in the statement of the probandum, the statement of the reason, and the statement of the example, the same error would occur.

original: gal te de ni yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gal te de ni yod pa ma yin te /
translated: If it does not exist,

original: de la ni /
analyzed: de la ni /
translated: then

original: phyogs lhag phyir na srid ma yin //
analyzed: phyogs lhag phyir na srid ma yin //
translated: it is not possible because of the remainder of the position.

original: rtsod pa bsgrub pa ni bsgrub byar brjod pa tsam dam bcar 'gyur ba ma yin gyi 'di ltar phyogs bsgrub bya yin no //
analyzed: rtsod pa bsgrub pa ni bsgrub byar brjod pa tsam dam bcar 'gyur ba ma yin gyi 'di ltar phyogs bsgrub bya yin no //
translated: The proof of a dispute is not just the statement of the probandum, but rather the position is the probandum.

original: phyogs de ci zhig rnam par dpyad pa'i 'dod pa don te /
analyzed: phyogs de ci zhig rnam par dpyad pa'i 'dod pa don te /
translated: The position is the object of the desire to analyze.üîΩIf the probandum is just the mere statement of the probandum, then the statement of the reason‚Äôs nonestablishment and so on would also be a thesis.

original: de phyogs yin pas bsgrub bya tsam de rtags ma grub pa la sogs par brjod pa yang dam bca' bar 'gyur ro zhes pa'i skyon ni med do zhe na skyon ji ltar na med de de la yang /
analyzed: de phyogs yin pas bsgrub bya tsam de rtags ma grub pa la sogs par brjod pa yang dam bca' bar 'gyur ro zhes pa'i skyon ni med do zhe na skyon ji ltar na med de de la yang /
translated: How could the fault not exist?

original: rnam par dpyad pa'i 'dod pa 'di //üîΩmi 'dod pa las log pa tsam //
analyzed: rnam par dpyad pa'i 'dod pa 'di // mi 'dod pa las log pa tsam //
translated: This desire to analyzeüîΩis merely the opposite of what is not desired.

original: de ni mi 'dod pa log pa tsam yin par bas so //
analyzed: de ni mi 'dod pa log pa tsam yin par bas so //
translated: It is merely the opposite of what is not desired.

original: des na ji ltar bsgrub bya'i bye brag go bar byed /
analyzed: des na ji ltar bsgrub bya'i bye brag go bar byed /
translated: Therefore, how does it make one understand the distinction of the probandum?

original: rnam par dpyad pa'i 'dod pa ni 'di rtags yin nam ma yin zhes ming gi gzung bya la yang dpyad par nus pa'i phyir de yang dam bca' bar brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: rnam par dpyad pa'i 'dod pa ni 'di rtags yin nam ma yin zhes ming gi gzung bya la yang dpyad par nus pa'i phyir de yang dam bca' bar brjod pa yin no //
translated: The thesis is also the assertion of a reason, because it is possible to analyze the object designated by the name, asking whether it is a reason or not.

original: bsgrub bya gzugs brnyan dang bcas pa bstan to //
analyzed: bsgrub bya gzugs brnyan dang bcas pa bstan to //
translated: The thesis is taught along with an example.

original: rigs pa can rnams na re dam bca' ba gtan tshigs dang 'gal ba dang dam bca' dang 'gal ba zhes bya ba de dag dam bca' ba'i skyon yin te /
analyzed: rigs pa can rnams na re dam bca' ba gtan tshigs dang 'gal ba dang dam bca' dang 'gal ba zhes bya ba de dag dam bca' ba'i skyon yin te /
translated: The NaiyƒÅyikas say: The faults of a thesis are contradiction with a reason and contradiction with a thesis.

original: dper na sgra rtag pa @42a * //
analyzed: dper na sgra rtag pa @42a * //
translated: For example, the thesis ‚ÄúSound is permanent‚Äù

original: de thams cad mi rtag pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba lta bu'o zhes zer ro //üîΩdam bca' gtan tshigs dang 'gal ba //
analyzed: de thams cad mi rtag pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba lta bu'o zhes zer ro // dam bca' gtan tshigs dang 'gal ba //
translated: is contradicted by the reason ‚Äúbecause it is impermanent.‚ÄùüîΩIt is not logical to say that contradiction with a reason

original: dam bca'i skyon zhes rigs pa min //
analyzed: dam bca'i skyon zhes rigs pa min //
translated: is a fault of a thesis.

original: 'dir ni dam bca' ba dang gtan tshigs su 'gal lo zhes pa gnyis ka rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'dir ni dam bca' ba dang gtan tshigs su 'gal lo zhes pa gnyis ka rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: Here it is not logical to say that both the thesis and the reason are contradictory.

original: ji ltar zhe na /üîΩlegs par ma bslabs pa rnams kyis //
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na / legs par ma bslabs pa rnams kyis //
translated: How is that?üîΩThe unlearned say

original: de ni chos mi mthun dpes brjod //
analyzed: de ni chos mi mthun dpes brjod //
translated: that is expressed by an example of dissimilar type.

original: gang gtan tshigs kyi sbyor ba 'di dam bca' ba dang 'gal bar brjod pa ni rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gang gtan tshigs kyi sbyor ba 'di dam bca' ba dang 'gal bar brjod pa ni rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not right to say that this syllogistic argument contradicts the thesis,

original: 'di ltar chos mi mthun pa'i dpe'i sbyor ba nyid kyis yin pas na'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar chos mi mthun pa'i dpe'i sbyor ba nyid kyis yin pas na'o //
translated: because it is a syllogistic argument with an example of a dissimilar instance.

original: der ni 'di ltar sbyor ba byas nas mdzes par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: der ni 'di ltar sbyor ba byas nas mdzes par 'gyur ro //
translated: It is only when the syllogism is formulated in this way that it is elegant.

original: sgra rtag ste thams cad mi rtag pa'i phyir zhes pa ni thams cad ma yin pas med pa'i phyir zhes don no //
analyzed: sgra rtag ste thams cad mi rtag pa'i phyir zhes pa ni thams cad ma yin pas med pa'i phyir zhes don no //
translated: The thesis is that sound is permanent, and the reason is that it is not all things. The meaning of the reason is that it is not all things, because it is not impermanent.

original: de lta na ni chos mi mthun pa'i dpes bsgrub bya med pa las gtan tshigs med par bstan pa yin no //üîΩrtag nyer 'jal gyis 'dir bsgrub bya //üîΩma yin / nye bar 'jal bas ni 'dir sgra la thams cad ces bya bas thams cad ces bya bas thams cad ma yin pa nyid rtags su brjod pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta na ni chos mi mthun pa'i dpes bsgrub bya med pa las gtan tshigs med par bstan pa yin no // rtag nyer 'jal gyis 'dir bsgrub bya // ma yin / nye bar 'jal bas ni 'dir sgra la thams cad ces bya bas thams cad ces bya bas thams cad ma yin pa nyid rtags su brjod pa ni ma yin no //
translated: In this way, the example of a dissimilar instance shows that the reason is absent when the property to be proven is absent.üîΩThe property to be proven is not established by the example.üîΩThe example does not establish that sound is permanent, because the example does not express the reason.

original: de ni ma grub pa ste thams cad kyi khongs su sgra yang 'dus pa'i phyir ram //
analyzed: de ni ma grub pa ste thams cad kyi khongs su sgra yang 'dus pa'i phyir ram //
translated: The reason is not established, because sound is included in all things.

original: dam bca' ba'i phyogs gcig yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dam bca' ba'i phyogs gcig yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is one part of the thesis.

original: gal te thams cad mi rtag ces pa la thams cad kyi sgras sgra dang bcas ste brjod na ni de ltar na thams cad kyi khongs su sgra yang 'dus pa'i phyir thams cad ma yin pa nyid ni med do //
analyzed: gal te thams cad mi rtag ces pa la thams cad kyi sgras sgra dang bcas ste brjod na ni de ltar na thams cad kyi khongs su sgra yang 'dus pa'i phyir thams cad ma yin pa nyid ni med do //
translated: If the word ‚Äúall‚Äù in the statement ‚Äúall is impermanent‚Äù includes sound, then since sound is included in ‚Äúall,‚Äù there is no ‚Äúall‚Äù that is not sound.

original: ji ltar med de /
analyzed: ji ltar med de /
translated: How is there no such all?

original: gang gi tshe 'di phyogs gcig yin pa'i phyir thams cad ma yin pa'o zhe na /
analyzed: gang gi tshe 'di phyogs gcig yin pa'i phyir thams cad ma yin pa'o zhe na /
translated: If you say ‚Äúall‚Äù is not all because it is one part,

original: de lta na ni gzhan la yang phyogs gcig yin pa nyid do //
analyzed: de lta na ni gzhan la yang phyogs gcig yin pa nyid do //
translated: then the same is true of the other.

original: thams cad ma yin pas so //
analyzed: thams cad ma yin pas so //
translated: It is not all because it is one part.

original: de lta na ni thams cad ma yin pa mi 'dod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta na ni thams cad ma yin pa mi 'dod par 'gyur ro //
translated: If that is so, you would not accept that it is not all.

original: ci ste de lta na yang dam bca' ba'i skyon nyid du 'gyur te /
analyzed: ci ste de lta na yang dam bca' ba'i skyon nyid du 'gyur te /
translated: But even if that is so, the thesis is still faulty.

original: mi rtag pa nyid kyis rtag pa nyid bsal ba'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: mi rtag pa nyid kyis rtag pa nyid bsal ba'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Because impermanence excludes permanence.

original: sgra la yod pa nyid sel bar 'gyur ba ni ma yin pa'i phyir sgra la yod par brjod pa yin pas ni chos mi mthun pa'i dpe'i sbyor ba nyid du sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: sgra la yod pa nyid sel bar 'gyur ba ni ma yin pa'i phyir sgra la yod par brjod pa yin pas ni chos mi mthun pa'i dpe'i sbyor ba nyid du sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: Because it does not eliminate the existence of sound, the statement ‚Äúsound exists‚Äù should be applied as the application of an example dissimilar to the probandum.

original: ci ste sgra dang bral ba thams cad de sgra nyid thams cad ma yin pa'o zhe na /
analyzed: ci ste sgra dang bral ba thams cad de sgra nyid thams cad ma yin pa'o zhe na /
translated: But if you say, ‚ÄúAll that is devoid of sound is not sound,‚Äù

original: de yang dam bca' ba'i don gyi phyogs gcig yin pa'i phyir ma grub pa ste /
analyzed: de yang dam bca' ba'i don gyi phyogs gcig yin pa'i phyir ma grub pa ste /
